loans.use: Purchase more well-known, name brand appliances  in order to increase her income and to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, despite being in the last stages of her beautiful pregnancy, she continues to work in order to provide a meal to her family. Selling fruits at the market isn’t too difficult since her mother is along side her to assist and make light of the work. Nonetheless, her biggest fear is when she finally gives birth no one will be there to purchase her fruit supply or take care of her children since her husband is working at his job in the city of Lima. The reason why Martha is requesting a loan is so she can purchase a large variety of fruits for her stand and not have to depend on her dear mother, who will be selling them, to also have to make the purchase. She will also be taking care of her grandchildren while her daughter is with the newborn. We hope for your collaboration in making this fruit stand the best market for Martha’s satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha a pesar de estar en la dulce espera y en los últimos meses de su período de embarazo sigue trabajando para llevar un plato de comida a su hogar. Oferta frutas en el mercado y no le es dificultoso, puesto que en compañía de su madre le es liviano el trabajo.Sin embargo su mayor preocupación es cuando llegue el momento del parto y no tenga quien se haga cargo de la compra de su mercadería de frutas y de sus hijos, debido a que su ayuda idónea es decir su querido esposo radica en la ciudad de Lima debido a que su trabajo se encuentra en esta ciudad.Este es el motivo por la cual Martha solicita una suma de dinero en calidad de préstamo a fin de invertido en la compra de frutas para surtir su puesto de ventas y dejárselo sin ningún pendiente a su querida madre, quien se ocuparía en venderlos, además de velar por el bienestar de sus nietos durante la ausencia de su hija.Esperamos vuestra colaboración a fin de hacer de este puesto de ventas el mejor del mercado para satisfacción de Martha..

loans.use: Purchase more fruits.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es: Doña Leoncia is dedicated to selling fruit, which she does in many areas and in the local market in her city, where she has been able to get a small space. She sells fruit from the central jungle region.  She has always worked in a dedicated and hard way, however despite her efforts, she has not been able to attain her higher goal of buying a small house where she could live safely and calmly.  She is asking for assistance in order to grow her business and increase the quantity of products offered to the public, in order to eventually get enough savings to buy a house.  Don't forget that you can do a lot to help this woman!

loans.use: Increased capital to be able to increase the quantity of fruit offered and therefore increase sales.

loans.name: Delina

texts.es: Mrs. Delina happily works in her orange and fruit orchard, accompanies by her young daughters who help her along with their smiles.  She works alongside her young in order to be able to look after them, as in past times, she worked far away and was not able to tend to them if there was sickness or accidents. She wants to increase the production of her products to increase income and help her children. For this reason, the is asking for a loan to put her small project into action alongside her young associates.

loans.use: Improve the quality and quantity of her products to increase sales and benefit her sons

loans.name: Lily's Group

texts.en:
Yorina, Maribel, and Lily are members of the community bank Musuq Wasi, which means "new house" in Quechua. They live in the Santo Domingo neighborhood and belong to the Jesus Nazareno district within the city of Ayacucho. In their community bank they have learned to be punctual and responsible, to save, how to educate their children, and about good nutrition.

Yorina is 22 years old. She has run a small grocery store for the past three years; little by little she has been able to add more products. On the other hand Maribel is 27. She is married and has four children. Maribel raises guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy. In addition she grows carrots, spinach, and lettuce, which she sells in Ayacucho. She started raising cuy six months ago and now sells them to different restaurants in the region. Lily is 28 years old and lives with her partner and two children. Lily also grows vegetables and raises cuys. She started raising cuys one year ago with only three and now has 180 which she sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Yorina, Maribel, and Lily need loans of 600, 750, and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying sugar, rice, cookies, chocolate, candies, medicines, seeds, fertilizer, and food for the cuys. They plan to use their savings to build a house and add capital to their business. Their dreams are to own a home, that their children receive good educations, and that their businesses continue to grow.

loans.use: Yorina, Maribel, and Lily need loans of 600, 750, and 300 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying sugar, rice, cookies, chocolate, candies, medicines, seeds, fertilizer, and food for the cuys.

loans.name: Cintia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Cintia Elizabeth C. H. is a native of the city of Bluefields, of African-Caribbean descent and is 44 years old. She is married to Mr. Armin Monroe, who is not currently working due to illness. They have a 4-year-old daughter and 2 sons, 18 and 19 years old, who are studying at university and whose tuition is paid with income from the sale of baked goods and coconut bread. She has more than 30 years of experience. Her potential customers are the students, office workers and other people who pass by, and who prefer her because she has a home-delivery service. Mrs. C. needs to buy 3 short hundredweights of flour at $32.00 per short hundredweight, 2 short hundredweights of sugar at $34.00 per short hundredweight, 2 cans of oil at $27.00 each, 10 pounds of butter at $1.00 a pound, 2 boxes of lard at $16.00 each, and 8 bags of charcoal at $5.00 each. With this investment she will be able to meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Cintia Elizabeth C. H. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, descendiente afrocaribeña, tiene 44 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Armin Monroe que en estos no esta trabando por estar enfermo, ambos tienen 1 niña de 4 años de edad y 2 hijos de 18 y 19 años de edad que están cursando los estudios universitarios que son pagados con el ingreso de la venta de repostería y pan de coco, tiene mas de 30 años de experiencia, teniendo como clientes potenciales los estudiantes de los colegios, trabajadores de las oficinas y personan que transitan en las calles que la prefieren por brindar un servicio a domicilio. La Sra. C. necesita comprar 3 quintales de harina a $ 32.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 34.00 dólares el quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a $ 27.00 dólares cada bidón, 10 libras de mantequilla a $ 1.00 dólar la libra, 2 cajas de manteca a $ 16.00 dólares cada caja, 8 sacos de carbón a $ 5.00 dólares cada saco, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, oil, butter, lard and charcoal.

payments.comment: La cuota real  de pago es de $ 37.50 dólares.
El pago real es de $ 37.50 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 37.50 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 37.50 dólares

loans.name: Teofila's Group

texts.en:
Lorenza, Fortunata, and Teofila have been members of the community bank Señor D. Huanca for 4, 4, and 12 months. Teofila is currently the president of her bank.

Lorenza is 52 years old. She is married and has 11 children, 4 of whom live with her. Lorenza sells fruits at the different markets around the region. From the markets she buys grains, cheese, young animals, and other products which she sells in Ayacucho. On the other hand, Fortunata is 42 years old. She is a single mother and has one son. Fortunata has a grocery store in the small town of Rosaspata in the Vinchos district. Teofila is 40 years old. She is married and has seven children. For the past two years Teofila has sold vegetables in the Grau market of Ayacucho. Before that she traveled to different markets buying and selling products, but this business was not making a profit.

Lorenza, Fortunata, and Teofila need loans of 600, 400, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying beans, barley, cheese, onions, carrots, corn, chili pepper, lemon, sugar, rice and tuna, which is a local fruit that comes from a cactus.

In their community bank they have learned to be punctual and responsible, how to care about hygiene, and about good nutrition. Lorenza, Fortunata, and Teofila dream of building a house, having more capital for their businesses, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Lorenza, Fortunata, and Teofila need loans of 600, 400, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying beans, barley, cheese, onions, carrots, corn, chili pepper, lemon, sugar, rice and tuna, which is a local fruit that comes from a cactus.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Consuelo works day in day out the land that provides her and her family with their daily sustenance. She deeply cares for her potatoes, corn and alfalfa in order to guarantee a good harvest. Therefore, she leaves her home very early to care for her vegetables. She will start harvesting in April.

Every effort results in a reward, which is why Doña Consuelo is certain she will progress. She is always supported by her family which she deeply loves.

Her youngest son is still in school and even though her husband abandoned them, her hopes and wishes have not gone away. Consuelo is a very hardworking woman. She wishes to increment production by renting other pieces of land. Her strength is admirable in spite of last winter's mercilessness, which devastated her farming fields.

At the moment everything is going well and she will continue sowing. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase fertilizers, seeds and part of the land's rent. Let your heart, which is full of solidarity, help Doña Consuelo. she will know how to invest the money wisely.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Cosuelo trabaja día a día la tierra que le proporciona el sustento diario para ella y los suyos, con gran empeño cuida D. sus cultivos D. papa, maíz y alfalfa para asegurarse D. una buena cosecha, por esa razón abandona su hogar muy temprano para poder cuidar sus vegetales ya que en abril cosechará.Cada esfuerzo conlleva a una recompensa es por ello que Doña Consuelo espera progresar con ayuda D. su familia a la que tanto ama, el menor aún está en el colegio, y a pesar del abandono D. su esposo sus deseos y sueños no han desaparecido.Consuelo es muy trabajadora y desea acrecentar su producción alquilando los terrenos que le hacen falta para este fin, esa fortaleza es admirable pese a la pérdida del año pasado por la inclemencia del invierno que azotó sus campos D. cultivo. Por el momento todo está marchando bien y seguirá sembrando, para ello es que solicita un préstamo con el objetivo D. invertirlos en la compra D. abonos, semillas y parte del pago D. los terrenos, ayuda a Doña Consuelo con ese espíritu solidario que tienes, ella sabrá invertir sabiamente ese dinero.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is from Hualahoyo. Thanks to her dear parents' seeding skills she is very familiar with the agriculture work. Her loving mother gave her her farming fields three years ago and she's been working them ever since. She has two little children who, through her hard work and effort, receive wellbeing and safety so that they can develop without any inconvenient.

Maribel's wishes to improve the quality of her products drive her to request a loan to acquire fertilizers in order to obtain excellent products for this harvesting season. Make her request possible so that this hardworking mother can continue to develop her work with a lot of satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer .

Maribel es natural de Hualahoyo, gracias a la habilidad para sembrar de sus queridos padres conoce muy de cerca la labor agrícola.Su adorada madre le cedió sus campos de cultivo y por esta razón ella lleva desenvolviéndose con éxito en esta labor hace tres años. Tiene dos pequeños a quienes a través de su trabajo y esfuerzo diario otorga bienestar y seguridad para que puedan desenvolverse sin ningún inconveniente. Sus deseos de mejorar la calidad de sus productos la llevan a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir abonos y fertilizantes a fin de obtener excelentes productos en esta temporada de cosecha.Posibilitemos su solicitud para que esta trabajadora madre siga desarrollando su labor con mucha satisfacción.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is a very hardworking woman. She is always looking out for her family's development, needs and foreseeable economical falls. These virtues make her her family's main economical source. Her husband is one of the luckiest people for having her constant support. Year after year and inspite of the difficulties, she has successfully maintained her home thanks to her hard work and achievements.

Elena currently farms potatoes and corn. She also raises pigs to help her during shortage periods. Raising pigs helped her a lot when she lost all the investment she put into the fields two years ago, when the ruthless winter killed her farming fields.

Elena is requesting a loan to acquire fertilizers. Have solidarity with Elena because she is responsible and she will respond and return this credit which she will be able to get thanks to your support.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena, es muy esforzada y siempre está observando el desenvolvimiento de los suyos para conocer sus necesidades y también prevenir posibles caídas económicas, esa virtud la convierte en el principal sostén de su hogar y su esposo es uno de los señores más dichosos por tenerla a ella siempre apoyándolos. Año tras año a pesar de las dificultades a llevado con éxito las riendas de su hogar gracias a su laboriosidad y desempeño.Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de papa y maíz, además para tiempos de escasez cría cerditos, estos le han servido aún más cuando perdió totalmente lo invertido en sus campos de cultivo hace dos años después del inclemente invierno que azotó sus campos de cultivo. Solicita un préstamo para adquirir abono y fertilizante. Solidarízate con Elena porque es responsable y responderá a tiempo con la devolución del crédito al que accederá gracias a tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Elías

texts.es:
Elias is a young man who has a strong desire to live in a healthy and dedicated way. Since he was a younger kid he decided to work in agriculture. He shares his humble abode with his beloved parents, who, much to his fortune, stay by his side enjoying good health.

Elias also works as a truck driver in order to have some extra income for his parents' wellbeing, while he waits for the harvesting season. This season is the only time of year where he receives the revenue of all the hard work that agriculture presents year round. His desire to increment the quality and quantity of his products drive him to request a loan to purchase fertilizers for his vegetables. Please support the work of this youth that strives day to day to develop.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Elías, es un joven con muchas ganas de vivir de manera sana y dedicada, cultivando en sus años de juventud el trabajo esforzado y honrado, eligió dedicarse a las actividades agrícolas habita su humilde morada en compañía de sus queridos padres que para fortuna de él siguen a su lado gozando de muy buena salud.Para otorgarles bienestar también trabaja como chofer de camioneta para tener ingresos extra mientras espera el tiempo de la cosecha y es justo en esa época donde recién se perciben los frutos de todo un trabajo arduo que compromete varios meses.Sus deseos de incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos lo conducen a solicitar un préstamo para comprar abonos y fertlizantes para sus vegetales.Apoya a este valor de trabajo y juventud que se esfuerza día a día por su desarrollo.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl is 28 years old and provides public transportation to passengers. He lives with his wife in a house rented from his aunt. Raúl is also in charge of collecting the rent from the other rooms in the house, as his aunt lives in Cochabanba.

Raúl has worked for several years as a public transportation driver for the Green Line of the Warnes LTDA Transportation Drivers´ Cooperative, on the Warnes-Santa Cruz de la Sierra-Montero route, which is why he has plenty of experience in this line of work. The competition is average as there are other drivers and also taxis, but the line he works for is the one most in demand by passengers from the different zones, and for that reason there is never a lack of customers.

This loan request is to buy gasoline equipment for his car, but he should increase his investment since he also wants to acquire 4 wheel rims for his car at $80 each. This is the fourth loan that Raúl has with our institution, he pays all his credits in an excellent manner. He currently has one other loan with the Luis Cooperative.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Raúl es un señor de 28 años de edad que se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros, actualmente vive con su esposa en alquiler en casa de su tía. Raúl se encarga también de cobrar el alquiler de los otros cuartos ya que su tía vive en Cochabamba.

Raúl trabaja hace varios años como transportista público de pasajeros en la Línea Verde de la Cooperativa de Transportistas Warnes LTDA. ruta Warnes-Santa Cruz de la Sierra-Montero, por lo cual tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro. La competencia en de nivel medio ya que existen otros transportistas y también taxis, pero en la línea que trabaja es la más cotizada por los pasajeros de las diferentes zonas, es por esta razón que la clientela no falta.

La presente solicitud es para la compra del equipo de gas para su auto, pero deberá aumentar su inversión ya que quiere adquirir 4 aros también para su auto a $us. 80.- cada uno. Esta es el cuarto préstamo de Raúl en nuestra institución, todos los créditos los pago de manera excelente. Actualmente sólo tiene un crédito mas en la Cooperativa Luis.

loans.use: Purchase gasoline equipment

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es:
Without a doubt work dignifies people, especially Bertilla, a modest mother of seven. Five of her seven children still live at home with her and are getting a good education. Bertilla feels very satisfied because her children are achieving their goals. Her husband's salary, as a school teacher, is insufficient to cover their expenses. Therefore, she decided to start her own ambulatory business 35 years ago selling jello, soda and tunas.

Bertilla makes an immense effort every day in spite of her deteriorated health. Many years ago she got diagnosed with a prolapse, which got her hospitalized for a while. She has rehabilitated and continues to work with the hopes of having her own store one day. Every day, she gets her baskets ready by placing in them all the tunas that she plans on selling. With this income, she will pay for her youngest daughter to get into medical school because she is done with highschool and wants to be a doctor. Therefore, Bertilla requests fro a 300 soles loan to purchase more tunas for this season's sales.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Sin duda el trabajo dignifica al hombre y en especial D. Bertila, una modesta madre D. familia que tiene siete hijos y D. los cuales comparte las instalaciones D. su hogar sólo con cinco D. ellos que estudian para superarse. Ella se siente muy satisfecha porque sus hijos están logrando lo que se han propuesto.El sueldo insuficiente D. su esposo como profesor del sistema educativo D. su país la llevó a decidirse a emprender su pequeña empresa hace 35 años ofertando diversos productos como gelatinas, refrescos y ahora tunas D. manera ambulante, cada día hace un esfuerzo inmenso a pesar D. sus diferentes dolencias por su deteriorada salud, hace varios años le diagnosticaron un prolapso que fue motivo D. su hospitalización por un tiempo ahora ya rehabilitada sigue trabajando con el anhelo D. un futuro establecer una tienda.Diariamente alista sus canastas para depositar ahí las tunas que ha D. vender en ese día y con la ganancia que obtenga podrá pagar los estudios en una academia D. su última hija que ya terminó el colegio y desea ser una doctora, por esa razón Bertila solicita un préstamo D. 300 soles para comprar más tunas para esta temporada D. venta.

loans.use: Increment capital to sell more tunas

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila lives in the center of the city of Huancayo, Peru, near a hospital and an elementary school. Because of her location and being on one of the city's main streets she decided to take advantage of her favorable conditions and open a small restaurant and juice stand in her home two years ago. Her talent and seasonings have assured her massive sales of dishes and juices and allowed her to stay in business. However, the unforeseen rise in prices of mass-consumed products like rice and potatoes have not allowed her to achieve the earnings she has been accustomed to from selling her meals. Luzmila is now requesting a loan to purchase the goods she needs at wholesale to cook in her restaurant and also improve its ambiance. Help Luzmila reach her goals for the good of her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Luzmila, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Huancayo, cerca de un hospital y una escuela primaria de su localidad y por ser su calle una de las avenidas principales decidió aprovechar su condición favorable para abrir un pequeño restaurante juguería en su propia casa hace dos años el cual ha resultado. Su talento y buena sazón le aseguran la venta masiva de menús y jugos que han hecho que su negocio permanezca en el tiempo; sin embrago la inexplicable alza de productos de consumo masivo como el arroz y la papa no le permiten obtener las ganancias que ya estaba acostumbrada a percibir con la venta de sus platillos.Luzmila ahora está solicitando un préstamo para comprar al por mayor los abarrotes necesarios para cocinar en su restaurante y mejorar el ambiente de su pequeño establecimiento. Apoya a Luzmila a alcanzar sus metas por el bien de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients at wholesale to lower the costs of making meals at her restaurant.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is a determined mother who has been working since she was only seven years old. She spent her childhood selling jellies out of necessity to help her family. Shortly after she was married she had the new responsibility of providing for her children, although her husband also worked. With a lot of hard work she was able to stick with what she knew, selling her jellies at different public events. All these years she has been exposed to the sun's intense rays and never interrupted her work despite needing medical care for spots on her skin. After a struggle within her heart, she decided to keep working for the well being of her beloved children and with that goal she's asking to find it in your kind and noble heart to help her purchase larger quantities of ingredients for her delicious jellies and invest in her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Vilma, es una empeñosa madre que trabaja de manera sostenida desde que tenía apenas siete años de edad. Su niñez la ha pasado ofertando gelatinas ante la necesidad económica por las que atravesaba su familia. Poco después de haber contraído matrimonio la responsabilidad de brindar comodidades a sus pequeños hijos a pesar de que su esposo también trabaja la ha conducido a mantener con muchas fuerzas la actividad que ya conoce y disfruta comercializar sus productos en diferentes eventos públicos.Todos estos años ha estado expuesta a los intensos rayos solares y no ha interrumpido sus labores a pesar de encontrarse en tratamiento médico; debido a la presencia de manchas en su piel. A pesar de tener una lucha interna en su corazón, desea seguir trabajando para procurarles bienestar a sus queridos hijos con este propósito solicita la ayuda de vuestro bondadoso y noble corazón a fin de invertir la cantidad que le otorgues en la compre de mayor cantidad de insumos para sus deliciosas gelatinas y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make her jellies and invest in her children's education.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, es una empeñosa madre que  trabaja de manera sostenida  desde  que tenía apenas siete  años de edad. Su niñez la ha pasado  ofertando gelatinas ante la necesidad económica por las que atravesaba su familia. Poco después de haber contraído matrimonio  la responsabilidad de brindar comodidades a sus pequeños  hijos a pesar de que su esposo también trabaja la  ha conducido  a   mantener   con muchas fuerzas la actividad que ya conoce y  disfruta comercializar sus productos en diferentes eventos públicos.Todos estos años ha estado expuesta a los intensos rayos solares  y no ha interrumpido sus labores a pesar de encontrarse en tratamiento médico; debido a la presencia de manchas en su piel. A pesar de tener una lucha interna en su corazón, desea seguir trabajando para procurarles bienestar a sus queridos hijos con este propósito solicita la ayuda de vuestro bondadoso y noble corazón a fin de invertir la cantidad que le otorgues en la compre de mayor cantidad de insumos para sus deliciosas gelatinas y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para fabricación de sus gelatinas e inversión en la educación de sus hijos.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, es una empeñosa madre que  trabaja de manera sostenida  desde  que tenía apenas siete  años de edad. Su niñez la ha pasado  ofertando gelatinas ante la necesidad económica por las que atravesaba su familia. Poco después de haber contraído matrimonio  la responsabilidad de brindar comodidades a sus pequeños  hijos a pesar de que su esposo también trabaja la  ha conducido  a   mantener   con muchas fuerzas la actividad que ya conoce y  disfruta comercializar sus productos en diferentes eventos públicos.Todos estos años ha estado expuesta a los intensos rayos solares  y no ha interrumpido sus labores a pesar de encontrarse en tratamiento médico; debido a la presencia de manchas en su piel. A pesar de tener una lucha interna en su corazón, desea seguir trabajando para procurarles bienestar a sus queridos hijos con este propósito solicita la ayuda de vuestro bondadoso y noble corazón a fin de invertir la cantidad que le otorgues en la compre de mayor cantidad de insumos para sus deliciosas gelatinas y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para fabricación de sus gelatinas e inversión en la educación de sus hijos.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty is dedicated to making beautiful embroideries for typical dresses, which she makes day to day with a lot of patience and enjoyment. She likes what she does and fondly recalls how she started at the suggestion of one of her friends. She started embroidering traditional items called "plumilladas" and selling them at festivals and markets in her area. Years have passed and today she has become one of the best embroiderers in her area. Now she only takes orders from her demanding customers, who come to her in every season for fine handmaD. work. This art form she has mastered due to her excellent color combinations and a high-quality finished product. With the passage of time she has seen with satisfaction all she has accomplished. She has never neglected her children and like any good mother has provided for them equally along with her husband, who currently is in a delicate condition and awaiting an operation. Because of this, Betty has worked even harder, with the help of her daughters. To be help her beloved husband's recovery she is requesting a loan to purchase a larger quantity of materials (fabric, thread, etc.) for her business. Support Betty in this time of need for our solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Betty, se dedica a realizar bellos bordados para los trajes típicos que produce día a día con mucha paciencia y gusto por que disfruta lo que hace, y recuerda muy bien como se inició por invitación D. una D. sus amigas y comenzó bordando fustanes D. tela a la que llaman plumillada en las ferias y mercados D. su zona, Han pasado los años y hoy se ha convertido en una D. las mejores bordadoras D. su localidad, ahora sólo cubre pedidos D. sus exigentes clientes que en cada temporada solicitan sus trabajos manuales muy bien elaborados, ese arte que domina acompañada D. la excelente combinación D. colores aseguran un acabado y un trabajo D. calidad. Con el paso D. los años observa con satisfacción todo lo que ha logrado durante estos años. Jamás descuido a sus hijos y como buena madre cubrió sus necesidades al igual que su esposo que en la actualidad se encuentra delicado D. salud y esta pronto a ser operado. Por este último motivo, Betty, trabaja aún con más esfuerzo y con la ayuda D. sus hijas. Para otorgarle una recuperación adecuada a su querido esposo solicita el préstamo D. una suma D. dinero a fin D. adquirir mayor cantidad D. materia prima. Apoya en estos momentos a Betty que necesita D. nuestra solidaridad.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a very hard-working woman and in spite of being both mother and father to her three children, the solitude she feels from not having the companionship of a husband has not stopped her from having a good sense of humor that keeps her moving forward. Five years ago she decided to dedicate herself to raising and selling hamsters to be able to provide for her family. She feels very satisfied because she has accomplished what she set out to do from the start, becoming the biggest provider of hamsters in the community. She did this thanks to the training she received through the local government, which she did with a lot of attention and has followed through on all their recommendations. Among her biggest dreams is expanding her business into the biggest one of its kind in the country. With this goal in mind, she also had been making food in the afternoons for them but could not continue because it was risky during pregnancy. She is now asking for help from your noble hearts so she can purchase the right kind of feed for her hamsters in large quantities to help her continue satisfying the needs of her household through this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa, es una mujer muy trabajadora y a pesar de que sola asume el papel de padre y de madre para sus tres hijos, la soledad que siente por no gozar de la compañía de su esposo no deja de tener un buen sentido del humor que la anima a seguir progresando.Hace cinco años decidió dedicarse a la crianza de cuyes para sostener a su familia, se siente muy satisfecha porque ha logrado lo que se había trazado en un inicio, hacer que su criadero de cuyes sea el más grande de su comunidad y lo ha logrado gracias a las capacitaciones que recibió a través del municipio de su localidad a la cual ha tomado mucha atención y ha aplicado cada una de las recomendaciones. Entre sus grandes sueños está la meta de alcanzar la expansión de sus criaderos para convertirse en la más grande proveedora de cuyes de su país.Con este fin en mente estuvo también preparando alimentos para ofrecerlos por las tardes sin embargo tuvo que abandonar este oficio debido a que se encuentra en un una etapa muy riesgosa de su embarazo; por este motivo solicita la ayuda de vuestro noble corazón a fin de obtener la cantidad que solicita para adqurir mayor cantidad de alimento balanceado para sus cuyes con el objetivo de seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de su hogar a través de esta su principal actividad económica.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of hamster feed.

loans.name: Aparicia

texts.en:
Aparicia Ramírez is more than fifty years old and is a single mother of two girls in elementary school. In order to achieve financial independence and to provide for young girls, she has had to work for years as a seamstress with a relative.

Thanks to her great management of profits made from mending clothing, Aparicia was able to set up her own convenience store where she sells various goods. Along with her work at the store, she also continues to mend and sew clothes to keep the store supplied, and make a greater income and support her family. She wants to insure her girls never go hungry.

Aparicia is asking for a loan so she may supply her convenience store with sugar, rice, cheese, corn, cookies, along with keeping the materials and supplies stocked in her seamstress shop.

loans.use: To  buy sugar, noodles, cheese, rice, corn and cookies for her convenience store.

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José G. is 55 years old and is married to Teresa G. who is fifty-four. They have no children because of the inability to conceive. Mr. G. has a small convenience store in which he sells various things. In order to start up this business, Mr. G. had cultivated cotton in prior years. With the cotton profits, he bought merchandise and soon began his convenience store in the year 2000.

Years have passed and Mr. G.’s store has grown in the amount of merchandise sold. It is located in an area where there is not much competition and therefore has achieved great income. It continues to be well maintained and staffed by his family. Jose wishes to continue the expansion of his convenience store and with a loan will diversify the goods, buying items such as yerba mate (herbal tea), sugar, oil, bath soap, and laundry detergent.

loans.use: To purchase yerba mate, sugar, oil, flour, bath soap, and laundry detergent

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.en:
Vilma, Elsa, and Laura have been members of the community bank Sarita for about one year. They are all very happy with their experience in the community bank and say that together they forget their problems and celebrate special events such as birthdays. They have learned responsibility, punctuality, the importance of saving, and how to take care of their children.

Vilma is 31 years old and has three young children. She has land in the country where she grows fruits and vegetables. She has been selling them in the market in Ayacucho for the past four years. Elsa is 25 years old and has two children. She has been selling snacks from her home for the past year and recently started selling cosmetics from a catalogue. Laura is 23 and has an adorable eleven-month-old daughter. She is an artisan and builds wooden tableaus. She learned this from her husband's family and has been working with them for the past four years.

Vilma, Elsa, and Laura each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in materials for their businesses, such as seeds, fertilizer, potatoes, oil, flour, wood, a stand from which to sell their products, and paint.

A large part of the community bank is saving, and each associate has an interest-earning account. All three women said that they are saving to be able to own a home. Vilma, Elsa, and Laura dream that their children will have a better life and receive an education. Laura also hopes to one day open a gallery to display her tableaus.

loans.use: Vilma, Elsa, and Laura each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in materials for their businesses, such as seeds, fertilizer, potatoes, oil, flour, wood, a stand from which to sell their products, and paint.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis Ruiz is 45 years old and married to Iluminada who is forty-five years old. Together they have five children, two of whom have graduated from college, and three who are still in high school.

In order to step into the world of small businesses and support his growing children, Luis had to travel to Buenos Aires, Argentina and sell goods. After making and saving enough capital to begin his business, he soon returned to Paraguay where he could be reunited with his family. Today he is a traveling clothes salesman in Ybycuí and surrounding towns.

His hard work and dedication has allowed his two working children to continue with their profession and allowed his younger children to continue their education. Luis’s hope is that one day all of his children will be able to gain degrees and will not have to struggle to make a living.

His request for a loan is to fulfill his hope of increasing the size of his business and buy larger quantities of T-shirts, pants, and Bermuda shorts to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of T-shirts, pants, and Bermuda shorts

loans.name: Elva's Group

texts.en:
Mercedes and Elva are members of the community bank Sarita. They have both belonged to Sarita for a little over a year. In that time they have learned many things. Mercedes was originally scared to join the organization because she was told many negative things about it. She is now very happy that she joined and sees that the community bank is there to help her and make getting a loan as easy as possible. Elva says that the lessons she has received have helped her almost more than the loans and she has learned how to manage her home and take care of her children. They say that all of the associates work together and try to lead by example.

Mercedes is 41 and has two daughters, aged 19 and 13. She sells desserts such as cakes, torts, and chocolates. The community bank has been especially helpful for her because the other associates call her when they need a special dessert for a birthday or other celebration.

Elva is 30 years old and has many businesses. She sells natural health products, sometimes works in a salon, and once a week she travels to the jungle area to sell chicken and fish and then buy fruit which she sells in Ayacucho. She has been doing this for the past six years.

Mercedes and Elva need loans of 400 soles and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will allow them to receive a discounted price by buying in a larger quantity.

They are currently saving to be able to build a house. Their dreams are to open their own stores. Mercedes would open a dessert shop and Elva would open a salon.

loans.use: Mercedes and Elva need loans of 400 soles and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will allow them to receive a discounted price by buying in a larger quantity.

loans.name: Zenobia's Group

texts.en:
Victoria and Zenobia have been members of the members of the community bank Kallpanchik for 1 1/2 and 2 1/2 years respectively. In this time they have learned to be responsible and punctual. They say that they enjoy coming to weekly meetings because they can forget the problems they have at home.

Victoria is 38 years old and has six children. She has been selling shish kabob from a stand in the market for eight years. Before that she washed laundry but it maD. her sick. Zenobia is 40 years old and has three children. She has owned a grocery store for the past 12 years. Before that she sold grocery staples from a cart but since buying her house she has been able to sell more products from her home.

Victoria and Zenobia need loans of 200 and 1200 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in meat, onions, flour, rice, sugar, and other similar products.

Both women have a savings account with their community bank and are saving in case of an emergency and to buy a car. Victoria and Zenobia dream of continuing to develop their businesses.

loans.use: Victoria and Zenobia need loans of 200 and 1200 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in meat, onions, flour, rice, sugar, and other similar products.

loans.name: Yuli Magali's Group

texts.en:
Silvia, Karina, and Yuli have been members of the community bank Glorioso for 3, 2, and 12 years respectively. In that time they have learned how to save, how to run their business, and how to continue to develop their business. In addition they have learned about self-esteem and respect. They feel like their bank is a family where they can relax and share their problems.

Silvia is 55 years old and has five children. She has owned a bakery for the past 15 years. Now she has established clients who always buy from her every day. Karina is 20 years old and owns a small café. She also goes to school where she studies accounting. Yuli is 32 and has one son. She is a founding member of her community bank. Yuli sells clothing and cosmetics to her friends, family, and other associates at the bank.

Silvia, Karina, and Yuli need loans of 800 soles, 1000 soles, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying products for their businesses, such as flour, sugar, eggs, and more cosmetics.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each member has an interest-earning savings account. Silvia, Karina, and Yuli are saving for the education of their children, for an upcoming marriage, and to open a restaurant. Each woman has her own dream. Silvia hopes for a better life for her children. Karina dreams of finishing her degree and getting married. Yuli hopes to one day open a restaurant and one day own a chain of restaurants across all of Peru.

loans.use: Silvia, Karina and Yuli need loans of 800 soles, 1000 soles, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying products for their businesses, such as flour, sugar, eggs, and more cosmetics.

loans.name: Epifania Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira has been a member of the community bank Glorioso for two years. Before joining the bank she was always late, but has learned the importance of being punctual. She has also found companionship and solidarity among the other associates.

Elvira is 50 years old and has one daughter who is 26. She owns a restaurant which specializes in fish and shellfish. She has owned this restaurant for 12 years and before that managed a cafeteria for a large telecommunications company that was located in Ayacucho but has since moved.

Elvira needs a loan of 2200 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to redecorate her restaurant, buy new tables, and begin buying fish from the southern coast of Peru, which are generally larger then the fish she currently buys.

A large part of the community bank is emphasizing savings. Each associate has an interest-earning savings account. Elvira is saving to be able to buy a large area of land and build several small economical houses to help some of her employees who have worked for her since she ran the cafeteria. Elvira dreams of being able to help her employees and buying a house for herself in the city of Tacna, where she grew up.

loans.use: Elvira needs a loan of 2200 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to redecorate her restaurant, buy new tables, and begin buying fish from the southern coast of Peru, which are generally larger then the fish she currently buys.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vincente B. is a 38-year-old man who is married to twenty-six-year-old Mercedes Ruiz. They have two young school- age children. Since his childhood, Mr. B. has sacrificed much to help his grandfather as a butcher in their meat shop. However, after his grandfather passed away five years ago, Vincente was left in charge of the family business and had to secure labor for the butcher shop.

Today the meat shop is still a great success, however, Mr. B. is asking for a loan to help the operation grow and become even more profitable. With a loan he will buy more cattle to raise and sell in his butcher shop.

loans.use: To  purchase animals to fatten for his butcher shop

loans.name: Doylith

texts.es:
Doylith Esther is a 42-year-old primary school teacher, and a friendly, super active woman. She has copy machines that she uses to provide the general public and businesses in the city the services that they require. Mrs. Doylith and her husband, Mrs. Oswaldo, have a 13-year-old daughter named Brenda, who is the light of their progress, and of course they want to give her everything she needs to one day be a successful professional. She has a goal, and that is to perform the necessary maintenance on her machines; she has also decided to open Internet service booths, and to do that, she requires an investment of capital. Let’s give a breath of hope to Mrs. Doylith so that she can complete her outlines proposals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doylith Esther, de 42 años de edad de profesión profesora de educación primaria, es una mujer jovial y súper activa, ella tiene máquinas copiadoras, con los que brinda servicios al público en general y a las empresas de su ciudad que lo requieran.La señora Doylith Esther junto a su Esposo el señor Oswaldo tienen una hija de 13 años de nombre Brenda, quien es la luz de su progreso y desde luego desean entregarle todo lo necesario para que en un futuro sea una profesional de éxito.Ella tiene una meta y esa es implementar y realizar el mantenimiento respectivo de sus máquinas, también ha decidido poner cabinas de Internet y para ello requiere de un capital de inversión.Demos un aliento de esperanza a la señora Doylith, para que cumpla sus propósitos trazados.

loans.use: Open a new Internet service and maintain the tools of her trade.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Selling food has been Rita's daily job for a long time. Her efforts to progress in life have only one goal: offer security and well-being to her 4 children who currently attend school. This hard working mother and her husband have been working very hard in order for their children to be able to attend college and get an education. Rita is a 48 years old woman who is willing to work very hard in order to reach her goals. Please help this mother and she will show you that with lots of effort and talent anything is possible.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Vender comida es la actividad diaria que tiene la señora Rita, ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo, sus esfuerzos por prosperar y progresar con la venta de comida tiene un solo propósito, otorgarles bienestar y seguridad a sus cuatro hijos quienes siguen estudiando, esta trabajadora madre y su querido esposos se han propuesto trabajar arduamente para que sus hijos estudien la carrera en la cual piensan desempeñarse el resto de sus vidas con mucha satisfacción.La señora Rita a sus 48 años de edad es una mujer decidida y capaz de lograr lo que desea, por esa razón requiere de un capital de inversión para mejorar los ambientes de su local y desde luego cumplir con su propósito en el tiempo menos pensado. Ayuda a esta madre desinteresadamente y te demostrará con talento y esfuerzo que si puede.

loans.use: Expand her small space for sales

loans.name: Talmit

texts.es:
Talmit is a 39-year-old single mother with two daughters, Diana and Claudia; these girls have become her reason for being and for progressing. She has a small hardware store located in a very strategic zone in her city. She also sells gas to households so she can improve her family’s quality of life. Her responsibilities as both father and mother to her girls do not impede her progress. On the contrary, she has progressed much in these last few years thanks to her hard work and drive. She wishes to expand her businesses selling hardware and gas, and to do this she needs a loan that will make it so she can reach her objective in an unthinkably short amount of time. With your help, Mrs. Talmit can bring her daughters an education and well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Talmit, es madre soltera de 39 años, tiene dos hijas Diana y Claudia, niñas que se han convertido en su razón de ser y progreso, ella tiene una pequeña ferretería ubicada en una zona muy estratégica de su ciudad, también vende gas a domicilio de manera adicional con el fin de incrementar el nivel de vida de su familia.Su responsabilidad como padre y madre para sus hijas no le impiden progresar, al contrario ha progresado mucho en estos últimos años gracias a su esfuerzo y empeño: desea ampliar su negocio de ventas de artículos ferreteros y la venta de gas, y para ello estima de un capital que hará cumplir su objetivo en el tiempo menos pensado. Con tu ayuda la señora Talmit podrá brindarles a sus hijas educación y bienestar.

loans.use: Cash for the consolidation of her two small businesses.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs. Pilar del Rocio is 38 years old and has two children, who have become the main meaning in her life and in her progress. She and her husband have proposed working themselves to their utmost so that their little children can achieve the goals that they have outlined. For some time, she has dedicated herself to selling groceries and other necessities, and this business has become the main source of economic support for their home. Her goal is to expand her sales space, buy a larger quantity of foods, and above all, improve the structure of their home. To do this, she needs to request a sum of money so that she can get started with these proposals. Thanks to your help, Mrs. Pilar del Rocio will achieve her goals in very little time.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Pilar del Rocio de 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos quienes se han convertido en el principal significado de su vida y progreso. Ella y su esposo se han propuesto esforzarse al máximo para que sus pequeños hijos puedan cumplir las metas que se han trazado.Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace mucho tiempo, y precisamente este negocio se ha convertido en el principal sustento económico de su hogar. Ella tiene el propósito de ampliar su espacio de ventas, comprar mayor cantidad de productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente solicita una cantidad de dinero a fin de poner en marcha sus propósitos.Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Pilar del Rocio logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Improvement of her small sales space.

loans.name: Ziomara

texts.es:
Mrs. Ziomara is 39 years old and is the mother of four children. She currently belongs to the communal bank Women with Future. She is the owner of a motorcar and dedicates herself to managing that as well as selling food at night. Her husband, Mr. Miguel, who supports her in everything, is happy and proud to have a hard-working woman. For Ziomara, the only goal of her daily efforts is to improve the conditions of her work tools and after that, to enhance her food sales business. For this, she needs cash that she will invest in the expenses of the previously mentioned goals. She awaits your noble heart’s unselfish help.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ziomara de 39 años de edad es madre de cuatro hijos, en la actualidad pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ella es propietaria de un motocarro y se dedica a la administración del mismo, adicionalmente también se dedica a la venta de comida por la noches. Su esposo el señor Miguel, quien la apoya en todo se siente feliz y orgulloso por tener una mujer trabajadora.Para Ziomara el único fin de su esfuerzo diario es mejorar las condiciones de su herramienta de trabajo y desde luego implementar más su negocio de venta de comida, para lo cual requiere de un capital que lo invertirá en los gastos del deseo antes mencionado.Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Implementation of her business

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara Beatriz is a 58-year-old mother of six children, of which three are independent, and three are still dependent on her since they are studying technical careers. She wants them to complete their studies successfully so they will be able to work.

Sara studied this fine art of knitting and embroidery long ago, and now that she has made it her business, it has brought in significant income, despite not having a suitable place to do her work. Since Mrs. Sara uses a space within her home to do this work, and the space is limited, it is important for her to improve her space. Mrs. Sara's goal is to rent a crafts workshop, and organize and develop it completely so she can share her skills with other moms in her community. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan in order to be able to rent a space and purchase materials.

With your support, Mrs Sara will realize her dream in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Sara Beatriz tiene 58 años de edad es madre de seis hijos, de los cuales tres de ellos ya son independientes, quedando sólo tres a su cargo y bajo su protección ya que están estudiando carreras técnicas, ella sólo quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios satisfactoriamente para que puedan trabajar. Sara estudió este bello arte de manualidades (tejidos y bordados) hace mucho tiempo, se desenvuelve en el ya que se ha convertido en el sustento económico significativo de su hogar; a pesar de no tener un local apropiado la señora Sara ocupa un lugar en su vivienda para trabajar, debido a este hecho le urge mejorar su ambiente.Para la señora Sara su propósito es poner un taller de manualidades a fin de e implementarlo completamente para desarrollar y compartir sus habilidades con otras madres de su comunidad, para este fin requiere de un préstamo para alquilar un local y la compra de sus materiales. Con tu apoyo la señora Sara podrá concretar su propósito en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: To start her business. (IMPLEMENTAR SU NEGOCIO)

loans.name: Juana Gregoria

texts.es:
Mrs.Juana Gregorio Zaledon is originally from Bluefields. She's 47 years and and is married to Mr. Antonio Cortes; they have two children who are married and independent; 2 other children attend elementary school. Mrs. Zeldon has been selling clothes for a year, she visits her customers at their houses. Current customers are people in her neighborhood and government employees. As the school year approaches, Mrs. Z. needs to purchase 20 yards of fabric ($.80/yard),3 dozen shirts, 1 dozen pants ($20/dozen), 6 dozen underwear ($25/dozen), 8 dozen socks ($6/dozen) and 1 dozen shoes ($36/dozen) to cover the needs of the families who request her services. These families need to get their kids ready for the school year which is about to begin.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer,

La Sra. Juana Gregorio Zeledón es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 47 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Antonio Cortés ambos tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y son independientes, 3 hijos menores de edad que cursan estudios primarios. La Sra. Zeledón desde hace un año vende ropa a domicilio teniendo como clientes potenciales a los habitantes de su barrio y trabajadores de la instituciones gubernamentales. Con el inicio de clases la Sra. Zeledón necesita comprar 20 yardas de tela a $ 0.80 centavos dólar la yarda de tela, 3 docenas de camisolín a $ 10.00 dólares la docena, 1 docena de pantalón $ 20.00 dólares la docena, 6 docenas de ropa interior $ 25.00 dólares cada docena, 8 docenas de calcetines a $ 6.00 dólares cada docena, 1 docenas de calzado $ 36.00 dólares la docena para poder cubrir las necesidades de los padres de familias que tienen que preparar a sus hijos para iniciar el curso electivo

loans.use: Purchase of 20 yards of fabric, 3 dozen shirts, 1 dozen pants, 6 dozen underwear, 8 dozen socks 1 dozen shoes

payments.comment: Pago 3 cuotas de una sola vez.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a very active woman who dreams of improving her lifestyle. She's been selling beauty products for many years: Perfumes, shampoos, powders, lipsticks, nail enamel, etc. With her hard work she's been able to acquire many customers and for this reason, she wishes to purchase a window display. She's a 28 year old single mother of two wonderful children. All she hopes of them is to become successful professionals. This working mother wishes to get a loan as soon as possible in order to achieve her goal. With your help Esther will be able to accomplish her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer,

Esther, es una mujer muy activa y con muchos deseos de superación, ella se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de productos de belleza como: perfumes, shampoos, talcos, lápiz labiales, correctores para uñas, etc; con su desempeño ha logrado con este trabajo una gran gama de clientes y por esa razón optado por poner su mostrador (vitrina) con el objetivo de surtirlo con estos productos de belleza. Ella a sus 28 años es madre de dos hijos maravillosos y lo único que espera es que estudien y sean profesionales exitosos.Esta trabajadora madre precisa de un capital lo más pronto posible para lograr su objetivo y cumplir con lo que realmente quiere. Con tu ayuda la señora Esther logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of a window display and go add more capital to her business

loans.name: Cristian Javier

texts.es:
Cristian Javier is 27 years of age, he is single and is a young, hardworking entrepreneur. Today he works in the transport of passengers, but he studied drawing, painting and ceramics. He now owns a motorcar which helps with successfully sustaining his home's expenses. For him, nothing is impossible. He dreams of finishing building his farm and ultimately putting in a drawing and painting workshop for children. But now he is requesting capital for the purchase of spare parts. With your support we will fulfill this young man's dreams as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Cristian Javier de 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, es un joven emprendedor y empeñoso, en la actualidad se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, pero estudió dibujo, pintura y cerámica, ahora es propietario de un motocarro el cual lo ayuda con el sostenimiento satisfactorio de su hogar.Para él no existe nada imposible ya que quiere terminar de construir su piscigranja y muy a la postre poner su taller de dibujo y pintura dirigido solo para niños, por lo que él necesita de un capital para la compra de repuestos.Con tu apoyo haremos cumplir el propósito de este joven activo a la brevedad.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcar. (Compra de repuestos para su motocarro.)

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andres Alvino is 27 years old and single. He currently attends college and is working towards his accounting bachelor's degree. He own a car that his brother drives (chauffer) while he attends school to obtain his degree. He is hoping to rent a place in which he'll be able to sell bike and car parts. This way he'll be able to employ more help and improve his family's way of life. With your help this young man will be able to improve the life of the local youth.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Andrés Alvino de 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, de profesión Bachiller en Contabilidad, es propietario de un mototacarro que conduce su hermano Rubén (chofer); mientras el estudia para obtener su titulo universitario.Tiene en mente alquilar un local para vender repuestos de motos y motocarros a fin de emplear a muchos jóvenes como su hermano que luchan por el bienestar de sus familias.Con tu ayuda este joven podrá concretar sus planes y ayudará a elevar la calidad de vida de más familias jóvenes.

loans.use: Implement and rent a place in which he'll be able to sell parts for motorcycles and other transportations

loans.name: Eugenia's Group

texts.en:
Ana Maria and Eugenia have been members of the community bank Sarita for two and eleven years respectively.

Ana Maria is 23 years old. She lives with her partner and is expecting her first child. She has been selling vegetables in the Nery Garcia market of Ayacucho for one year; she learned this business from her mother. Ana Maria would like to change her business to sell groceries and condiments. Eugenia has a grocery store in the center of Ayacucho and has been selling groceries since she was very young.

In their community bank they have learned to save and to be responsible and punctual. They have also learned valuable social skills such as how to educate their children, how to respect themselves, and how to support other bank associates.

Eugenia and Ana Maria each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying onions, squash, cilantro, parsley, tomato, beans, sugar, rice, and milk.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest-earning account. Ana Maria and Eugenia plan to use their savings to increase the capital available for their business, to buy a house, and to pay for medical care if a family member gets sick. Eugenia and Ana Maria dream of owning a home, giving their children a good education, having good health, and that no one in their family will lack anything they need.

loans.use: Eugenia and Ana Maria each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying onions, squash, cilantro, parsley, tomato, beans, sugar, rice, and milk.

loans.name: Sulma's Group

texts.en:
Sulma, Miriam, and Katty have belonged to the community bank Kalllapanchik, which means “our force” in Quechua, less than six months. In their community bank they have learned to be responsible and punctual. They have also learned to value themselves and to be honest.

Sulma is 23; she lives with her partner and one-year-old child. Sulma rents a stand in the Nazarenas market where she sells vegetables. She has had this business for four months. With her new loan Sulma will begin to sell sandals.

Miriam is 24 and lives with her partner and two-year-old daughter. Miriam works with her husband driving a motorcycle taxi. Before this Miriam sold vegetables but stopped in order to spend more time with her daughter. Now that her daughter is older she has decided to start her vegetable business again. With her new loan she will travel to markets in the surrounding area and buy fruits which she will sell in the Nery Garcia market.

On the other hand, Katty is 19 and lives with her partner and four-year-old son. Katty rents space in the Jesus Nazareno neighborhood where she runs a beauty salon.

Sulma, Miriam, and Katty need loans of 400, 1000, and 200 soles (3 sole = $1), which will be invested in buying sandals, celery, squash, carrots, peaches, and tuna, a local fruit which comes from a cactus.

An important part of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Zulma, Mariam, and Katty plan to use their savings to develop their business, buy a car, and in the case of an emergency. Their dreams are to own a home, to have a stable and successful business, and to give their children a good education.

loans.use: Sulma, Miriam, and Katty need loans of 400, 1000, and 200 soles (3 sole = $1), which will be invested in buying sandals, celery, squash, carrots, peaches, and tuna, a local fruit which comes from a cactus.

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia and Zonia have been members of the community bank Kallpanchik, which means "our force" in Quechua, for one year. In their community bank they have learned business skills such as saving, discipline, punctuality, and responsibility. They have also learned how to care for their children, how to avoid getting sick, and how to have a positive relationship with their husbands.

Sofia is 36 years old and has four children. She knits beautiful sweaters, which she sells to the stores in the center of Ayacucho. She also sells them to friends and family. Sofia learned how to knit from her mother. Furthermore, Sofia has recently opened a bar.

Meanwhile, Zonia is 40; she is married and has five children. She buys cochinilla, an insect used to make red dye, and leather in the country and then sells it to intermediaries who take it to Lima. Sofia also buys animals, butchers them and sells them in the Nery Garcia market of Ayacucho.

Sofia and Zonia need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying wool of various colors, knitting needles, cochinillia, and leather.

Each member of the community bank gets an interest-earning savings account. Sofia and Zonia hope to use their savings to buy furniture and decorations for their house, and to educate their children. Their dreams are to own a home, own a business where they can sell their own knit goods, start a new business, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Sofia and Zonia need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying wool of various colors, knitting needles, cochinillia, and leather.

loans.name: Teodosia's Group

texts.en:
Judit, Catalina, and Teodosia have been members of the community bank Glorioso for 2, 8, and 6 years respectively. In that time they have learned to save, to be punctual, to be responsible, and to be friends with the other associates.

Judit is 32 years old. She is single and has two children. On Saturdays and Sundays Judit sells fish and shellfish in Andahuaylas. She learned this business from her aunts. On the other hand, Catalina is 42. She is married and has five children. She sells vegetables, groceries, and grains in the San Juan Bautista market from a rented stand. Catalina would like to run her store from her house. Furthermore, she has a car which her youngest son drives as a taxi. Teodosia is 34, married, and has four children. She sells firewood from her house in the mornings and in the afternoons sells emoliente, which is a warm beverage maD. from local herbs and seeds.

Judit, Catalina, and Teodosia need loans of 600, 1200, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying crabs, fish, octopus, wheat, corn, wood, and a car battery.

Each community bank member has an interest-earning account and learns about the value of saving. Judit, Catalina, and Teodosia plan to use their savings to educate their children and in the case of an emergency. Their dreams are to own a home, that their children will be professionals, and that they can open a business from their home.

loans.use: Judit, Catalina, and Teodosia need loans of 600, 1200, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying crabs, fish, octopus, wheat, corn, wood, and a car battery.

loans.name: Zoraida Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Zoraida, Cristina, and Paulina have been members of the community bank Glorioso for the past 7, 2, and 3 years respectively. In that time they have learned to be responsible and punctual, and to save. They have also learned the importance of self-esteem.

Zoraida is 38; she is married and has two children. She runs a well-stocked grocery store where she sells food staples, clothing, and cosmetics. Furthermore, Zoraida has computers available for Internet use. Cristina is 64 years old; she is married and has three children, only one of whom lives with her. Cristina has been selling food staples from her house for the past 10 years. Paulina is married and has four children; she is 58 years old. Paulina has a small grocery store in the Capillapata neighborhood.

Zoraida, Cristina, and Paulina need loans of 1600, 600 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, beans, soap, detergents, soft drinks, beer, pre-paid phone cards, tuna fish, cookies, candies and chocolates.

They plan to use their savings to increase the capital of their businesses, to educate their children, and for unexpected costs. Zoraida, Cristina, and Paulina dream of owning a large grocery store, improving their homes, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Zoraida, Cristina, and Paulina need loans of 1600, 600 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, beans, soap, detergents, soft drinks, beer, pre-paid phone cards, tuna fish, cookies, candies and chocolates.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana Rosa Gonzalez Gomez is originally from the city of Bluefields, she's 34 years old and married to Mr. Jairo Centeno. They have a 4 year old girl who is in Kindergarten. Mrs. Gonzalez sell gold plated jewelry. As potential buyers, she has full time employed women as well as housewives. She visits them at their home/work and offers them the best possible service ever. At the pace she's been working, she needs to invest more money in the purchase of more necklaces and earrings. She needs to purchase 10 units of necklaces ($10 each unit) and 20 units of earrings ($10 each unit).

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Ana Rosa G. G. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 34 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Jairo Centeno ambos tienen 1 niña de 4 años que cursa el Kinder. La Sra. G. tiene 1 año vendiendo oro laminado tiene como clientes potenciales mujeres que trabajan en oficinas y ama de casa que la prefieren por brindar un servicio a domicilio con el ritmo de trabajo que ha llevado en estos momentos necesita invertir más ya que el producto ha tenido una buena aceptación en el mercado y por eso necesita comprar 10 unidades de cadenas con dijes a $ 10.00 dólares la unidad y 20 unidades de aretes a $ 10.00 dólares cada arete.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 units of necklaces with pendants & 20 units of earrings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment and tools (Compra de equipo y herramientas)

loans.name: Jesús Gilberto

texts.es:
I have over 7 years experience with the business of operating and managing heavy machinery for construction. This business is the source of income for my brothers' two families and myself. I am applying for a loan of $1,200 USD in order to provide maintenance to my machinery and to buy tires.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Tango ya más de 7 años con el negocio de renta de maquinaria pesada para construcción. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para la familia en el trabajamos dos de mis hermanos y yo. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para darles mantenimiento a la maquinaria y comprar llantas.

loans.use: To supply maintenance to my machinery and to purchase tires.  (Mantenimiento y compra de llantas a la maquinaria.)

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeang P. and her husband have been married since 1973. They have four children—two sons and two daughters. Three of the children are employed full time, and the youngest one is studying in a local school. Yeang and her family live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production in 1979. Beside weaving, she also buys silk products from a weaver to resell at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a teacher.

Yeang has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is requesting another loan, in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase silk products to resell at a market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase silk products to resell

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Mr. Puth K. and his wife, Mrs. Sophos Eng, have been married since 2005. They have one daughter, who is one year old. Puth and his family live along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has been growing rice since 2005. His wife has been working in a garment factory since 2003.

Puth is requesting his first loan from Maxima, in the amount of $300. He will use this money to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to pay a plowing fee

loans.name: Phoen

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoen T., age 66, and her husband have been married over forty years. They have six children—four sons and two daughters. Four of their children are married and living elsewhere, and the other two live under their custody; one of them is a construction worker, and the other one weaves silk at home. Phoen and her family live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production when she was twenty years old. Her husband grows rice and plants vegetables.

Phoen is requesting her second loan, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to buy silk materials for weaving and to expand her family's farming business.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for weaving, and to expand farming business

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mrs. Saret Y., age 45, and her husband have been married since 1988. They have five children—four sons and one daughter. Their four sons are all studying in a local school, and their daughter works with her mother. Saret and her family live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been running a grocery store for over five years. Her husband is employed full time.

Saret is requesting her fourth loan, in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to buy grocery items to resell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to resell

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mr. Chheng C., age 45, and his wife have been married since 1993. They have nine children, five sons and four daughters. All of their children live under their custody. Chheng and his family live along National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He and his wife are currently in the business of farming and fishing. They plant cauliflowers on their farm.

Chheng is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $500. He will use this money to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Riya

texts.en:
Mrs. Riya Y., age 51, and her husband, Hem Phun, have been married since 1979. They have five children, one son and four daughters. Three of their children are working, and the other two are studying in a local school. Riya and her family live along National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been selling fruit since 1980. She buys the fruit from farms to resell at a market in the village. Her husband has been a house constructor since 1985.

Riya is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Mrs. Soung U., age 58, is a widow with eight children, four sons and four daughters. Four of her children are married and living elewhere, and the other four are living under her custody. Soung and her family live along National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been selling fish since 1982. She also does farming.

Soung is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to expand her fish-selling business, as well as to buy farmland on contract.

loans.use: To expand her businesses of selling fish and farming

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Y. Nasiba is 34 year-old loving mother of three children. Seven years ago she lost her husband and since that time all the difficulties were placed to the shoulders of this brave woman.

For 8 years already Nasiba has been selling the housewares, like detergents, washing liquids, tooth paste, air fresheners. Her elder daughter who is 12 now is helping her in the business. Two times a week Nasiba travels to the neighboring city that is about 80 kilometers away from her home to purchasing new goods for selling. In these cases she leaves her kids with her very old mother-in-law.

Nasiba has been loaned for about 2 years by IMON. Today she requests 1000.00 US Dollars. Nasiba is planning to increase the turnover capital which allows her to enlarge the range of housewares. The generated income Nasiba shall spend to pay for the education of her children. Nasiba thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Increasing the turnover capital and enlarging the range of goods

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C., age 36, and her husband have been married since 1991. They have five children, four sons and one daughter. Four of their children are studying in a local school, and the youngest one stays at home. Sopheap and her family live along National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of weaving cotton scarves since 1985. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. Her husband is a teacher.

Sopheap is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to expand her scarf-weaving business.

loans.use: To expand her business weaving cotton scarves

loans.name: Nayyer's Group

texts.en:
I am Nayyer I.. I was born and brought up in Pakpattan, a small town in Pakistan. I am not educated but my husband has finished tenth grade. Therefore, all of my kids (three daughters) are completing their studies. My husband is a farmer and I embroider and stitch. This would be my second loan. This time we require capital to buy pesticides for our fields. Shabana B. requests this loan for their snooker club. Koser P. will invest the loan in her son’s agricultural products business. Haleema S. wants to buy an embroidery machine. Gulshan I. would use this loan in their shoes store. Riffat B. also requests loan for her business. I hope these loans will do well for our businesses.
Nayyer I.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for our field

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng H., age 48, and his wife have been married since 1984. They have three children, one son and two daughters. One of their daughters is working in a garment factory and the other two children are studying in a local school. Sokheng and his family live along National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has been in the house construction business since 1992. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children.

Sokheng is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $600. He will add this loan to his own money in order to finish building his house.

loans.use: To add to his own money to finish building his house

loans.name: Sheela's Group

texts.en: I am Sheela N.. I live in a small town  named Pakpattan with my family. I am a mother of two: one boy and one girl. My son is in grade ten while my daughter is in grade eight.I studied till grade ten while my husband has completed his Bachelors degree. I am very hopeful about my kids' future.  I run a stitching school. I want to add a boutique to my school and therefore need capital. I am responsible for a few other women: Tahira S. requests a loan to expand their grocery store. Zarina B. sells cloth. Sakina B. stitches clothes for women in my neighborhood and now would like to buy an embroidery machine. Shamim M. requests this loan for their used items trading.

loans.use: Start a boutique

loans.name: Hadayat's Group
