texts.en: I am a mother of seven: five daughters and two sons. My husband and my elder son construct building and my younger son is a rickshaw driver.  Now, my son plans to buy a small truck to transport goods from one place to another for which we request a loan.  Parween B. will use the loan in their cycle repair shop. Basheeran M. requests this loan to buy stock for their general store. Zareen K. will use the money to buy an additional video game for their video games club.

loans.use: To buy a small truck

loans.name: Erisa A (I) Group

texts.en:
Rose is 47 years old and married with five children. She helps support her family by selling second-hand clothes. Alice works as a seamstress, Mary operates a retail shop, Grace is a poultry farmer and Regina runs a small grocery store. Rose plans to use the extra income generated by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the businesses operated by all five applicants.

loans.name: Erisa A (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Safina is 49 years old and divorced with eight children. She makes a living raising poultry. Beth and Resty both have retail shops and want to use the loan to increase the number of items they have for sale. Florence sells cold drinks and Fiona sells second-hand clothes. Safina intends to use the income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more poultry and other items to sell to customers

loans.name: Erisa A (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Safina is a 48-year-old widow with six children. She supports her family by poultry farming. Rose sells produce in the local food market. Teopista sells second-hand clothes. Hadijahis is a cook in a hotel and Bilal works as a seamstress. With the extra income generated by this loan, Safina intends to pay her children's school fees.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses by buying more items to sell to customers

loans.name: Erisa A (Iv) Group

texts.en:
Safina is 25 years old and married with four children. She sells raw foodstuffs from a stall in the local market. Aidah sells charcoal. Sylvia, Jesca and Aisha deal in second-hand clothes. All five women have applied for a loan to expand their businesses. Safina wants to use the extra income generated by the loan to pay school fees for her children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell to their customers

loans.name: Erisa B(I) Group

texts.en:
Dezi is a 48-year-old widow with five children. She has a market stall where she sells raw produce such as cassava, sweet potatoes and yams as well as matoke, a dish made with plantains that is popular in Uganda. She and her fellow applicants are seeking a loan to expand this business and buy additional produce to sell to their customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy additional produce to sell to customers

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phin C. N. is the mother of four children and works on her farmland grinding rice and resells it for a profit. Her husband works buying and selling plots of land, making about $10 each day. She has four children. One of them is a garment worker and three are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Phin C. N. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation. With a new motorcycle, her business will be faster and easier, and her husband will also use it occasionally to go to work. (Mrs. Phin C. was too shy to be photographed, so we took a photo of her grinding mill instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business's transportation

loans.name: Erisa B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Mastula is a widow with five children. She supports her family by selling food, particularly matooke, a dish made with plantains that is popular in Uganda. Zira and Josephine sell fruits and vegetables. Margret sells second-hand clothes while Betty sells charcoal. Mastula wants to use the extra income made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to sell to their customers

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng S., 32, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She stays at home, cooking food and looking after her little kids, while her husband works buying and selling wood, earning around $23/day in revenue.

Mrs. Seng S. would like to use this loan to purchase four water buffaloes to breed for additional income as now the price of buffaloes is growing steadily.

loans.use: To buy four water buffaloes to breed for additional profit

loans.name: Erisa B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
Juliet is 48 years old and married with three children. She helps support her family by running a poultry farm. Costa and Regina operate grocery stores. Sanyu breeds poultry and Florence sells charcoal. Juliet wants to use the extra profits generated by this loan to pay her grandchildren's school fees.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for their businesses

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Mrs. Uy K., 26, is married with one school-aged child and works selling different kinds of biscuits and candies to a number of students passing by. Her husband works at a hotel, making around $3 each day.

Mrs. Uk K. hopes to use this loan to purchase more products to expand her little business; the remainder of the money will be used to buy a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase more products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Erisa B(Iv) Group

texts.en:
Alice is 47 years old and married with four children. She runs a retail store. Betty has a charcoal-selling business. Rita runs a grocery store. Juliet sells cold drinks and Mary is a poultry farmer. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, Alice wants to start a new business raising pigs.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for their businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Erisa C(I) Group

texts.en:
Anne Kivumbe is 29 years old and married with two children. She makes a living renting out movies from her video library. Margret and Harriet sell charcoal. Catherine and Juliet are poultry farmers. All five women will use the loan to buy more items to offer to their customers. Anne will use the additional income made possible by the loan to pay school fees for her children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more videotapes, DVDs and VCDs and other items to offer customers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Erisa C (Ii) Group

texts.en: Betty M. sells soft drinks for a living and needs to acquire new inventory. Oliver has a stall in the local market and wants to buy additional produce. Margret runs a retail shop and wants to increase the number of items she has for sale. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, Betty will pay her children's school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator and several types of items to sell

loans.name: Erisa C(Iii) Group

texts.en: Racheal is 40 years old and married with three children. She makes a living for herself and her family selling charcoal on a retail basis. She and four her associates have applied for a loan to buy more charcoal to sell, and to open up a wholesale business. Racheal will pay her children's school fees.with the extra profits made possible by this loan.

loans.use: To expand a charcoal-selling business and become a wholesaler

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en: Mahsuda S. lives in the Nausky region and is married with 5 children. She applied to MicroInvest in 2006 and with her loan greatly improved her business. Now she has her own trade outlet in the food bazaar where she sells tea, sugar, condensed milk and vegetable oil. She is experienced in this business for over 5 years. She is now requesting a loan for  business developemnt and importing new goods.

loans.use: for importing new goods and for business development purposes

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en: Mukarram I. lives in the Nausky region and is married with 2 children. She has been A client of MicroInvest since 2003 because she heard so many successful stories from friends on the MicroInvest loan circle. She started her business from scratch but with the time she opened her candy own shop in the food bazaar. She sells a wide-side assortment (candies, biscuits etc) that she purchases directly from suppliers. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more sweets.

loans.use: for the business development and assortment wideness

loans.name: Oliya

texts.en: Oliya N. lives in the Nausky region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. Mrs. N. is an active client of MicroInvest since 2003 that recommends her as a very reliable client. She started her business from scratch and with time she opened her own trade outlet selling sweets in the food bazaar. She has a wide-side assortment (the different sorts of candies, biscuits and etc) which she purchases from suppliers. The prices for her good are lower than those of the bazaar and she therefore has repeat customers. She is now requesting a loan for six months for purchasing more sweets.

loans.use: for purchasing new sweets

loans.name: Erisa C(Iv) Group

texts.en:
Angella is 35 years old and married with four children. She sells raw foodstuffs in her town's local market, and has joined with several friends to secure a loan that will allow them to buy more items to offer to their customers. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, Angella intends to open up a beauty salon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell in a local market

loans.name: Bokasa A Group

texts.en:
Christine is 32 years old, married and has five children. She runs a wholsesale business that distributes goods to various retail merchants. Hasifa offers tailoring services. Jannet and Ritah both have retail shops, and Porssy sells groceries. Christine wants to use the extra profits earned by her business to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for several business.

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en: Erkin K. lives in the Nausky region and is married with 4 children. He is a client of MicroInvest since 2003;  an active client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and applies permanently for business support loans. He started his business with selling small housewares and now has his own outlet selling haunches, brooms, clothespins and bath sponges that he purchases from suppliers. The prices for his goods are lower than the bazaar's prices and therefore he has repeat customers. He is requesting a loan to purchase new goods.

loans.use: for purchase of new inventory

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika E. lives in the Nausky region and is married with 4 children. She decided to become a client of MicroInvest in 2006 because she heard so many successful stories from friends on the MicroInvest loan circle. Malika is very experienced in this business (about 5 years) because she has been working in this family business from her young days. She is currently requesting a loan to purchase a milk producing cow.

loans.use: for the purchase of a milk producing cow

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en: T. Ilhom lives in the Nausky region and he is married with 2 children. He is the client of the MicroInvest since 2004 that recommends him as a motivated client.  He is engaged in the home business of livestock raising and sale. He is experienced in this business because has been engaged in this business since his early years when he helped his father. His wife also helps out in this business.  He is requesting a loan to purchase a bull.

loans.use: for the purchase of a bull

loans.name: Lufula B(I) Group

texts.en:
Hellen is 40 years old and divorced with six children. She sells used clothes. Mary sells raw foodstuffs in the market. Maureen and Goretti also sell used clothes. Hellen intends to use the extra profits from her business to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her business and start purchasing used shoes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Lufula B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 48-year-old widow with 4 children. She sells used clothes. With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en: Khasan B. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. He decided to become the client of MicroInvest in 2006 because he heard many successful stories about it from his friends who had benefitted from its loans. Increase in income helped him return his previous loan. Mr.B. is engaged in the home business livestock raising . He also works as a security guard in the food bazaar in the Nausky region.  He is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of fodder for his livestock.

loans.use: for purchase of fodder

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheang C. L., 38, is the mother of three children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife, cooking food and looking after her school-age children, so all of her famiL.’s expenses are covered by her husband who works as a mechanic and typicalL. earns around $10 each day in revenue.

Mrs. Cheang C. L. has requested a loan to enable her husband to purchase more mechanic's supplies and more spare parts to use in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more mechanic's supplies and spare parts for her husband to expand his business

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en: Farogat B. ives in the Nausky region and is married with 3 children. She applied her first loan to MicroInvestin in 2005 and thanks to the received loan she improved her business tremendously. She now trades mens wear n the flea bazaar and has several repeat customers. She is experienced and has been in the business for 6 years.  She is now requesting a loan to purchase new inventory and increase her assortment of clothing.

loans.use: For purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Lufula B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and a widow with three children. She has a retail shop. Eva and Jane want to use the loan to purchase more goods for their retail shops. Suzan sells fruits and vegetables. Irene wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her retail shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ortikjon

texts.en: Ortikjon V. lives in Nausky region. She is a single mother who is raising 4 children. Despite this, she is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work because she dreams as any mother about the happy future for her children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004 and is engaged in the home business of raising livestock and selling milk. Besides she works as a text typesetter. She is requesting a loan for purchasing a bull.

loans.use: For purchasing a bull

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.en: Ruziboy M. lives in Nausky region, Tajikistan. He is married and has 5 children. He decided to become the client of MicroInvest in 2004 because he heard so many successful stories from his friends who were helped by MicroInvest loans.  The business stability and income increase helped him to return his previous loans. Mr.Malloboev is engaged in the home business of the livestock raising. He is also typesetter but he continues to work in the livestock business started by his father.  He is requesting a loan to purchase a bull.

loans.use: For the purchase of a bull

loans.name: Nabweru North A-2078(I) Group

texts.en:
Phiona is 27 years old and married with four children. She owns a public pay phone and also has a vegetable market stall. Loy and Shamim both have a beauty salons, thus they want to use the loan to buy salon equipment like dryers and oils. Joan owns a cosmetics shop and wants to add inventory. Phiona wants to use the extra profits to start selling fish in her market stall.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another pay phone and purchase more air time (phone) cards

loans.name: Donojon

texts.en: Donojon M. lives in the Nausky region, is married and has 3 children. She has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2004. She is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work because she dreams of a happy future for her children. She is engaged in the home business of raising livestock and selling the milk produced. She is experienced in the livestock business because she has been working in it since she was a young girl while helping her mother in the farm. She also works as a hospital nurse.  She is currently requesting a loan for purchasing a milk-producing cow.

loans.use: For the purchase of a cow

loans.name: Surayo

texts.en: Surayo A. lives in Nausky region, is married and has 2 children. She is an active client of MicroInvest since 2004 which recommendeds her as reliable. Her stable business and increase in income helped her to return on time the previous loan and to improve her business. She trades children wear and has a wide-side assortment that she purchases from suppliers. She is now requesting a loan for 8 months for purchasing new inventory.

loans.use: For purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Nabweru North A-2078(Ii) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for five months. Robinah is a widow with five children. She sells secondhand clothes, particularly suits for women. Jane has a charcoal-selling business. Benah owns a retail shop and wants to use the loan to buy a fridge. Amina has a canteen and she intends to use the loan to increase inventory. With the extra profits from her business, Robinah intends to reinvest and also construct a strong counter with a safe whre she can keep the money form daily sales. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop so as to make more profits.

loans.name: Nabweru North A-2078(Iii) Group

texts.en: The group has been together for five months. Evelyn is married with two children. She sells both used shoes and clothes. Teddy wants to use the loan to buy a dryer for her salon. Allen sells used clothes. Jane is a tailor and she intends to purchase more cloth and material with the loan. Evelyn wants to use the extra profits from her business to complete her house that is under construction, that is plastering and cementing it. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To stock more clothes and shoes thus expand business

loans.name: Nabweru North A-2078(Iv) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for five months. Jane is 41 years old and married with four children. She sells raw foods in the market. Jane wants to use the extra profits to cater for the childrens' school fees and other necessities like clothing and medical care. Damalie sells used clothes and wants to add inventory with the loan. Prisca has a poultry business and wants to use the loan to purchase drinkers (for poultry to drink from) and poultry feeds. Zaina sells charcoal. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more raw foods from villages

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is an enterprising business owner from Pavlograd in central Ukraine. She has been in business for about 20 years, gaining much valuable experience and developing a solid enterprise. She currently operates two businesses. One is a clothing sales business. She has several kiosks at a market in Pavlograd where she sells both men’s and women’s clothing. In addition to clothing sales, she also owns a hair salon. Ludmila is married and has one grown son who was just recently married.

Ludmila requested a short term loan to give her additional working capital and help purchase some women’s winter coats to sell in the market. Additional capital gives Ludmila the ability to increase her income. We are happy for another opportunity to help this dedicated, sharp business owner continue to operate a successful enterprise.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Andryi

texts.en:
Andryi is married with a daughter. His family lives in Drogobych. Andryi is a private entrepreneur selling electrical goods. His small business is well known in the city, for he sells merchandise at wholesale prices and has a good distribution network. Andryi has been in this business since 2004. Currently, he has about $3000 of gross income every month and about $1000 of net profit.

Andryi has good credit history in different crediting institutions. He usually uses loans he receives to purchase electrical goods in neighboring Poland wholesale and then sell them in Ukraine at retail prices. His business has been running well recently, and he could even purchase a nice little house and a car. Today Andryi is requesting a loan of $1200 to expand his services in Drogobych and attract more customers to his venture. Andryi is very energetic and determined. He is a true businessman motivated by achievement. We believe his character and hard work will help him not only set high goals but also reach them through application of his versatile skills.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 36 year-old Editha B.. She is single with four children, ages 2, 4, 6, and 8, and has one other dependent who is her nephew.

In 2007 Editha established a café business. Editha has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requires a loan of $875 in order to purchase additional stocks of ingredients and soft drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support; hence, poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and soft drinks in bulk.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.name: Jam Som Group

texts.fr:
Jam Son is a group from the eco village of Mbam who is involved in market gardening. The choice of this activity was made by the screaming lack of vegetables in the region while the population and the hotel industry are forced to obtain vegetables outside of the region. This creates speculation on the prices and causes high costs of living for our households, comprised mostly of poor people. This is how the group Jam Som, in the framework of their struggle against poverty and the improvement of living conditions of the population, is soliciting a loan to bring forth this project.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Jam Som est un groupement de l'éco village de Mbam qui s'active sur des ativités de maraîchage. Le choix de cette activité est dû au manque criard de légume dans la zonne alors que les populations et les structure hôtelier sont obligées de se procurer des légumes en dehors de la zone ce qui cré une spéculation sur les prix et provoque la chéereté de la vie dans nos ménages composés de pauvres. C'est ainsi que le groupement Jam Som , dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté et aussi l'améllioration des cadres de vie de populartions sollicite un prêt afin de mettre a jour ce projet.

loans.use:
Market gardening -

Maraîchage

loans.name: Elburus

texts.ru:
Elburus H. was born in 1977. He is single and currently lives in Agsu. He has been raising cattle for the past 3 years. Elburus started his business with just three cows. Now, with god's help, he has more. Elburus wants to buy more cows, but he does not have enough money. This is why he wrote a letter asking for help with a loan to the local microcredit agency Normicro.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Гусейнов Эльбрус 1977 года рождения. Холост,данный момент проживает в Ахсуниском районе. Уже три года занимается скотоводством . Когда начинал этот бизнес у него было всего три голов скота . Теперь слава богу по больще стало. Эльбрус хочеть купить еще коров. Но ему не хватает средство. По этому он написал заявление в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Mrs. Faith I. is an LAPO client. She sells fish and provisions (such as biscuits in cartons). She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 39 years old and married with 4 children.

Faith needs a loan of $700 to buy more fish and provisions to sell. She studied the business for 6 weeks and started her own in 2005.

loans.use: To buy more fish and provisions for sale

loans.name: Mounir

texts.en:
Mounir is a 53 year-old man who lives and works in south Lebanon, in the region of Saida. Mounir has four children.

He owns a sweets store and at this time, needs a loan to buy provisions for his business. Mounir needs to generate enough revenues to help him pay his children's school tuition fees. He hopes that this initial loan will help boost his business to fund his children's much-needed education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is an LAPO member. She sells bags of rice and beans. She is married with 6 children and she is 35 years old.

Christiana has been in business since 1994. She needs a loan of $600 to buy more bags of rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is married and he is 40 years old. He has a business of selling foodstuffs. He has been in this business since 1997. Jerry buys the foodstuffs in his village and sells to people in the community.

Jerry is a member of LAPO and needs a loan of $1,050 to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in larger quantity to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria O. has a catering business. She is an LAPO member. She is 43 years old and married with four children.

Maria needs a loan of $600 to buy more materials and flour for her business. She studied the business for 6 months and started hers in 1999.

loans.use: To buy more materials and bags of flour for the business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 49 year-old man who lives and works in the region of Saida in south Lebanon. Ahmad is the father of 10 children.

In order to support himself and his family, he runs a grocery store. At this time, Ahman needs a loan to buy additional merchandise for his business. To increase his revenues, Ahmad also grows beans. This is the third time Ahmad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Esmail

texts.en:
Esmail is a 26 year-old man who lives and works in south Lebanon, in the region of Saida. Esmail is also the father of two children.

Esmail owns a grocery store and needs a loan to buy merchandise for his business. Esmail is planning to help his brother finance his wedding; therefore, he needs to increase his income. This is the fourth time Ahmad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth O. sells foodstuffs. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria.

Ruth needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She started the business in 1993.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is a 46 year-old man who lives and works in south Lebanon, in the region of Saida. He is also a father of three children.

Ramzi is a car mechanic and needs a loan to buy tools for his business. Ramzi is an ambitious man; he has expanded his business by offering oil change services. This is the fourth time Ahmad is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. He is hopeful that an initiA. loan of $1,200 will assist in his investment of additionA. tools.

loans.use: To buy tools for his business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 45 year-old man who lives and works in south Lebanon, in the region of Saida, with his three children.

Mohamad's full-time profession is making ready-made food. He now needs a loan to help him open a bird shop. Mohamad is an ambitious man; he is planning to diversify his income sources. This is the fourth time Ahmad is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To help him open a birds' shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42 year-old man who lives and works in south Lebanon, in the region of Saida. He is a retailer and a wholesaler of house products.

Ali needs a loan to buy merchandise for his business. This is the third time Ahmad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is hopeful that with a loan, he will be able to increase his home product sales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is a 46 year-old man who lives and works in south Lebanon, in the region of Saida. Atef is a father of two children and is the owner of a computer store.

Atef needs a loan to buy computer parts for his business. This is the third time Atef is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. Previously, Atef worked in the electrical sector, but unfortunately, he suffered from injuries and had to change professions.

loans.use: To buy computer parts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells drinks and provisions. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 39 years old and married with 3 children.

Mary needs a loan of $525 to buy more drinks and provisions to sell. She studied this business for two years and started hers in 1999.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. is 38 years old and married with four children. She is an LAPO client and sells drinks and provisions for her business. She is from Edo State, Nigeria.

Helen needs a loan of $525 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She studied the business for 3 years and started hers in 2002.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria E. has a business of selling provisions and drinks. She is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She is an LAPO client from Edo State, Nigeria.

Victoria needs a loan of $875 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale. She has been in this business since 1997.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and other provisions for sale

loans.name: Agueda De Jesús

texts.es:
Mrs. Agueda Gonzáles is a lady who sells soft drinks, in the department of Leon in Nicaragua. For most of her life, Agueda has struggled in order to be able to bless her two children with schooling, since she must take care of these little ones by providing support for all their needs. She decided to sell soft drinks which she makes herself, as well as carbonated sodas, with the goal of helping out her husband, since he does not earn enough to maintain their household.

She has had her soft drink business for 15 years, selling in the food section inside the central market of Leon. In order to improve her standard of living and that of her business, for the past 4 years she has received loans from Ceprodel, which have had a strong impact on her business since she has been able to acquire larger quantities of ingredients to make the soft drinks and in addition, to acquire larger quantities of carbonated sodas to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Agueda Gonzáles es una dama que se dedica al negocio de la venta de refrescos en el departamento de León en Nicaragua., la mayor parte de su vida la Sra. Agueda se ha esforzado para poder bendecir a sus dos hijos con los estudios ya que debe de cuidar a estos pequeños brindándoles apoyo en sus necesidades. Decide vender refrescos elaborados por ella misma y de igual manera gaseosas con el único fin de apoyar a su esposo por el hecho de que su trabajo no percibe las ganancias suficientes para mantener su hogar.

Hoy en día tiene 15 años de tener el negocio de la venta de refrescos vendiéndolos en el sector de alimentos al interior del mercado central en León y para poder mejorar su condición de vida y el de su negocio, desde hace 4 años viene realizando créditos con Ceprodel que le han impactado fuertemente en su negocio ya que adquiere mayores cantidades de materia prima para elaborarlos y además adquiere mayores cantidades de gaseosas para brindarlas a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make soft drinks and also to buy carbonated sodas

loans.name: Lametu

texts.en: Lametu's business is selling and milling rice. She is 50 years old and married with 10 children. She needs a loan of $700 to buy a milling machine and more bags of rice to sell. Lametu is from Agbede in the Edo State of Nigeria. She started in the business 30 years ago.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and a milling machine

loans.name: Vick

texts.en: Vick owns a restaurant where she sells food and drinks. She is 34 years old and married with one child. She is from Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria. Vick needs the loan of $875 to buy a fridge and small generator. She has been an LAPO member for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and a small generator

loans.name: Aly

texts.en:
Aly is a business woman, mother, and community leader.  She has a store in her house where she sells groceries to the populace of San Juan, district of La Banda de Shilcayo, province and department of San Martin.  In the store she provides her community with the goods they want so they don’t need to walk to the market on the other side of town.  She says since starting the business two years ago she has experienced much success.

Aly is 30 years old, has two children, and lives with her boyfriend.  Her children are young and she is happy she gets to work from home and spend time with them.  She started her business to help support her family’s financial needs.  Her boyfriend is very supportive and helps her with some of the more physically demanding work.  Aly never had the opportunity to study at a University so she is determined to send her children there.

Aly is the founding member and treasurer of her community bank Las Margaritas.  They now have 30 members.  She is always seeking new members but says it’s often difficult to find women that are responsible and punctual with their finances; Aly is very strict.  Aly is requesting a loan of S/. 1,800 that she will repay in six months and to invest into her store.  With the loan she will restock old products and add new popular goods.  Aly is confident this loan will help her business achieve a new level of success.

loans.use: She will restock old products and add new popular goods

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Bilda

texts.en:
Bilda is a fun ambitious business woman.  She lives in district San Jose de Sisa, province El Dorado, in the department of San Martín. She currently raises and sells pigs, rabbits, and guinea pigs.  She started her business one year ago with two pigs and five guinea pigs.  Her brothers also raise animals various animals and helped teach her the business.  Her animals are in high demand and she has had an easy time growing the business.  

Bilda is 33 years old, married and has four children.  She started the business to help her families economic situation.  Her husband is very supportive.  Bilda loves working from home and spending time with her children.  She works very hard and organizes carefully to take care of her business and family.  Bilda never had the opportunity to attend University but is determined to send her children.

Bilda is a member of the community bank Maria Parado de Bellido and is requesting a S/ 1,500 loan to repay over six months.  With the loan Bilda will buy medicines, food, build a new pen, and pay for some veterinarian services.  These are important investments for keeping the health and growing the business.  Bilda feels great about being able to help the family and is happy with all the new friends she has made.

loans.use: will buy medicine, food, etc

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Verónica Isabel

texts.es:
Verónica Isabel is a lady who, for the past 10 years, has bought and sold articles of clothing such as necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings, etc.

For the past 10 years she has run this business from her home in the department of León. Before this, she studied secondary school, but because of the difficult economic situation, she began to look for a way to survive and she did that by selling these products. She buys the merchandise from her mother, who lives outside the country, to whom she sends money and once she receives the money, her mother makes the purchases and sends them to her beloved daughter.

To be able to acquire the products, Verónica receives loans from Ceprodel, and she notes that this has been very beneficial to her in the sense that she has acquired more goods to sell. She needs some new loans because when the merchandise is sent to Nicaragua, she has to pay for the transportation costs, which are increasing all the time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica Isabel es una dama que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir tales como cadenas, pulseras, anillos, aretes, etc.

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a este negocio en su casa de habitación en el departamento de León. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad se dedicaba a sus estudios de secundaria pero por su difícil situación económica, busca la manera de sobrevivir y lo hace vendiendo estos productos. La compra de estos materiales los realiza por medio de su mamá que esta fuera del país, el cual le envía el dinero y al recibirlo su mamá, hace las compras y luego las envía a su amada hija.

Para lograr adquirir los productos la señora Verónica realiza prestamos en Ceprodel y según comenta le han sido muy beneficiosos en el sentido de que ha adquirido mayores artículos para la venta. Su necesidad es adquirir nuevos prestamos ya que al ser enviada su mercadería a Nicaragua, tiene que pagar un costo de transportación que cada vez va aumentando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Catia Libeth

texts.en:
Catia Libeth is an ambitious young woman from San Juan, district La banda de Shilcayo, province and department San Martin.  Two years ago Catia started an internet café to help her family earn more money.  She started the business with one computer and a table in the front space of her house.  She now has four computers and a little stand where she sells candy, phone cards, and computer accessories.  

Catia is 24 years old, married, and has two young children.  Her husband is very supportive and helps run the business when she is busy.  Being a mother, wife, and business woman can often be difficult but she organizes her time and works very hard.  Catia never had the opportunity to study to become a professional so she is very happy to have her business.  She especially enjoys working from home where she gets to spend time with her children.  When her children are old enough Catia hopes to send her children to University.

Catia’s internet café is popular and in high demand.  She is requesting a loan of s/ 1,400 to invest into her business and to repay over 6 months.  With the loan she will buy a transformer and an electrical facilities. The more services she provides, the more success she experience.  She would one day like to have ten computers, some printers, and scanners.  Catia is a member of the Las Margaritas community bank who also supports her decision to request this loan.

loans.use: Buy transformer and an electrical facilities

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru:
Ismoil R. - 40 years old, finished high school, is married and has 4 children. Ismoil would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase a milk cow. Currently, he has several cows that produce milk. With his cows’ milk Ismoil makes yogurt products, which he then sells to the locals. People have an opportunity to buy fresh yogurt products at affordable prices.

Ismoil plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Расулов Исмоил– 40 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Исмоил полученный кредит хочет использовать на дойной коровы. В настоящее время он имеет несколько коров, которые дают молоко. Из полученног молока он производит кисло-молочные продукты, которые потом реализует местному населению. Жители имеют возможность приобретать свежие кисло-молочные продукты по приемлемым ценам. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Pašana

texts.en: Pašana K. was born in 1963. She is widow and lives with her son who is studying. She has daughter who is married. She does not have any income except her husband's pension.This is her first loan in the amount of 600 KM. With this loan she intends to buy poultry and stock food and to begin poultry breeding. She believes that  she will earn some extra money and help her son to finish his studies.

loans.use: Buying poultry and stock food.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana S., before having her business selling convenience-store goods, was a housewife. However, because of the difficult situation in the country and the difficulty in finding work, she decided to formally start her business, putting up a convenience store with a small amount of capital obtained from her savings and with the help of her husband.

For the past 8 years she has dedicated herself to the business, her convenience store is located in the city of León on a busy street, and she is looking for a way to invest more in her business to capture more customers. Ceprodel has been her financial support, having granted her loans which she invested in the purchase of products. However, this has not been enough to cover all her expenses, and for that reason she will continue to lean on this financial institution in order to be able to achieve her dreams of becoming a great businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.p>

Ana S. antes de tener su negocio de venta de productos de variedad (pulpería) se desempeñaba como ama de casa. Sin embargo, por la dura situación del país y la dificultad para conseguir un empleo, decide muy formalmente iniciar su negocio poniendo una pulpería con un pequeño capital obtenidos por sus ahorros y el apoyo de su esposo.

Desde hace 8 años se dedica al negocio, su pulpería está ubicada en la ciudad de León en una calle muy transitada por lo que busca la manera de cómo invertir en el negocio para acaparar mas clientes. Su apoyo financiero ha sido Ceprodel, habiéndole brindado crédito que lo invirtió en la adquisición de los productos, sin embargo con esto no basta para cubrir todos sus gastos por lo que asegura seguir apoyándose de esta institución financiera para poder realizar sus sueño de ser una gran comerciante.

loans.use: Purchase products for a convenience store

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married with two sons and two daughters. He and his family live in Kherson. Gennadyi owns a small business offering English language tutoring and translation services. He has been in this business for five years already. Gennadyi loves his job. His passion for languages has helped him grow his business and increase his financial indicators by up to 200% over the past five years.

Gennadyi has a perfect credit history. He has used four previous loans to promote his business and improve the quality of his services. Gennadyi is constantly improving his language skills and puts a lot of effort into each project he translates. Today he is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new computer, some literature and materials, as well as do a small remodeling project in his office. We believe this loan will help Gennadyi achieve further success and gain sustainability in his business.

loans.use: Purchase a computer, books and remodel the interior

loans.name: Ciumarith

texts.en:
Ciumarith is a busy business woman, student, and community leader.  She started a cake decorating business six years ago to help improve her family's financial situation.  Ciumarith specializes in wedding cakes but will provide cakes for all occasions.  Over time she has acquired many faithful clients in the town of San Jose de Sisa and surrounding areas.  She learned the trade from her mother who had a similar business.  

Ciumarith is 42 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is very supportive of the business and helps out during the busy holiday periods.  Her children are grown and independent.  She uses the income from her business to study at a University in Tarapoto. Ciumarith never had the opportunity to go to University when she was younger but now she is studying to become a professor and help the population of her town.

Ciumarith is the president and founding member of her community bank Maria Parado de Bellido.  She is requesting a loan of S/. 1,000 that she will repay over six months.  With the money she would like to buy some new cake decorating tools so she can work more efficiently and is considering renting a store space in the center of town.  She thinks the space would attract even more customers.

loans.use: To buy some new cake decorating tools

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika owns a stand where she sells french fries and sausages in the town of San Juan, district San Martin, province El Dorado,  department San Martin.  Her food, which she sells at night, is a popular regional dish.  She started the stand one year ago to help her family earn more money.  Over this time, her sales have increased and she is looking forward to taking the next step.

Erika is 28 years old, married, and has three children.  She says although running a business and having a family is difficult, she organizes her time wisely every day and works hard so she doesn’t have very many problems.  Erika also mentioned that because she sells her food at night she has all day to spend taking care of her children.  Erika is determined to send her children to University so they can become professionals; she never had this opportunity.

Erika is part of the community bank Las Margaritas and is requesting a loan of S/. 1,000 so she can buy a larger food stand and will repay the loan in four months.  She says that right now her stand is too small and doesn’t meet the production level she needs to serve her clients.

loans.use: To buy a larger food stand

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a widow with a 16-year-old daughter. They live in Uzhgorod where Irina owns a business in the local market called “Belochka” (“Squirrel”). This is the only source of income for their family of two. Irina sells delicious baked cookies and cakes as well as a variety of candy and other sweets. Some of her inventory spoils quickly so Irina has to buy fresh merchandise every two days. Irina has a nice big vending spot in the market and offers a huge variety of fresh cookies, pastries, cakes and candy to please many different customers’ tastes. She has been in this food business for 4 years. Her turnover capital is about $2000. Last year Irina used profits generated from her business to remodel her entire apartment.

Irina is very cheerful and open-hearted, which always attracts many potential clients to her vending kiosk. Moreover, she knows how to make reasonable investments in her business, work 24/7 and take risks whenever a new opportunity comes along. Irina outlived her husband who was killed in an accident. However, she overcame this tragedy and went back to work. Irina is requesting a loan of $500 to increase assorted inventory, continue to grow as an entrepreneur and possibly open a new vending facility in the near future.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with a 13-year-old son. She is an entrepreneur in Uzhgorod, Ukraine. Oksana runs a small business in the local market selling mostly meats and sausages in the winter and vegetables in the summer season. She owns two vending spots in the market and manages them with the help of two hired employees. Oksana is very demanding of her employees – they have to be enthusiastic about their work and very friendly with customers. Oksana has an enviable passion for her business. She is very enterprising and hard-working. She coordinates all aspects of her business and purchases inventory from wholesalers. Oksana has been in this trade for 8 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about $24,000. Recently, Oksana was able to buy a new vehicle which is a significant reinforcement for her business.

Oksana has been using loans from Nadiya Ukraine to increase her turnover capital and grow her business. Today she is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a lot of merchandise for her new vending kiosk. We believe Oksana’s high competitive capacity and her enthusiasm and desire for perfection and expansion will help her repay this loan and fulfill her dream of opening her own grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to stock her new kiosk

loans.name: Indalicia

texts.en:
Indalicia is a busy business woman.  She opened a small shop selling groceries from her home two years ago in the town of San Martin, province El Dorado, department San Martin.  The shop was started with $100, a table, and shelves.  Step by step, she patiently grew her business. She now has a larger, well-stocked shop which also sells clothes, and also she started a business baking and selling a variety of delicious breads.

Indalicia is married and has five young children.  She started the businesses with the help of her supportive husband so they could meet their basic needs and provide a better future for their children.  She works very hard to care for all of her children and run her businesses.  She has chosen to save money by not hiring someone to help her balance these duties.  Her husband also works from home and has a carpentry business.  Education is important to the family and Indalicia dreams of sending all her children to University.  Indalicia loves and feels lucky that she gets to work from home and spend time with her family.

Indalicia is a part of the community bank Los Girasoles and is requesting a loan of S/. 2,800 that she will repay in 6 months.  With the money she will restock her store and add new products and services such as shoes, beauty products, and a Chicharia (drink stand). She will also buy ingredients to bake her bread. She says that she is much happier now since starting these businesses. Her family is better off economically and she has made so many new friends. In the future she plans to continue to grow her various businesses.

loans.use: To stock her store and add new products and services

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana M. is married with one daughter named Liza. She lives in Kherson and owns a small vending kiosk in the local Dneprovskyi market. Svetlana sells children’s denim clothes, jackets and slippers. Her kiosk is well known in the market for having a nice variety of assorted children’s clothing at affordable prices. Svetlana has been in this trade for about 12 years. Her business has seen a 300% profit increase since she started her small venture. Her turnover capital has doubled in that time as well.

Svetlana has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche. This is something that helped her start her business and open 5 vending facilities in Kherson. Svetlana has received and repaid 10 loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. Today she is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase the assortment of her inventory and her sales and profits as a result.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen has a growing business selling ice cream bars in the city of Bellavista, San Martin. She started the business in 2000 with $200 in capital and a freezer she borrowed from her aunt.  Karen now has six freezers stocked full of inventory and five employees. Her employees sell the ice cream by riding bright yellow bicycles with ice chests on them around the city. Bellavista is located in a tropical climate so her refreshing ice cream bars are very popular.

Karen is 29 years old, and married with two young children. Her family is very supportive of her business and help in what ever way possible. She initially started the business to help improve her families economic situation. She was lucky to have a supportive aunt who had a similar business in the city of Tarapoto; her aunt helped teach her how to manage the business. Karen loves her business not only because she helps earn money for her family but because she gets to work from home and spend time with her children. She is looking forward to and is always saving to send her children to university. Family is very important to her.  She is also happy with all the friends she has made and proud of being a positive influence in her community.

Karen is now more confident than ever and would like to grow her business.  She is a member of the community bank Las Vencedoras and is requesting a loan of S/. 3,000 that she will repay in six months.  With the loan she would like to invest in increasing the variety of flavors in her inventory.  She is always thinking of ways to provide a better service for her customers and stay ahead of the competition.

loans.use: invest in increasing the variety of flavors in her inventory.

loans.name: Lesly

texts.en:
Lesly T. Z. has a store selling groceries in the town of San Juan, district La Banda de Shilcayo, province and department San Martin.  She started the store three years ago from her house with S/. 500.  Over time, the business has grown and she has been able to provide a better service for her community.  Lesly says that she is always friendly and flexible with her customers.

Lesly is 40 years old and married with no children.  Her husband is very supportive and helps her with manual labor. Lesly never had the opportunity to study so she loves running her business because she says it make her feel good.  Before she started her business she spent her time doing house work and working out in the fields.  

Lesly is part of the community bank Las Margaritas and is requesting a loan of S/. 1,000 so she can restock her shelves and invest in new products her clients frequently ask for. She will repay the loan in four months. She is confident that repaying this loan will not be a problem as she already has many loyal customers.

loans.use: To restock her shelves and invest in new products

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. B. from San Jose de Sisa, San Martín, is 32 years old and has a business raising and selling pigs.  She started the business with $300 and a pen to raise the pigs in four years ago after her brother offered to teach her how to run the business.  She has had quite a bit of success, she sells as many pigs as she can raise for a high price.  She currently has 20 pigs but would love to have more.

Maria is married and has three young children.  Her husband is supportive and helps her with the business.  The business currently covers the expenses of all the families basic needs but Maria also dreams of sending her children to University.  Maria never had the opportunity to study and she wishes she would have.

Maria is requesting a loan of S/. 1,000 to buy medicines and food for the pigs. She is a member of the Maria Parado de Bellido community bank and will repay the loan over 6 months. The food and medicine will give her the ability of raise more pigs and earn more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy medicines and food for animals

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina A. is forty-seven years old and is married to Miguel Malgarejo who is fifty-five years old. They have a son who is a student in the middle of his second school year. Guillermina is a hairdresser who works to provide for her family. A few years ago after finishing her courses to become a hairdresser, Guillermina still was not able to pay her bills. She had to sacrifice living in the city and worked as a hairdresser traveling from town to town. Now, after two years of hard work, she has saved enough money to open her own beauty salon.

Today her beauty salon is in a strategic location in Ybycuí, a town outside of Asuncion, and has had great success. However, Guillermina needs a loan to buy new furniture and supplies so that her customers are comfortable and satisfied. She is asking for a loan in order to buy chairs for the waiting room, shampoo, new scissors and to stock up on necessary supplies.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, scissors, new chairs for the waiting room, and general supplies

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German is a 35 year old experienced mechanic. He makes a living by repairing engines. For the past three years he has been living with his wife Viviana and now have a newborn baby. They own their home which is located near Barrio Universitario Norte UV-78 MZ-3 zona septimo anillo.

German has over 5 years of experience as a mechanic and is well known in this area. He provides maintenance services for diesel and gasoline engines as well as tractors.

German's auto repair shop is located near Avenida San Silvestre, barrio Ferbo, zona Avenida Banzer al Norte KM 4.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase more tools for his shop. Specifically a set of wrenches for cars and tractors.

German has obtained numerous loans in order to update his equipment and tools, which he likes to do often. He is a very responsible person and has an excellent credit history with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

German es un maestro mecánico de 35 años de edad que se dedica al arreglo de motores, actualmente vive a su conyugue la Sra. Viviana desde hace tres años, tienen un hijo que recién nació, viven en su domicilio propio que se encuentra ubicado por el Barrio Universitario Norte UV-78 MZ-3 zona séptimo anillo.

German tiene una experiencia de más de 5 años como mecánico y ya es bastante conocido en su zona, en su taller efectúa trabajos de mantenimiento de motores a gasolina y diesel.

El taller de German se encuentra ubicado por la Avenida San Silvestre barrio Ferbo zona Avenida Banzer al Norte Km 4, en este lugar hace el mantenimiento a vehículos como también a tractores.

El destino de la presente solicitud es para aumentar su stock de herramientas, quiere comprar un juego de llaves para vehículos y tractores.

German siempre está renovando su material de trabajo por lo que saca contínuamente créditos para este efecto, es una persona muy responsable y tiene excelentes antecedentes crediticios en la Institución.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa rents a spot in a market in the town of San Jose de Sisa, San Martín where she cooks and serves delicious food typical of the region to the townspeople.  She started the business 13 years ago with S/. 50 after she moved to the town with her husband and children from Iquitos were she was raised. Starting the restaurant was her idea; she loves to cook and wanted to help her family economically.  

Rosa is married and has four children. Her husband is supportive and often helps her with any manual labor the restaurant requires. Their four children study in Iquitos and live with other family members. Rosa uses the income she earns from her restaurant to fund her children’s education. She wants all of her children to have the opportunity to study and become professionals.

Rosa is a member of the community bank Maria Parado de Billido and is requesting S/. 700 to repay over a period of four months.  With the loan she would like to invest in new utensils, pots, and ingredients for her business. These investments will help Rosa provide a better service and attract new customers.  One day Rosa would like to return to Iquitos and open a shop selling clothing.

loans.use: invests in new utensils, pots, and ingredients for her business

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Rosaria

texts.en:
Rosaria has a general store in Bellavista, San Martin where she sells everyday goods. Rosaria started the store in 2000 because she was sick of working in a home doing domestic work all day long. She says she would wash clothes and cook all day long and earn very little money. Rosaria has a natural business touch; although she had no prior business experience she had no problems starting and learning the retail industry.

Rosaria is single and has one child. With the extra income she earned running her store she was able to save enough money to send her child to a university which was very important to her. She is very happy running her business and feels much better personally because she’s made so many new friends and is now well known in her community. She has many loyal customers because she is always friendly.

A member of the community bank Las Vencedoras, Rosaria is requesting a loan of S/. 3,000 to invest into her business. She will repay the loan in 6 months and she would like to purchase vegetables, sodas, rice, oil, and milk. She will continue to improve and invest in her store. Someday soon she would like to have enough money saved to fix and add a room on her house.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, sodas, rice, oil and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is 42 years old and offers gardening and plumbing services, and at the same time rents out his taxi to third parties who work the vehicle on a daily basis. Mario lives with his wife, Paulina, they have a son and live in their own home located in the Cupesi 7 de julio neighborhood.

Mario offer his gardening and plumbing by home delivery, and owing to his experience in both lines of work, has a fixed clientele. He also has a station wagen which he rents to a driver who pays him for each day worked. This generates extra income for him. Mario is well-known for his excellent work and recommended by his customers.

The current loan request is for gasoline equipment for his vehicle and also to acquire other accesories. With this, Mario will be able to reduce his operating costs and increase his income. He has an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario es un señor de 42 años de edad que se dedica a ofrecer servicios de jardineria, plomeria y paralelamente renta su taxi a una tercera persona que trabaja con el vehículo a diario. Mario vive junto a su esposa la Sra. Paulina, esta pareja tiene un hijo y viven en su propio domicilio ubicado por el barrio Cupesi 7 de julio.

Mario ofrece los servicios de jardinería y plomería a domicilio, debido a su experiencia en ambos rubros cuenta con clientela fija, paralelamente cuenta con un vagoneta la cual la renta a un chofer que le paga por día trabajado, esto le genra ingresos extra. Mario es muy conocido por el excelente trabajo que desarrolla y es recomendado por sus clientes.

La presente solicitud es para el equipamiento de gas a su vagoneta y también para adquirir otros accesorios, con esta implementación Mario reducirá sus costos de operación y aumentará más sus ingresos. Tiene excelente antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: Gasoline equipment for a vehicle and accesories

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
For the past 20 years Gina has helped her husband sell fertilizer. Nevertheless, the enormous need for money and her youngest daughter’s illness (she suffers from Downs Syndrome) has made it so that the past 2 years she has been selling wine among her neighbors in the AAHH Sol Naciente neighborhood.

Even though her business is going well (she began selling 1 liter and now sells 7), there are season in which sales fall. She also has to travel every weekend to Chincha (south of Lima) to bring the wine, leaving her daughter alone. It is for this reason that with having the possibility to acquire a loan, she will be able to open a clothing or shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 20 años, Gina ha ayudado a su esposo en la venta de fertilizantes. Sin embargo, la inmensa necesidad de dinero y la enfermedad de su última hija (padece síndrome de Down) han hecho que desde hace 2 años, venda vinos entre sus vecinos del AAHH Sol Naciente.

Aunque le va bien en su negocio (comenzó vendiendo 1 litro y ahora 7) hay temporadas en las que las ventas caen. Además debe viajar todos los fines de semana a Chincha (localidad al sur de Lima) para traer el vino, dejando sola a su hija. Es por esto que de tener la posibilidad de acceder a un mayor crédito, pondría una tienda de ropa o calzado.

loans.use: Open a clothing or shoe store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy has always liked selling to the general public, and for that reason, some time ago she opened a small store. However the cost of renting the location was very high for her means, so she had to close the store. This inconvenience didn’t stop her. Nancy opened a store in her mother’s house two years ago.

She began with just a sack of rice and another of sugar, and today, thanks to the financing from EDAPROSPO, she can offer her customers a large variety of groceries. With the income she not only invests in merchandise, she also can help her husband support their baby.

Now Nancy dreams of having a large grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

A Nancy siempre le gustó atender al público, por eso, hace algún tiempo, puso una pequeña tienda. Sin embargo, el costo del alquiler del local era muy alto para sus posibilidades, por lo que se vio en la necesidad de cerrarlo. Este inconveniente no acabó con el gusto de Nancy, y hace dos años tiene una tienda en la casa de su mamá.

Comenzó con un costal de arroz y otro de azúcar; y hoy, gracias al financiamiento de EDAPROSPO, puede ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de abarrotes. Con los ingresos no solo invierte en mercadería, sino también puede ayudar a su pareja a mantener a su bebé.

Ahora el sueño de Nancy es poder poner un gran almacén de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha´s passion is dressmaking, and some time ago that was her main source of income. But as time went on, her sewing machines became obsolete and it became harder and harder to compete with other dressmakers. For that reason, two years ago she put in a beauty salon and 8 years ago put a phone booth in the same premises.

In addition to these businesses, three days a week Mirtha cares for an elderly couple. She does not do this for money but because of the affection she feels for them.

Mirtha´s dream is to once again have a dressmaking workshop, for which she will need money to buy the necessary equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La pasión de Mirtha es la confección, y hace algún tiempo fue su principal fuente de ingresos. Al pasar el tiempo, sus máquinas se volvieron obsoletas; por lo que le era cada vez más difícil competir con los grandes confeccionistas. Por este motivo, hace 2 años puso una peluquería y hace 8, un locutorio en el mismo local.

Además de estos negocios, Mirtha cuida, tres días a la semana, a una pareja de ancianos. No lo hace por dinero, sino por el cariño que sienten por ella.

El sueño de Mirtha es volver a poner un taller grande de confecciones, por lo que necesitaría dinero para comprar las máquinas necesarias.

loans.use: Start up a dressmaking workshop.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
What began as a craving ended up being her greatest source of income. Seven years ago, Ysabel's children gave her the idea of putting up a business to sell sandwiches and salchipapas (a dish made from hot dogs and french fries) from the front door of her house for when they felt like eating these. In spite of the fact that it went well, she had to stop because she did not have enough energy to work at her regular job.

Her grandmother´s illness resulted in Ysabel not being able to depend on her mother´s help to care for her children. For that reason, she had to give up her job and return to selling sandwiches. Now that her children are older, Ysabel would like to rent a space to put up her own sandwich shop.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Lo que comenzó como un antojo terminó siendo su mayor fuente de ingresos. Hace 7 años, los hijos de Ysabel le dieron la idea de poner un negocio de venta de sánguches y salchipapas (platillo hecho de hot dog y papas fritas) en la puerta de su casa cuando se les antojó uno de estos productos. A pesar de que le iba bien, tuvo que dejarlo por que no tenía muchas fuerzas para rendir en la consecionaria en la que trabajaba.

La enfermedad de su abuelo, hizo que Ysabel ya no cuente con la ayuda de su madre para cuidar a sus hijos. Por lo que renunció a su trabajo y retomó la venta de sanguches. Ahora que sus hijos están más grandes, a Ysabel le gustaría alquilar un local para poner una fuente de soda.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
For the past 10 years Rita has had a clothing and beauty products store in her parent’s home. In addition, she makes uniforms and clothing for certain seasons, like the school year, for example.

As this is her only form of income, Rita is thinking about opening an internet café in order to be able to support her two daughters. In order to do this, she estimates she will need around 900 dollars.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

DesD. hace 10 años, Rita tiene una tienda D. ropa y artículos D. belleza en L. casa que era D. sus padres. Además, confecciona uniformes y vestidos en determinadas épocas, como L. escolar, por ejemplo. .

Al ser esta su única fuente D. ingresos, Rita piensa poner un nuevo negocio D. cabinas D. internet a fin D. poner mantener a sus dos hijas. Para esto, estima que necesitaría alrededor D. 900 dólares.

loans.use: Open an internet cafe

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
For 16 years Anita has helped her husband, a painter, with the household expenses with her food stand in the market.

Thanks to the Ceviche (seafood dish) and Chanfainita (traditional beef dish) sales, Rita has been able to provide a better education to her two children and maintain her home.

Now that her children are preparing to go to the university, Anita would like to open a grocery store which would bring her greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 16 años, Anita ayuda con la economía a su esposo pintor con su puesto de comida en el mercado.

Gracias a la venta de Cebiche y Chanfainita (plato típico a base de res) , Rita ha podido brindarles una mejor educación a sus dos hijos y arreglar su casa.

Ahora que sus hijos se preparan para la universidad, Anita quisiera poner una tienda de abarrotes que le brindaría mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Open a grocery store

payments.comment:
La Sra. Sabino ha cancelado toda su deuda y agradece la deferencia de las personas que se interesaron por su historia.
Asimismo hace un llamado para que más personas contribuyan en el crecimiento de esta digna obra manejada por KIVA, para que asi otras mujeres y/o varones como ella puedan hacer realidad su sueño de salir adelante.

loans.name: Fraxila

texts.es:
Fraxila has been selling vegetables at the market for 22 years to help her husband, who sells sugar cane liquor (also known as rum).

Thanks to this business she has been able to own her home and pay for her youngest son's education.

Fraxila would now like to set up a "locutorio", which is a small phone kiosk or booth, where people can can make phone calls for a fee. She would also like to help her daughter with her notions store.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 22 años, Fraxila trabaja vendiendo verduras en el mercado. De esta manera, ayuda a su esposo, quien vende agua ardiente (licor de caña).

Gracias a este negocio, ha podido tener su casa propia y pagar los estudios de su hijo menor en un instituto.

Fraxila desea poder poner un locutorio, además de ayudar a su hija con su mercería.

loans.use: To set up a telephone kiosk or booh (locutorio)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue to invest in his and his parents' businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more products for her store and help her husband buy more sandals for re-sale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is married with four children.  He is 45 years old and he has been in business for the past six years.  His business is the sole source of income for his family.  Samuel has been accessing micro-loans from SMT and he is now requesting a larger loan to continue expanding his business.  He sells used clothing in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone.

loans.use: Samuel would like to improve his clothing business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan K. is 43 years old and married with three children.  He sells used clothes in the eastern part of Kabala town, in Sierra Leone.  He started his business 12 years ago, but the business started really expanding 3 years ago with the loans from SMT.  He is eager to continue to expand the business. He would like to be able to purchase more bales of clothing at a time so he can lower his expenses and increase his profits.

loans.use: Hassan would like to be able to purchase more bales of clothing for sale at a time.

loans.name: Brima

texts.en: Brima M. joined the SMT program four years ago and has accessed several small loans to expand his business.  He sells clothes and plastic sandals in Kabala town.  With five children, Brima needs to generate a good profit to meet their education and other expenses.  Brima wants to expand his business to meet his customers' demands, but he lacks sufficient capital.

loans.use: Brima would like to be able to keep up with the supply and demand of his clothing business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 42 years old and married with four children.  With previous loans from SMT she diversified her business by including simple jewelry, in addition to a few African-print cotton materials.  She has seen her business grow and would like to expand it more.  She is now requesting a second loan.
