Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ana podrá comprar zapatos en oferta para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes un precio más bajo. Con tu ayuda Ana podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Around 14 years ago, Virgina began selling prawns door to door to help her now-retired husband. Little by little, she built a regular following, customers who sought her out to buy her products. In 2000, happily, she and her family moved into a house of their own. It was then that Virginia decided to start a business, selling general merchandise, to increase her earnings and, in turn, provide their 3 children with an education.

Two of their children are married now and only the youngest still depends on them. However, Virginia's husband's retirement income doesn't stretch to pay all of the family's expenses and, consequently, she has to fight to keep the business going. Fortunately, her husband helps her tend the store but Virginia thinks they need to grow it. That's why she's asking for a US$925 loan, to be repaid in 4 months, that she can use to buy more merchandise to better stock her store. With your help, Virginia will be able to save a little money for a time when neither she nor her husband can work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace aproximadamente 14 años que Virginia vende camarones casa por casa, para poder ayudarle a su esposo quien ahora es jubilado. Sin embargo poco a poco Virginia fue adquiriendo clientela que la buscaba para comprarle sus productos. En el 2000 afortunadamente ella y su familia se cambiaron de casa a una propia. Y fue donde decidió Virginia, poner un negocio de abarrotes para poder obtener más ganancias. Y así poder ofrecerle a sus 3 hijos educación.

Actualmente dos de sus hijos ya están casados y sólo les queda el más chico a su cargo. Sin embargo no les alcanza para pagar los gastos de su casa con lo que recibe el esposo de Virginia en su jubilación. Es por eso que ella tiene que luchar por sacar adelante el negocio. Afortunadamente su esposo le ayuda a atender el negocio, sin embargo Virginia considera que necesitan que éste crezca. Es por eso que están solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener un mejor surtido en su tienda. Con tu ayuda Virginia podrá ahorrar un poco de dinero para cuándo ya no puedan trabajar ni ella ni su esposo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro left his hometown, Gutierrez Zamora, Mexico, some 20 years ago, in search of new work opportunities. When he arrived in Nuevo Leon, he found his first job, in food sales, working as a waiter for a year. His enthusiasm for the job led him to excel at it and he was promoted to cook, grilling the meat for tacos and, over time, learning how to make different kinds of tacos. Because his earnings weren't enough to support his wife and two children, he decided to start his own business and, little by little, he came to be the neighborhood "taquero" (taco maker).

Alejandro is applying for a US$200 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, that he will use to buy ingredients for making his products along with a couple of tables and chairs. With your help, Alejandro can improve his business and help his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Alejandro salió de su natal tierra Gutiérrez Zamora, México aproximadamente hace 20 años, en busca de nuevas oportunidades de trabajo. Al llegar a esta frontera encontró su primer trabajo en la venta de comidas, laborando como mesero durante un año. El gusto por su trabajo lo hizo superarse en ese negocio y lo pasaron al asador de las carnes, con el transcurso del tiempo aprendió a preparar los diferentes tipos de tacos. Debido a que con lo que ganaba no era suficiente para pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos y su esposa fue como decidió iniciar su propio negocio y poco a poco es como ah podido posicionarse como taquero en su comunidad.

Alejandro está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Alejandro podrá comprar material para elaborar sus productos así como comprar un par de sillas y mesas. Con tu ayuda Alejandro podrá sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria began her business, selling clothing, 8 years ago as a way to increase her family's income. She's carried on working because the business has allowed her to help her husband provide for their two children.

Maria is asking for a loan of US$550, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can buy seasonal clothing and offer her customers a wider range of merchandise. With your help, Maria will be able to better help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María inició su negocio hace 8 años con el fin de aprovechar una venta de ropa de oportunidad para revender y con ello ayudar a la economía familiar. Se ha mantenido trabajando hasta hoy en esta actividad ya que con este trabajo a podido ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.

María Elizabeth está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar ropa de temporada para poder tener más variedad en su negocio y así los clientes le compren a ella. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria del Socorro has 3 children, for whom she always wants to provide more. Her partner works hard but his earnings aren't enough to cover the family's expenses. Five years ago, Maria went to work in a taqueria for 4 hours every afternoon. Later, she decided to make food herself, at home, and sell it to the employees of a local company where she knew some of the workers. They recommended her food to their co-workers and, little by little, more orders for her food rolled in.

Maria del Socorro doesn't have, however, a secure way to store her deliveries and, consequently, she has to travel back and forth from home to factory in order to deliver her orders. She's applying for a US$650 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that she can buy a "stand" (cart?) for carrying her orders and, by speeding up her deliveries, increase her customer base. With your help, Maria can push her business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María del Socorro, tiene 3 hijos a los cuales desea siempre darles lo mejor, y su pareja también trabaja mucho, sin embargo lo que gana no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Hace 5 años María ingresó a trabajar por las tardes en una taqueria por 4 horas, y después decidió preparar comidas en su domicilio y ofrecerlas a los trabajadores de una empresa, ya que ahí tiene varios conocidos y estos han sabido promover su negocio de comidas, y poco a poco más y más empleados de la empresa piden comidas.

Sin embargo María del Socorro, no cuenta con un lugar seguro para poder transportar su comida a la fábrica y esto hace que María tenga que dar más vueltas para poder entregar sus pedidos. Es por esto que María está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María del Socorro podrá tener en qué llevar sus pedidos y así obtener más clientes, porque se tardaría menos en entregarlos. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: Buy a "stand" (cart?) for food deliveries.

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Ruben began his grocery business when his job was eliminated. He and his wife decidd to invest the money he received from his former employer in the business, now called Abarrotes Jethzi ("Jethizi Groceries") after one of their young daughters. Since then, the business has provided for the family.

Ruben is applying for a US$550 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that he can finish converting and air-conditioning what used to be a room in his house to a grocery. He's already operating the space as a store but he needs to finish the conversion. With your help, Ruben will be able to make his dream of having his own business come true so that he can help his daughters have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Rubén empezó su negocio de venta de abarrotes cuando lo liquidaron de su trabajo, por consejo de su esposa decidieron invertir el dinero de su liquidación en el negocio de Abarrotes, al cual le pusieron el nombre de una de sus pequeñas hijas Abarrotes Jethzi. Desde entonces este negocio ha sido el sostén de la familia.

Rubén está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con este dinero Rubén podrá terminar la remodelación y acondicionamiento del local, ya que ocupaba uno de los cuartos de su casa para la tienda. Hoy ya tiene su local y necesita terminarlo. Con tu ayuda Rubén podrá hacer su sueño realidad de tener un propio negocio que le ayude a que sus hijas tengan un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Finish shop conversion and remodel.

loans.name: Kasubi Iii B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for ten months. Aneet is a widow with six children. She sells groceries to earn a living. With the extra business profits, she intends to repay the loan and to pay school fees for the orphans. Dianah is a poultry farmer. Maria owns a small bar and wants to use the loan to buy more beers. Faridah sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to purchase more groceries and improve their businesses.

loans.name: Namungoona A Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Annet owns a butcher shop. She wants to use the extra profits to expand her business and repay the loan. Aisha and Robinah are both poultry farmers. They want to buy more poultry feeds. Edtih has a beauty salon and wants to buy hair oils and weaves. Aisha is a food vendor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women want to expand and improve their businesses.

loans.name: Namungoona B Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Ruth is married with six children. She is a charcoal seller. She wants to use the extra business profits to construct a big shelter (kibanda) for the charcoal. Sarah offers catering services and she wants to use the loan to construct a bigger restaurant. Harriet wants to purchase more clothes for sale. Milly wants to buy more items for her hotel with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (A) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Phiona is 30 years old and married with two children. She works in a beauty salon. She wants to use the extra profits to re-invest in the business and improve her lifestyle. Brenda works in a hotel and wants to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs. Christine sells used clothes and wants to purchase more clothes for sale. Milly sells raw foodstuffs.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (B Group

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old. She has a canteen for home product sales. She wants to use the extra profits to re-invest in the business. Ruth has a public pay phone and wants to use the loan to buy more air time cards. Betty has a charcoal selling business and wants to add in stock. Juliet and Specioza both have retail shops and want to increase capital.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to purchase more goods like sodas, sugar, bread and flour and to improve their various businesses.

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (C) Group

texts.en:
Esther is married with three children. Estehr, Martha and Rose all sell new clothes to earn a living. With the extra business profits, Esther intends to build a house for the family. Norah and Florence both have beauty salons and want to use the loan to buy more salon equipment.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their sewing and beauty salon businesses.

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (D) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Halima has a restaurant business. She wants to use the extra profits to buy more items for the restaurant and expand the business. Harriet wants to purchase more items for her stationery shop. Angella wants to use the loan to add in stock in her cloth selling business. Racheal has a beauty salon. Florence sells mortocycle spare parts.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (E) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year. Fatumah is 32 years old and married with four children. She has a reail shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to increase her sales and pay school fees for the children. Carol has a video library and wants to use the loan to purchase more tapes and DVDs. Patience wants to purchase more shoes for sale.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (F) Group

texts.en: Rebecca is 32 years old and married with two children. Her current busines is charcoal selling. She wants to use the extra business profits to build a store (kibanda) for the charcoal. Grace and Spe both offer catering services. Milly has a bar business and wants to use the loan to stock more beers for sale.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (G) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Phiona is 29 years old and married with two children. Phionah, Yudaya and Rita all sell charcoal. Phiona intends to use the extra profits to re-invest in the business thus increase total sales. Eva sells decorations and wants to use the loan to buy more items.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Kamuli A3 (I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Rose is a single mother of four children. She runs a salon business. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy a pice of land. Jane and Domicilia have a bar business and intend to use the loan to increase stock. Grace wants to stock more charcoal for sale. Aminah offers catering sevices.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Kamuli A3 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Olivia is 43 years old and married with six children. She makes and sells snacks. She intends to use the extra business profits to pay schol fees for the children. Annet and Harriet sell raw foods. Robinah has a salon business and wants to use the loan to buy hair driers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women woulg like to increase their businesses.

loans.name: Kamuli A3 (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Safina is 46 yeas old and married with six children. Her current business is selling firewood. She wans to start up a brick laying business with the extra profits. Zaituni sells milk and wants to use the loan to buy more milk cans and a fridge. Jessica has a bar business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Kamuli A4 (I) Group

texts.en:
Eva is a 45 year old widow with two children. She has a brick laying business. With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children and start up a poultry business. Jalia and Faith have a canteen business and want to increase their stock with the loan. Jane has a beauty salon while Annet sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Kamuli A4 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old and married with four children. She sells raw foods. With the extra business profits, she wants to start a piggery business. Sumayiya and Jane both sell milk and want to buy fridges with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to add ito their businesses.

loans.name: Kamuli A4 (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Christine is 35 years old and married with six children. Her current business is tailoring. Edith sells used clothes and wants to use the loan to add in stock. Catherine sells raw foods. Jalia is a charcoal seller and wants to use the loan to add in stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to invest more in their tailoring, used clothing, food and charcoal businesses.

loans.name: Kamuli A2 (I) Group

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old and married with three children. Her current business is tailoring. She intends to use the extra business profits to set up a tailoring training school. Agnes has a stationery shop. Effuansi and Olivia both have brick laying businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to purchase new sewing machines for a tailoring shop and training school and to  improve their stationery and brick laying businesses.

loans.name: Kamuli A2 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Harriet is 36 years old and married with six children. She runs a beauty salon. She wants to use the extra business profits to start up a poultry business. Annet and Esther both have retail shops and want to use the loan and add in stock. Justine and Chrstine have brick laying businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to buy new salon equipment like driers and steamers and improve their retail and brick laying businesses.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr:
Fati A., age 39, is married and the mother of six children, of whom five are in school. She has worked in this business sector for almost two years. Since her husband is a polygamist, she is alone in providing for her childrens' needs, which she can meet, thanks to the income from her business. She would like to use this loan to increase her shop's capacity in order to satisfy customer demands and also, through the profits gained, to help pay for the schooling of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Fati A. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 05 sont à l’école. Elle opère dans ce secteur d’activité depuis bientôt 02 ans. Son mari étant polygame, madame Fati subvient seule aux besoins de ses enfants grâce aux revenus de son activité. Elle désire par ce crédit augmenté la capacité de sa boutique pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et aussi par les profits supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy 100 cartons of canned goods, 50 cartons of oil, and various items to increase the stock for her shop

loans.name: Kamuli B3(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Rose is 45 years old. Currently she sells used clothes. With the extra business profits, she wants to construct a permanent residential house. Sauda and Harriet both sell new clothes and want to use the loan to increase stock. Daphine has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy hair dryers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Soudure Elanyo Group

texts.fr:
The "Soudure Elanyo" Group was founded by two young courageous men named Kokou A., age 39, and Kodzo D., age 34. They are both married. The former has five children, while the latter has three. Their shop was created nearly three years ago. They would like to use this loan to buy corrugated metal sheets to make gates and doors to sell.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

La soudure Elanyo est fondée par deux jeunes hommes vaillants qui se nomment Kokou A. et Kodzo D. qui ont respectivement 39 ans et 34 ans, tous mariés. Le premier a 05 enfants tandis que le second en a 03. Cet atelier est créé bientôt 03 ans. Il désirent par ce crédit acheter des tôles pour confectionner des portails en vue de les revendre.

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal sheets for making metal doors and gates for homes

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra AZIAWONOU, age 33, sells "ablo", a local corn bread that is much appreciated by the Togolese people. She has been in this business for two years and is married with five children. To meet the extreme demand, she would like to use this loan to buy three sacks of corn and two cartons of sugar, thus increasing her production capacity and finally to clear profits that would enable her to make ends meet for her and her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Abra AZIAWONOU est revendeuse de « ablo », une pâte locale qui est tant appréciée par la population togolaise. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 02 ans. Agée de 33 ans, madame Abra est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Pour répondre à la demande exorbitante, madame Abra AZIAWONOU désire par ces fonds acheter 03 sacs de maïs et 02 cartons de sucres, augmentant ainsi la capacité de son activité et in fine dégager des profits lui permettant de venir à bouts de ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy 80 sacks of corn for making a local style of bread called "ablo"

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi E., age 34, is married and the mother of five. She has been a yams retailer for seven years. This business is her only source of income. With this loan, she would like to buy 300 units of yams enabling her to manage in lean times, thus clearing a greater profit. She could then meet the needs of her children, since her husband has no job.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants, madame Essi E. est revendeuse d’ignames depuis 07 ans. Cette activité est sa seule source de revenu. Elle souhaite par ces fonds acheter 300 unités d’ignames lui permettant de gérer la période de soudure et de dégager ainsi plus de bénéfices pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants étant donné que son mari n’a pas de boulot.

loans.use: To buy yams in neighboring villages to sell at the local market

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi E. is a single mother of 3 children, all students. She has been trading yams for the last 7 years. She is 35 years old. Being single, she can hardly provide for the schooling needs of her children. With this loan, she wishes to increase her business potential so as to increase her purchases and thus her sales. This way she will be able to make a profit allowing her to provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Afi E. est célibataire avec 03 enfants tous élèves et exerce le commerce de vente des ignames depuis 7 ans. Elle est âgée de 35 ans . Etant seule, elle subvient difficilement aux besoins scolaires de ses enfants. Elle souhaite augmenter la capacité de son commerce par le présent emprunt afin d’augmenter ses achats et par là les ventes pour dégager des excédents lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of yams in surrounding villages and resale at the local market.

Achat des ignames dans les villages environnants et leur revente sur le marché local

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mariama A. is 31 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. Her stall, from which she sells goods, is set up in front of her house. With this loan, she would like to buy 5 bags of rice, 3 boxes of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, 3 boxes of soap and 5 boxes of canned goods. With this she will increase her stock and meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Mariama A. est âgée de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a installé la baraque dans laquelle elle vend ses marchandises devant leur maison. Elle désire par ce crédit acheter 05 sacs de riz, 03 cartons de sucres, 02 cartons de laits, 03cartons de savons et 05 boîtes de conserves afin d'augmenter son stock et satisfaire la demande de la clientelle

loans.use: With this loan, she would like to buy 5 bags of rice, 3 boxes of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, 3 boxes of soap and 5 boxes of canned goods to open a store.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr:
Mrs. Hélène A. is 37 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She has been running her business for almost 3 years. Thanks to her good management, last August, she opened a store for her daughter who just dropped her schooling. With this loan she wishes to stock up her store and that of her daughter. She wishes to buy 15 bags of rice, 5 bags of powdered sugar, 10 boxes of milk, 10 boxes of soaps and 15 boxes of canned goods to fulfill the demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Hélène A. est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle détient son commerce bientôt 03 ans. Grâce à sa bonne gestion, elle vient d’ouvrir en août dernier un point de vente à sa première fille qui vient d’abandonner les classes. Elle souhaite, par ce crédit, alimenter sa boutique et celle de sa fille en achetant 15 sacs de riz, 05 sacs de sucres en poudre, 10 cartons de laits, 10 cartons de savons et 15 cartons de boîtes de conserves afin de répondre aux demandes de la clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 15 bags of rice, 5 bags of powdered sugar, 10 boxes of milk, 10 boxes of soaps and 15 boxes of canned goods to increase the volume of her business.

loans.name: Makafui

texts.fr:
Mrs. Makafui A. is a, 35 years old, single mother with 3 children. She has been in her business for 5 years and her workshop is located in the front of her house. She recruited 5 apprentices but she only owns 2 sewing machines. With this loan, she wishes to purchase 5 sewing machines to strengthen her workshop’s ability to welcome more apprentices and thus more clients. Moreover, this will enable to earn more to provide for her own needs and those of her children.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Makafui A. est célibataire avec 03 enfants. Agée de 35 ans, elle détient ce secteur d’activité depuis 05 ans et a installé son atelier devant sa maison. Elle a recruté 05 apprenties mais ne dispose que de 02 machines à coudre. Elle souhaite donc par ce crédit acquérir 05 machines à coudre afin e renforcer la capacité de son atelier à accueillir plus d’apprentis et de clients De plus ceci lui permettra de gagner plus pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants.

loans.use: Purchase 5 sewing machines to strengthen her workshop’s ability to recruit more apprentices.

loans.name: Akuyo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akuyo G. is 33 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She has owned this business for 2 years and has set up her store in the big market of Kpalimé. The profits from the sales allow her to meet her needs and to partly provide for the household expenses. With this loan she would like to buy 5 bags of candy, 5 boxes of cookies, 10 bags of rice, 5 boxes of sugar, 7 boxes of canned goods. This would increase the size of her store in order to meet the demand of her ever-increasing number of customers. Thus she would improve her living conditions with the profits she would gain from the sales.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, madame Akuyo G. est âgée de 33 ans et détient ce commerce depuis 02 ans et a installé sa boutique au grand marché de Kpalimé. Les profits issus de ses ventes lui permettent de répondre à ses besoins et de supporter en partie les dépenses du foyer. Par ce crédit, elle souhaite acheter 05 sachets de bonbons, 05 cartons de biscuits, 10 sacs de riz,05 cartons de sucres , 07 cartons de boîtes de conserves afin d’augmenter la capacité de sa boutique pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de croître et par là améliorer sa condition de vie avec les bénéfices qu’elle réalisera sur ses ventes.

loans.use: With this loan she would like to buy buy 5 bags of candy, 5 boxes of cookies, 10 bags of rice, 5 boxes of sugar, 7 boxes of canned goods. This would increase the size of her store in order to meet the demand of her ever-increasing number of customers.  Thus she would improve her living conditions with the profits.

loans.name: Groupement Mokpokpo

texts.fr:
5 women founded the grouping of Mokpokpo in 2004. This grouping’s work is the purchase and resale of Kola nuts. With this loan, the grouping would like to put in place means of preservation in order to tackle the decay (of the Kola nuts). These funds will also allow them to increase their area of involvement in order to buy more products for resale.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Le groupement Mokpokpo est fondé en 2004 par 05 femmes. Ce groupement opère dans l’achat et la revente à l’extérieur des colas. Ce groupement désire par ce crédit mettre en place les moyens de conservation en vue de lutter contre la détérioration. Ces fonds leur permettront aussi d’élargir leurs zones d’interventions pour acheter plus de marchandises pour la revente.

loans.use: Installation of their preservation store and growth of their working capital.

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en: Josephina, age 27, is married with a toddler. She started a tailoring business in 2004 where she works from 8am to 6pm daily. From this business, she can make a monthly profit of about $90. She now hopes for a loan to expand her services in order to increase her profit. She belongs to a loan group called Jitelyemee, which totals 34 members who ensure that they each pay back their loans.

loans.use: To expand tailoring services

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, age 32, is married with 2 children (ages 7 and 10). She has a business of selling clothes - underwear, fabrics, and sarongs - from 10am to 2pm daily, which she started in 2006. From this business, she can make a monthly profit of about $30. She hopes for a loan to increase her sales. She is a member of a loan group called Thimaini, which totals 27 members who ensure that they all pay back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Juana's Group

texts.en:
Juana, Dina, and Liliana are members of the community bank “Desarollo”. They have been associates for four months, two years, and four years respectively. In that time they have learned good business practices such as saving, punctuality, and responsibility. They have also learned values such as respect.

Juana is 27 years old and has three children. She has had a business making bricks for the past five years. She learned this trade while working in a larger brick-making operation but prefers having her own business.

Dina is 22 and has two children. She owns a bakery. Dina makes bread and then sells it from a stand in the town market.

Likewise, Liliana is in her 20s. She is 24 and has one child. Four years ago Liliana used a loan from her community bank to start a business selling fish. She sells the fish from a stand in front of her house.

Juana, Dina, and Liliana need loans of 800, 1000, and 800 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying more business supplies. With the loans they will able to buy in bulk and receive a lower price. With the community bank each women has an interest-earning savings account. Juana, Dina, and Liliana plan to use their savings on their homes. They all dream that their children will have better lives and continue to move up in the world.

loans.use: Juana, Dina, and Liliana need loans of 800, 1000, and 800 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying more business supplies.  With the loans they will able to buy in bulk and receive a lower price.

loans.name: Beatriz's Group

texts.en:
Salustia, Beatriz, and Epifania have been members of the community bank “Cusi Urpi” for 9, 1, and 7 years respectively. In that time they have learned to save, and to work mO. effectively. In their community bank they feel like a family.

Salustia is 39 years old. She has seven children, the oldest of whom is 22 and the youngest is 3. Salustia buys grains and animals such as cows and sheep in the country and then sells them at the market in Ayacucho.

Beatriz is 25 years old and has a one-year-old daughter. She has been selling grocery staples such as flour, rice, and sugar for one year. BefO. that she and her husband drove a motorcycle taxi, but now they are both able to work.

Epifania is 33 years old and has three children. She has been selling firewood in the city of Ayacucho for seven years. She buys trees in the country and then chops them and sells them in a local market.

Salustia, Beatriz, and Epifania need loans of 400, 1000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying mO. grains, a cow, flour, butter, beans, and trees.

The community bank emphasizes saving, and each associate has an interest-earning savings account. Salustia, Beatriz, and Epifania are saving to further develop their business and pay for their children’s school fees. Beatriz and Epifania dream of buying their home and owning a restaurant. Salustia dreams of buying a car because her feet are tired.

loans.use: Salustia, Beatriz, and Epifania need loans of 400, 1000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying more grains, a cow, flour, butter, beans, and trees.

loans.name: Fuad's Bora Group

texts.en:
Fuad, age 36, is married with 3 children (ages 24, 18, and 12). She has a business of making and selling decorations, which she started in 2005. She works from 6am to 5pm daily, and in a month can make about $140 from this business.

In the past, Fuad has taken out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more stock. Having paid this loan back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with Eva, a member in her loan group who has a hair salon business.

loans.use: To buy decoration stock

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Melva, Norma, and Rosa Luz have been members of the community bank “Sumaqcha” for four, five, and one year respectively. In that time they have learned to be responsible and to save. They also feel like a family and the community bank’s interest-earning savings accounts make it stand out from other banks in the area.

Melva is 28 years old. She buys light bulbs of different shapes and sizes in Ayacucho and sells them in the countryside. She started this business four years ago with her first loan from the community bank.

Norma is 28 years old and has one child. For the past 11 years she has had a business selling food staples such as rice, flour, beans, and butter.

Rosa Luz has three young children. She is 32 years old. She has a stand in the central market of Ayacucho where she sells breakfasts. She has been running this business for five years.

Melva, Norma, and Rosa Luz need loans of 600, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying light bulbs, a glass display case, and a new stand.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest-earning account. Melva, Norma, and Rosa Luz are saving to buy furniture for their home, a second display case, and land. They dream of owning a store, and buying a house.

loans.use: Melva, Norma, and Rosa Luz need loans of 600, 600, and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying light bulbs, a glass display case, and a new stand.

loans.name: Salome's Nguukazi Group

texts.en:
Salome, age 36, is married with 3 children (ages 18, 15, and 13). She has a business of selling food and materials at her shop. This shop opened in 2004 and she works there from 6am to 8pm daily. In a month, the shop brings her a profit of about $64.

In the past, Salome took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more inventory for her shop. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with Hamida who is a member in her loan group. Hamida owns a small grocery store.

loans.use: To buy stock in food and materials

loans.name: Olinda's Group

texts.en:
Olinda and Margarita have been members of the community bank “Sumaqcha” for four and one years, respectively. In that time they have learned how to continue improving their business, and to save. They have also learned about nutrition and women’s health.

Olinda is 30 and has one son. She has owned a salon and sold cosmetics for the past five years. Previously, she was trained in information technology and previously worked in an office. After her son was born she preferred the flexible schedule of owning her own business.

Margarita is 32 and has 2 young children. She has been renting rooms out in her house for the past three years. In addition, with this loan she will open a small grocery store also located in her house. She says that she and her husband are always thinking of new business ideas and eventually he would like to open a café as well. Since joining the community bank she has been able to buy a television and a refrigerator.

Olinda and Margarita need loans of 450 and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in scissors, cosmetics, hair care products and basic grocery items. They dream of owning a home, or a nicer home, and that their children will finish school.

loans.use: Olinda and Margarita need loans of 450 and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in scissors, cosmetics, hair care products and basic grocery items.

loans.name: Mariam's Drink Shop Group

texts.en:
Mariam, is 28-years-old and is married with a 7 year old child. She owns a soft drinks business, which she started in 2005. She sells soft drinks from 6am to 7pm daily, and now makes a monthly profit of about $55 from her sales.

In the past, Mariam successfully took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more soft drinks. She now hopes to take out a new loan to start selling snacks with her drinks. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in timber, food, fruit and vegetables, and general items sales.

loans.use: To start serving snacks with her drinks

loans.name: Zaharia's Tunyanyaane Group

texts.en:
Zaharia, age 36, is married with 2 children (ages 13 and 16). She owns a small grocery shop where she sells general items. She started this business in 2004 and now makes a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales. She works from 5am to 6pm daily.

Zaharia has taken out a previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She was able to pay this back successfully and now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses in fish and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy items for grocery store

loans.name: Asha's Changanoto Group

texts.en:
Asha, age 32, is married with 3 children (ages 10, 8, and 6). She has a drinks business where she sells soft drinks and beer. She opened this business in 2006 and now makes a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales. She works from 7am to 5pm daily at her business.

In the past, Asha successfully took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to increase her sales. She now hopes for a new loan, which she will share with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing in clothing, tailoring, and market items.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Rehema's Changamoto Group

texts.en:
Rehema, age 30, is married with 2 children (ages 18 and 15). She owns a cafe which she started in 2005. She works there from 6am to 7pm daily and now makes a monthly profit of about $40 from her business.

In the past, Rehema took out a loan to increase her cafe's services. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose and will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in clothing, food, and drink sales.

loans.use: To buy food items for cafe

loans.name: Kapemba's Nguvu Moja Group

texts.en:
Kapemba, age 29, is a widow and takes care of her 2 children (ages 7 and 9). She owns a beauty salon, which she started in 2005. She works there from 6am to 8pm daily and now makes a monthly profit of about $70 from her business.

In the past she took out a successful loan and now would like another to help her business. She will share this with her subgroup member Mosi who owns a shop.

loans.use: To expand the salon's services

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es:
Maura Estela P. is a very capable woman, who has worked for 6 years selling coffee in the Estación market of León. She is a married mother with responsibility for four children.

Her business was born when she was working as a domestic worker, but, on seeing the needs of her family were not being met by the income of her husband, she decided to invest her savings (100 dollars) to purchase materials for making coffee.

As of today, she has a location in the market of León and she has completed loans with Ceprodel that have benefited her in restructuring her business. The small location that she currently has does not provide the facilities (that she would like to provide). It is necessary to invest in the purchase of plastic chairs and a plastic table to put in her location and thus the clients can enjoy their coffee in better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Maura Estela P. es una dama muy esforzada que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de café en el mercado la Estación de León. Es madre casada y con cuatro hijos a su responsabilidad.

Su negocio nace cuando se dedicaba a la labor de empleada domestica pero al ver la necesidad de su familia ya que los ingresos de su esposo no cubrían con los gastos del hogar decide invertir sus ahorros (Cien dólares) en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de café.

Hoy en día se ha posicionado en un local del mercado de León y ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel que le han beneficiado para la remodelación de su localidad ya que el cafetín que posee no presta las condiciones y es necesario que invierta en la compra de sillas plásticas, una mesa plástica para ubicarlas en su localidad y así los clientes puedan disfrutar en mejores condiciones su café.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs and tables for her cafe in the Estación de León market

loans.name: Consuelo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Consuelo del Carmen L. has worked for 6 years renting sanitary services in the market of Israel Lewites in Managua. She started her business because the income of her husband did not cover with the needs of the home, since they have three children and must provide for their health and education.

Upon arriving at the market Israel Lewites, she encountered a very disorderly location for which she requested the respective permissions to remodel the restrooms little by little. As of today she has completed loans with Ceprodel which have benefited her directly in that she has remodeled the locations, has bought new toilets, has bought liquids such as disinfectants and chlorine and at the same time has acquired small barrels to store water.

Her goal that has been presented is to continue working hard to achieve so that her three children can complete their studies and become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Consuelo del Carmen L. desde hace 6 años se dedica al alquiler de servicios sanitarios en el mercado de Israel Lewites en Managua. Inició su negocio debido a que los ingresos de su esposo no cubrían con las necesidades del hogar ya que tienen tres hijos a los que deben brindar salud y educación.

Al llegar al mercado Israel Lewites se encontró con un local muy desaseado por lo que solicitó los respectivos permisos para remodelar poco a poco los baños sanitarios. Hoy en día ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel los cuales le han beneficiado directamente por lo que ha remodelado el local, ha comprado nuevos inodoros, ha comprado líquidos tales como desinfectantes y cloro y a la vez ha adquirido pequeños barriles para almacenar agua.

Su meta que se ha planteado es seguir trabajando fuertemente para lograr que sus tres hijos puedan llegar a culminar sus estudios y ser profesionales de éxito.

loans.use: To buy toilet paper and disinfectants.

loans.name: Cristobal Rommel

texts.es:
Cristobal is a young man who lives in the neighborhood of Milgaro de Dios (God's Miracle). Due to the lack of job opportunities, he found himself in search of something that would bring income to his family. From this need and from his love of computers, a business idea was born. He attends churches to record songs they make there, which afterwards, he edits the sounds to make CDs or DVDs for sale. When he can get free time, he also fixes computers for his neighbors. The loan he requests is to start building a recording studio.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator. Cristobal es un joven que habita en el barrio Milagro de Dios, debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo se vió en la necesidad de buscar una actividad que le diera el ingreso de su familia. Es de ahí y de su gusto por la computación como nació la idea de su negocio, él se dedica a asistir a las iglesias a grabar los cantos que ahí se hacen, para después por medio de su computadora limpiar el sonido y grabar los cantos ya sea en cd o dvd, para después venderlos a la gente que se los solicita. En el tiempo que logra tener libre también se dedica a dar mantenimiento de computadoras a sus vecinos. El préstamo lo necesita para empezar las inversiones para hacer su estudio de grabación que en el momento son sus aspiraciones.

loans.use: to build a recording studio

loans.name: Rosa Adilia

texts.es:
Rosa lives in the La Primavera neighborhood of Managua. She is a single mother and has a handicapped son. Doña Rosa has a beauty salon, which she puts a lot of effort into since her son's disability generates a lot of expenses due to the care that he needs. Through the years, Rosa has grown considerably, and has managed to establish her salon with the necessary accessories to give her clients good service. With the profits that her salon generates, she has been able to construct her house little by little. She needs this credit to be able to construct her kitchen and to continue supporting her dream of having a decent house for her and her son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Rosa habita en el barrio La Primavera de Managua, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo discapacitado. Doña Rosa tiene un salón de belleza al que ella le da su mayor esfuerzo ya que la incapacidad de su hijo la lleva a generar más gastos, por los cuido que éste merece. A través de los años Rosa ha crecido considerablemente al lograr establecer su salón de belleza con los accesorios necesarios para dar un buen servicio. Con las ganancias que genera el salón de belleza ha ido construyendo su casa poco a poco. Necesita el crédito para construir su cocina y seguir aportando a su seño de tener una casa digna para ella y su hijo.

loans.use: To purchase bricks, cement, and iron to construct a kitchen

loans.name: Roger Ivan

texts.es:
Roger Cross is a gentleman that works selling delicacies, candies and crackers by walking in the Mayoreo market of Managua. His business was born 20 years ago with the purchase of small quantities of products, which he resold all around the outskirts of the market.

Confronted at present by the difficult situation of his nuclear family, composed of his wife and three children, he decided to invest his few savings in the purchase of products, obtaining them through loans from Ceprodel (16 loans) that he has invested directly in the purchase of the crackers, delicacies and caramels.

The need that confronts Mr. Cross is the acquisition of his products. His goal is to obtain a section in the market where he can sell more products to improve the financial condition of his family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Roger C. es un caballero que se dedica a la venta ambulante de golosinas, caramelos y galletas en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua. Su negocio nace hace 20 años con la compra de pequeñas cantidades de productos que los comercializa por todos los alrededores del mercado.

Por la difícil situación que actualmente atraviesa su núcleo familiar compuesto por su esposa y tres hijos, decide invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de sus productos, obteniéndolos por medio de prestamos realizados en Ceprodel (16 créditos) que los ha invertido directamente en la compra de las galletas, golosinas y caramelos.

La necesidad que atraviesa el señor C. es la adquisición de sus productos y su meta es llegar a obtener un tramo en el mercado donde comercialice mas productos para mejorar su condición financiera en su familia.

loans.use: To buy delicacies, candies and crackers

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena is 51-years-old. She is a single mother of 2 sons, one who is 25, and one who is 30. Both are now independent. Her 25-year-old son helps her at her grocery store after work. They live in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood, one of the largest and oldest neighborhoods of Managua. Doña María Elena has had this grocery store for more than 15 years, and it has grown over the years. In her store, she sells basic products for the home and cosmetics. Doña María Elena is requesting this credit to buy school supplies like notebooks, pencils, uniforms, shoes, etc., since classes are about to start. This is the right moment to invest in this merchandise and to obtain profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria Elena tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, uno de 25 años y otro de 30 años, ambos ya son independientes. Su Hijo de 25 años después de horas laborales le ayuda en la pulpería, habitan en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano uno de los barrios más grandes y más antiguos de Managua. Doña Maria Elena tiene ya más de 15 años de tener esta pulpería que con los años va creciendo un poco más. En su pulpería ella vende productos básicos del hogar y cosméticos. Doña Maria Elena solicita el crédito para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapices, uniformes, zapatos, etc. ya que las clases están por empezar, y es el momento adecuado para colocar esta mercadería y obtener más ganacias.

loans.use: Purchase of school uniforms and notebooks

loans.name: Aboubakar

texts.fr:
Mr. Aboubakar Y. is 37 years old, married and the father of 5 children. He has been a butcher for 10 years at the big Adéta market. His main source of income is the profit from his sales, which barely allows him to provide for the needs of his family. With this loan he would like to buy 3 oxen for slaughter and resale. This will allow him to increase his sales and thus improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Aboubakar Y. est âgé de 37 ans, marié et père de 05 enfants. Il est boucher depuis 10 ans dans le grand marché de Adeta. Sa principale source de revenu est les profits issus de ses ventes qui lui permettent de subvenir à peine aux besoins de sa famille. Il désire, par ce crédit acheter 03 bœufs, pour l’abattage et la revente. Tout ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes et par là améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 oxen for slaughter and retail sale of the meat

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
A married father of two children, Mr. Kokou Etse is 30 years old and has owned a general store for the last two years. His shop is located in the Assahoun market. With this loan, he would like to increase his business capacity by purchasing five bags of rice, ten boxes of canned goods, five bags of granulated sugar, seven boxes of soap and five boxes of milk. This will allow him to meet his customers’ constantly growing demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Marié et père de 02 enfants, monsieur Kokou ETSE est âgé de 30 ans et propriétaire d'une boutique d'alimentation générale depuis 02 ans. Sa boutique est installée dans le marché de ASSAHOUN. Il souhaite par le présent emprunt augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant 05 sacs de riz, 10 cartons de boîtes de conserves ; 05 sacs de sucres en poudre, 07 cartons de savons et 05 cartons de laits. Ceci pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle sans cesse croissante

loans.use: Purchase of 5 bags of rice, 10 boxes of canned goods, 5 bags of granulated sugar, 7 boxes of soap and 5 boxes of milk in order to meet customer demand, allowing him to increase his sales and earn a higher profit so he can improve his living conditions.

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
José Dolores Sequeiro is a gentleman who is dedicated to the study of medicine. As of today he has had his medical clinic in the outskirts of the Mayoreo market of Managua for 16 years.

To come to have this clinic and laboratory was very difficult for him, since he is the father of two children and, with the responsibilities of home, he did not have the necessary money for the investment. Because of this, he began little by little, primarily with the acquisition of small locations and then with the purchase of the expensive materials for this activity.

Ceprodel has been his faithful helper and, with the support of the loans offered, he has managed to improve in part the conditions of his business. At present his need is focused in the purchase of medicine, so that he can offer them to his clients, and also to obtain disposable supplies such as gauzes, cotton, dispensable syringes and gloves.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

José Dolores S. es un caballero que se dedicó al estudio de la medicina. Hoy en día tiene su clínica médica en las afueras del mercado Mayoreo de Managua desde hace 16 años.

Para llegar a tener esta clínica y laboratorio le fue muy difícil ya que por ser padre de dos hijos y con la responsabilidad del hogar no tenía el dinero necesario para hacer la inversión por lo que comenzó poco a poco primeramente con la adquisición del pequeño local y luego con la compra de los caros materiales para esta actividad.

Ceprodel ha sido su fiel ayudador y con el apoyo de los créditos otorgados ha logrado mejorar en parte las condiciones de su negocio. Actualmente su necesidad radica en la compra de medicina para luego ofrecerlas a los clientes y además está necesitado de obtener insumos de reposición periódica como gasas, algodones, jeringas descartables y guantes.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and disposable supplies such as gauzes, cotton, dispensable syringes and gloves.

loans.name: Sylvanus

texts.fr:
Mr. Sylvanus E. is 32 years old and a married father of three children, two of whom currently attend school. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last three years. The income he earns allows him to pay for his children’s education. To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, he would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to send his children to school and to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Sylvanus E. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 03 enfants dont 02 sont sur les bancs de l’école. Il est propriétaire d'une boutique de vente des pièces détachées des engins à deux roue, activité qu'il exerce depuis 03 ans et les revenus de son activité lui permettent de financer les charges scolaires de ses enfants. Pour répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de la clientèle, il souhaite augmenter la capacité de sa boutique. Les bénéfices issus de ces ventes lui permettront de supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie

loans.use: Purchase and sale of spare moped engine parts

loans.name: Glenda Rebeca

texts.es:
Doña Glenda is 48-years-old, is married, and has 2 children, one who is in primary school, and one who is in secondary school. She lives in Unidad in Managua. In her home, she has a small store where she sells clothing, perfume, shoes, and cosmetics for women. She started this business 4 years ago in search of another source of income for her family and to support her husband, who is an auto mechanic. Doña Glenda hopes to invest in clothing for men and children, since she wants to expand her line of products and to attract a larger number of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Glenda tiene 48 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijos de edad, en escuela primaria y secundaria. habita en Unidad de propósito de managua. En la vivienda la señora tiene una pequeña venta, la cual consiste en ropa, perfume, zapatos y cosméticos para damas. Este negocio lo inició hace 4 años en busca de otra fuente de ingresos para la familia y apoyar a su esposo que es mecánico automotriz. Doña Glenda desea invertir en ropa para caballeros y niños, ya que desea expandir sus lineas de productos y así captar mayor números de clientes.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for men and children

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
In the Estación market of León, the sale of groceries is a very common business, there being various merchants that are dedicated to this business. Among them we find the lady Maria del Rosario C. who, in seeking a way to survive and to maintain their home, has been working in this business for 14 years.

Her three children and granddaughter depend on this business since it is the only income that provides for the nuclear family. Among the products that Mrs Maria offers are basic grains, ropes, sardines, instant coffee, brooms, etc. To improve the condition of her business, the lady Maria has completed loans with Ceprodel that have benefited her business greatly, increasing her sales due to the acquisition of more products. She has also managed to pay the expenses of her home and give a better appearance to her business. Her credit record includes 9 loans.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

En el mercado la Estación en León, la venta de abarrotes es un negocio muy común habiendo varios comerciantes que se dedican a este negocio. Entre ellos encontramos a la señora Maria del Rosario C. quien buscando la manera de sobrevivir y mantener su hogar se dedica a este negocio desde hace 14 años.

Sus tres hijos y una nieta dependen de este negocio ya que es el único ingreso que percibe el núcleo familiar. Entre los productos que doña Maria oferta se encuentran granos básicos, mecates, sardinas, café instantáneo, escobas, etc. Para mejorar la condición de su negocio, la señora Maria ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel que le han beneficiado grandemente ya que ha incrementado sus ventas debido a la adquisición de mas productos, también ha logrado pagar los gastos de su hogar y darle una mejor apariencia a su negocio. Su record crediticio es de 9 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale in her grocery, such as basic grains, ropes, sardines, instant coffee, brooms, etc.

loans.name: Corina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs Corian is 36 years old and married. She has 3 children, aged 8, 10 and 11 years, who all study in primary school. They live in Sabana Grande, a region a little ways away from the city of Managua. Mrs Corina and her husband have a butane distribution business, which generates the income for their family. The husband of Mrs Corina is responsible for distributing the gas to residences using a motorcycle. The space where they have the gas is rented, since they do not have sufficient space in their home. This product is in very high demand among their neighbors and that is why they need the loan; to be able to buy more canisters of gas and thus to be able to rotate them and always have them available.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Corian tiene 36 años de edad, es casada. Tiene 3 hijos uno de 8, 10 y 11 años, todos estudian la educación primaria. Habitan en Sabana Grande, una comarca un poco alejada de la ciudad de Managua. Doña Corina y su esposo tienen un negocio de distribución de Gas Butano, el cual les genera los ingresos a su familia. El esposo de Doña Corina es el encargado de distribuir el gas a domicilio en una motocicleta.El espacio donde ellos tienen el gas es alquilado ya que en su hogar no cuentan con el espacio suficiente. Este producto es muy demandado entre sus vecinos es por eso que necesitan el préstamo, para poder comprar más unidades de gas y así poder rotarlos y tener siempre en existencia.

loans.use: To purchase more canisters of gas for her business.

loans.name: Adzoto

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzoto G. is 39 years old and a married mother of six children. She has been in the baking business for nearly ten years. Mrs. G. has a difficult time meeting her children’s needs, as her husband is unemployed. With this loan, Mrs. G. would like to purchase ten bags of wheat flour and five bags of granulated sugar and build a second oven in order to increase her production, satisfy her customers and earn more so that she can improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Adzo G. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle opère dans ce secteur d’activité bientôt 10 ans. Madame Adzo subvient difficilement aux besoins de ses enfants étant donné que son mari n’a aucun boulot sous les mains. Par les fonds dont elle bénéficiera, madame Adzo veut acheter 10 sacs de farine de blé, 05 sacs de sucres en poudre et se faire construire un second four afin d’augmenter sa production et de répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et in fine gagner plus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of wheat flour and 5 bags of sugar to make and sell bread. She would also like to build a second oven.

loans.name: Flor Esbeidi

texts.es:
Flor C. is a woman who likes to fight to get her family ahead. She has one child and her husband works as a labeler. Nevertheless, what he earns is not enough to pay the family’s living expenses. As a result, Flor searched for a business that would still leave her with enough time to take care of her son. She began to set up a small stall outside her son’s school. Little by little, the children and mothers began to approach her business. Her business has been growing gradually thanks to her efforts and her dedication.

Nevertheless, Flor thinks that she does not have the product variety that kids are asking for. Consequently, she is asking for a credit of US $200 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, Flor will be able to buy more merchandise to offer to her customers. With your help, Flor can move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Flor C. es una mujer que le gusta luchar por sacar adelante a su familia, tiene un hijo y su esposo trabaja como rotulista. Sin embargo lo que gana no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de su casa. Es por eso que Flor buscó un negocio que no le quitara tanto tiempo para no descuidar a su hijo. Y fue como comenzó a poner una pequeña mesa fuera de la escuela de su hijo. Y poco a poco los niños y las madres de familia comenzaron a acercarse a su negocio. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo y a la dedicación que le pone a este negocio.

Sin embargo Flor considera que no cuenta con un repertorio suficiente de productos que le piden los niños. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Flor podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Flor podrá sacar a su familia adelante

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.fr:
Mr. Nelson T. is a 35-year-old mechanic and a married father of three children. He has owned an auto repair garage for the last five years. The income he earns from his business allows him to pay for his children’s education and to meet his family’s needs. With this loan, he would like to purchase the equipment he currently lacks in order to better satisfy his customers and in turn earn more to support his family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Nelson T. est un mécanicien âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 03 enfants. Il est propriétaire d'un garage de réparation d'automobile depuis 5 ans .Les revenus de son activité lui permettent de financer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il souhaite par ces fonds acquérir les outils de travail qui lui font défaut afin de satisfaire plus ses clients et par là gagner plus d’argent pour répondre aux exigences de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of mechanic’s equipment to increase working capacity

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is 48 years old. She sells indonesian salat called 'gado-gado' every day at her house. She earns $10 a day with a small profit. Her husband M. does not work anymore so she works by herself to provide for her family needs. She requests a loan of $100 to add to her business capital. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Adding to her business capital

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco V. is a very capable and industrious gentleman. He has worked in the sale of groceries and basic grains in the Estación market of León. Since he found himself in a difficult economic situation 20 years ago with no employment to be found anywhere, he decided to invest his few savings in the purchase of grocery products and basic grains to sell them.

His activity is very stressful, since one must consider that he lives in León and his business is very far away from his home. Because of this he must leave at 6:30 AM every day to take a bus that carries him to the market where he has his business and arrives at this point at 7:30 AM (An hour of transportation). Similarly it happens in the end of the day which concludes at 5:00 or 6:00 PM. All these efforts he carries out for the sole purpose of maintaining his family, since he is a husband and father of three small children.

For 3 years he has been a faithful client of Ceprodel, completing 19 loans that he has utilized to supply more products and in this manner to be able to maintain his nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco V. es un C. muy esforzado y trabajador. Se desempeña en la venta de abarrotes y granos básicos en el mercado la Estación en León. Desde hace 20 años por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de productos de abarrotes y granos básicos para venderlos.

Su actividad es muy agitada ya que a pesar que vive en León, su negocio está muy alejado de su hogar por lo que desde las 6:30 a.m todos los días espera un bus que lo lleve al mercado donde tiene su negocio y llega a este punto a las 7: 30 a.m (Una hora de transporte). De igual manera sucede al final del día el cual concluye a las 5:00 o 6:00 pm. Todos estos esfuerzos los realiza con el único propósito de mantener a su familia ya que es esposo y padre de tres pequeños hijos.

Desde hace 3 años ha sido un fiel cliente de Ceprodel, realizando 19 créditos que los ha utilizado para surtir mas sus productos y de esta manera poder mantener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Essoham

texts.fr:
Mrs. Essoham Awèdéou is a 42-year-old widow with five children. She has been selling yams at the Adéta market for the last 10 years. She takes care of her family with the profits she earns from her business. With this loan, she would like to increase her working capital in order to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Essoham Awèdéou est agée de 42 ans , veuve avec 5 enfants en charge. Elle est revendeuse d'iggname au marché d'Adéta depuis 10 ans. Avec son bénéficie elle fait vivre sa famille Avec le présent emprunt elle compte augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de satisfaire sa clientèle

loans.use: Purchase of yams in neighboring villages for retail sale at the local market

loans.name: Julia Petrona

texts.es:
Mrs.Julia Garcia sell basic grains (rice, frijoles, corn) wholesale and retail. She began her business with $100 saved up from her previous employment picking fruit.

The section of the market where she has her stall is in very poor condition and they don´t even have a roof. When it rains (especially in winter), the water floods her stall and damages her products.

Mrs.Julia has benefitted from 19 microloans financed by Ceprodel over the past three years. These loans were used to purchase greater amounts of grain. The current loan she is soliciting will be used to improve the working conditions of her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase rice, frijoles, corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
In 2003, Estefana began to sell fruit and vegetables to help her husband with their living expenses. Estefana and her husband have two children who do not live with them and who work themselves. Nevertheless, the two of them alone need to earn for their own maintenance. Martín (Estefana’s husband) works as a seller of fruit and vegetables in the traveling markets. Meanwhile, Estefana sells in a small local market. They pay their living expenses with the earnings from these businesses.

Nevertheless, Estefana’s wish is to save money for her retirement. As a result, she is working hard to save. Still, she currently does not have enough merchandise to offer to her customers. So, she is soliciting a credit of US $550, which she will repay in 5 months. With this money, Estefana will be able to buy fruit and vegetables and have more customers. As a result, she will be able to save for the time when she and her husband can no longer work. With your help, you can provide Estefana and Martín a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

En el 2003 Estefana comenzó a vender frutas y verduras, para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa. Estefanía y su esposo tienen dos hijos los cuales no viven en su casa y cada uno trabaja por su cuenta. Sin embargo al estar los dos solos en su casa, necesitan algo con qué mantenerse. El señor Martín (esposo de Estefanía) trabaja como vendedor de verduras y frutas en los mercados ambulantes. Mientras que Estefanía vende en un módico local. Con estos negocios es con lo que pueden pagar los gastos de su casa.

Sin embargo Estefanía, desea ahorrar dinero para su retiro. Es por eso que está trabajando muy duro para poder ahorrar. Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Estefanía podrá comprarfrutas y verduras y tener más clientes y así podrá ahorrar para cuando ya no puedan trabajar ella y su esposo. Con tu ayuda podrás brindarle un futuro mejor a Estefanía y Martín.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Dolores is 30 years old, she is married, and has three small children ages five, three, and eight months old. Maria makes tortillas, sells cheese and cooked beans, and also has a small local store from which she sells basic grains. Her husband works construction, but only sporadically. Therefore, with Maria’s sales, she is able to pay for her home expenses. She is asking for the loan in order to buy large sacks of rice, sugar, and beans to add to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra Maria Dolores tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, con 3 hijos menores de edad, 5, 3 y 8 meses de edad. Doña Maria elabora tortillas, vende queso y frijoles cocidos y también tiene una Mini Pulpería en la cual vende Granos Básicos. Su esposo trabaja en construcción de manera esporádica, es por eso que Doña Maria lo apoya con sus ventas en los gastos del hogar. Requiere el préstamo para compara sacos de arrroz, azúcar y frijoles para inevrtir en su negocio

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.es:
Crecencia is a 39 years old single mother, and has six children. Her youngest children are six and eight years old, and they are the only children that are under her care at this time. She lives in a neighborhood called North Laurels, where there are scarce economic resources, and most live in unfavorable conditions, where potable water is scarce. For 15 years, Crecencia has had a local store in her home, from which she sells milk, basic grains, and other products. With this business, Crecencia has been able to raise all of her children and help them get ahead. Crecencia would like to sell new products that she still does not offer her clients, such as cheese and chicken, because she does not have enough income to purchase them for re-sell.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Crecencia tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tuvo 6 hijos, de los cuales sólo dos están bajo su cuido, ya que son menores de edad, de 6 y 8 años. Ella habita en el Barrio Laureles Norte, en donde los pobladores son de escasos recursos económicos viven en condiciones muy desfavorables y existe escases de agua potable. Desde hace 15 años doña Crecencia tiene una pulpería en su casa en la cual vende leche, granos básicos, entre otros productos, con este negocio doña Crecencia ha podido sacar adelante a todos sus hijos. La señora desea invertir en nuevos productos que todavía ella no ofrece a sus clientes, debido a que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, entre estos productos están la carne de pollo y queso.

loans.use: Purchase new products such as cheese and chicken to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Paulina Del Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs.Paulina U.´s main economic activity is selling fruits and vegetables. Fifteen years ago she managed to save up $200 which were her seed money for her enterprise.

Initially, she sold her produce from a small basket walking around La Estación market. Later she got her own stall but she was not happy with the poor conditions of the stall.

She is married with three children and a grandson living under her roof and they are the reason she strives to improve her business.

Over the past three years Ceprodel has provided 14 microloans to help Mrs.U. grow her business and improve living conditions for her, her children and her grandson. Mrs.U. will use her loan to purchase greater volumes of fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
Since he was very young, Erasmo M. has been in touch with the countryside. His family dedicated themselves to cultivating fruits and vegetables. Ever since he was young, he imagined he’d be in the business of selling produce. And, fortunately, he realized this dream. At the age of 16, he began to sell fruit and vegetables in small markets. Nevertheless, little by little, he was saving money so he could set up his own shop. And now he is located in a shop that is on an avenue where there is a lot of traffic. Thanks to his efforts and the love he has for this business, Erasmo’s business has been growing gradually.

Nevertheless, Erasmo believes it is the time to inject more capital into the business so that he can buy at wholesale and obtain better prices. As a result, he is soliciting a credit of US $650, which he will repay in 6 months. With your help, Erasmo will be able to move his business forward and offer his wife and three children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Erasmo M., desde muy pequeño estuvo en contacto con el campo. En su familia se dedicaban a cultivar sus frutas y verduras. Desde pequeño que se imaginaba que de grande tendría un negocio de venta de verduras. Y afortunadamente a sabido encausar este sueño.
