Hace 16 años que comenzó a vender frutas y verduras en los mercaditos. Sin embargo poco a poco fue juntando dinero para poder establecerse en un local. Y ahora ya se encuentra ubicado en un local que está sobre una avenida en donde transita mucha gente. Gracias a su esfuerzo y el amor que le tiene a este negocio que su local ha ido creciendo poco a poco.

Sin embargo Erasmo considera que es momento de inyectarle más capital para así poder comprar a mayoreo y obtener mejores precios. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses con tu ayuda Erasmo podrá sacar adelante su negocio y con esto poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su esposa y sus tres hijos.

loans.use: Purchase produce.

loans.name: Cristina Francisca

texts.es:
Preparing and selling flour tortillas is a common business in Nicaragua. Mrs.Cristina M. has been doing this from a very young age in León and has sold many tortillas over the past 48 years in the Estación market. Very early in the morning she sells these delicious tortillas for her eager clients.

Being an elderly lady, Mrs.M. is having a difficult time moving the tortilla mix from the flour mill to the market. She needs to hire someone to assist her and has to increase her production to offset the incresed costs. To increase her production she wishes to purchase more raw materials.

Ceprodel has helped Mrs.M. over the past two and a half years with 17 micro loans that she has used to purchase raw goods which are transformed into flour tortillas. She now needs the loan to pay a young assistant that transports the tortilla mix from the flour mill to the market. Mrs.M. is a mother of four but unfortunately they have all moved away as all of them are married and have children.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in León for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. Rodrigo R. has been selling fruits and vegetables in León for the past 27 years. He began his own stall with his hard earned savings as he had allways wanted to be an entrepeneur.

Rodrigo began selling in La Estación market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall

Currently his stall is his pride and joy with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor. Rodrigo is a father of four young children that are in school. Ceprodel has provided 27 microloans over the past three years to Rodrigo and he has paid back these loans. He needs another loan to expand the business and to help provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Edith Carolina

texts.es:
To help her husband, Edith began to sell fried foods and sweets from her house. Nevertheless, the money that she earned with this business was not enough to pay for her children’s expenses. As a result, with some savings and a little bit of borrowed money, she decided to open a small grocery store in her house two years ago. Since then, this has been a business which allows her to pay for school expenses and to help her husband pay for utilities like the light bill.

Nevertheless, some of Edith’s customers are not able to find what they’re looking for. As a result, Edith is soliciting a credit of US $550 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, Edith will be able to buy more merchandise so that she can have variety in her shop. With your help, Edith can help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Para poder ayudar a su esposo, Edith comenzó a vender frituras y otros dulces fuera de su casa. Sin embargo el dinero que ganaba con ese negocio no le dejaba lo suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Fue por eso que con unos ahorros y un poco de dinero prestado decidió poner una tiendita de abarrotes en su casa hace dos años. Desde entonces ese a sido su negocio con el cual saca para pdoer pagar los útiles escolares y para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de luz y otros servicios.

Sin embargo algunos clientes de Edith se han ido puesto que no encuentran lo que andan buscando. Es por eso que Edith está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con este dinero Edith podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener variedad en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Edith podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Supply her business.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria I. has been selling cosmetics during the past 17 years at La Estacion market in Nicaragua´s Leon province.

She began her business subletting her stall in the market, but she was not making enough money so she decided to speak with the market managers to obtain her own stall. This was a sound business decision which lowered her fixed costs and helped her to reach her sales targets and increase her benefits.

Mrs. Maria Teresa I. has been able to do this thanks to the business loan given to her by Ceprodel. Thanks to this loan she has incresed her product range at her market stall in León.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Cosmetics purchase

loans.name: Carlos Gerardo

texts.es:
In June of 1998, with the arrival of his second child, Carlos Gerardo needed to find another source of income in order to pay his family’s expenses since what he earned at that time was not sufficient. Carlos began to repair furniture in his free time thanks to some of his friends, who are carpenters and taught him this traD.. Little by little, word spread and he was asked to make furniture. As such, he began to formalize his status as a carpenter. Currently, he has various customers to whom he sells his furniture.

Nevertheless, he currently does not have a sufficient amount of wood, and many of his tools are very worn. Consequently, Carlos is soliciting a credit of US $550 which he will repay in 5 months. With this money, he will be able to buy wood and tools in order to make more furniture. With your help, Carlos will be able to keep his business afloat, as well as his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

En Junio D. 1998 con la llegada D. su segundo hijo, Carlos Gerardo, necesitaba encontrar otra fuente D. ingreso para poder pagar los gastos D. su familia. Puesto que lo que ganaba en ese momento no era suficiente. Gracias a que algunos amigos D. Carlos quienes son carpinteros le enseñaron este oficio fue como comenzó por reparar muebles en sus tiempos libres. Poco a poco se fue corriendo la voz, y después le pidieron que hiciera un mueble. Fue ahí donD. comenzó a formalizarse su carpintería. Actualmente ya tiene varios clientes a quienes les venD. sus muebles.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente madera y varias D. sus herramientas ya están muy desgastadas. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito D. US $550 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo D. 5 meses y con este dinero Carlos podrá comprar mercancía para poder comprar madera y sus herramientas para elaborar más muebles. Con tu ayuda Carlos podrá sacar a flote su negocio así como a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase wood and tools.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel started in sales when he was very young and he acquired a liking and a knack for it. As a result, he saved and started his own business selling clothing, which has been prospering. Currently, he has a shop on one side of his house. He just acquired a shop in the Principal Market, which he needs to supply with merchandise and variety in order to be competitive and improve his earnings so that he may provide a better life to his wife and small children, who are 2 and 4 years old, respectively.

It is for this that Daniel is soliciting a credit of US $650 which he will repay in 6 months. With this money, Daniel will be able to buy merchandise so that he can have more variety in his new shop. With your help, Daniel will be able to grow his business and offer his children the opportunity to consider a career so that they may have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Daniel Empezó desde muy joven en el negocio de las ventas y adquirió el gusto y la habilidad para las ventas, lo que lo llevó a ahorrar e iniciar su propio negocio de venta de ropa, el cual ha ido prosperando, actualmente tiene un local a un costado de su domicilio y acaba de adquirir un local en el mercado Principal, para el cual necesita surtir con mercancía y variedad, para ser competitivo y mejorar sus ingresos para poder brindarles un mejor estilo de vida a su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos de 2 y 4 años cada uno.

Es por eso que Daniel está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Daniel podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener más variedad en su nuevo local. Con tu ayuda Daniel podrá crecer sus locales y así poder ofrecerles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his new shop.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia has a “ventorrillo”, a business selling chicken, salad, vegetables and ripe fruits in Chácaro, in the community of Yamasá. Vegetables and fruits are commonly consumed by people of that community. Therefore, her products are in high demand.

Currently, Cecilia has a weekly profit of USD 60.00. She is forty-six years old; she and her husband have three school-going sons. Her husband works for a construction company. For more than fifteen years, she has been running her business, which is the principal source of income of the family.

Cecilia would like to give her family a better standard of living. With her loan, she will purchase more products to replenish her small store.

loans.use: To make the purchases of vegetables and fruits to replenish a small store.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is a forty-two year-old businesswoman who lives in Chácaro, in the community of Yamasá. She is married, with four children (two boys and two girls) who all attend school.

Gabriela has been running a grocery store for the past two years. Now, she wants to expand and add fried vegetables to her business so that she can increase her income. The grocery is the principal source of income of the family. Gabriela hopes she will get the loan soon so that she can start her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy new products in order to expand a small general store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is forty-five years old and runs a cafeteria in her community. She is also the mother of five children. Everyday, from early in the morning to late into the night, people in the surroundings visit her cafeteria to get traditional Dominican meals she prepares with love. Cecilia has been running the cafeteria for more than three years, and currently has a well-established clientele.

Cecilia plans to expand her business and hopes in five years’ time that she will have a big locale where she can operate a comfortable cafeteria. With her loan, she will make the purchase of raw materials to keep producing her delicious meals for her customers.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and other materials to move a small cafeteria forward.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is a young woman who is making great efforts to succeed in life. For more than three years, she has been selling perfumes and women’s clothing in order to support her university studies. María explains that her inventory is still limited but she plans on expanding the business with the loan she has requested.

María studies Education Sciences at a university in Santo Domingo, the capital, and has to go outside her community thrice a week to attend the classes. María hopes she will have the requested funds soon so that she can be one step closer to get professional and have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to move forward a small business so that the entrepreneur can continue with her university studies.

loans.name: Belkis

texts.en:
Belkis is twenty-seven years old, and she has one school-going son. Her husband is an independent truck driver. Belkis has been selling gold and silver-plated jewels for three years to the women of her community. Currently, she has a lot of loyal customers that visit her store everyday to make the purchase of bracelets, necklaces, chains and some fashionable trinkets.

Belkis expects her store to become the most well-established supplier of these goods in all the surroundings. With her loan, she will purchase more jewels in order to meet her clients’ needs and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more jewels in order to satisfy the customers' needs.

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en:
Altagracia is in her late twenties, and she and her husband have five school-going children. Her husband is a mechanic and he has his own shop. Altagracia, the entrepreneur, lives in Chácaro, in the community of Yamasá.

Altagracia dedicates herself to the selling of an assortment of natural and silk flowers. She started this business six months ago with a loan she obtained from FSMA. The natural flowers Altagracia offers to the customers are carefully picked from healthy bushes of Santo Domingo, the capital.

After wholesale purchasing them, Altagracia has to dedicate a lot of time to prepare the bouquets within her house. After, she visits other women in the neighborhood to sell her products.

Altagracia would like to rent a small locale where she can run the business. Meanwhile, she will keep walking the streets to sells the flowers. With her loan, Altagracia will buy more artificial and natural flowers in order to increase her sales volume and thus her income.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of both natural and artificial flowers to resell in her community.

loans.name: Carlixta

texts.en:
Carlixta is an arduous and hard-working woman who owns and operates a general store which she started eight years ago in Chácaro, in the community of Yamasá. She is a 46 year-old single mother of four children.

Carlixta sells a variety of products in her store, specializing in the selling of fuel and parts for motorcycles. She also retails motor oil, fuel additives and so forth. She operates that activity in a small rented local.

Carlixta is currently looking for funds in order to expand her business. Her expansion plan includes adding new products to her actual inventory and renting a more spacious locale to operate the business. Carlixta thinks her business’ achievement will help her improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy goods to replenish a small motorcycles and accesories shop.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
After eight years of operation, Maximina’s cafeteria has become one of the most popular gathering places of the community. At the beginning, things were not easy and it was almost impossible get capital to maintain the cafeteria. Now, her business’ success outweighs all the pains she’s endured to make her dream come true.

Maximina says she has to keep working as hard as before to improve things and move her business forward. With her loan, she will purchase raw materials to prepare her delicious meals. She will also buy napkins, disposable plates for food to go services, and new plates and tablecloth so as to give a new face to her cafeteria. Given this loan, this twenty-year-old mother of four children will maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and invest in other goods to make more attractive a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Mobin

texts.en: Mobin lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated and has degree in business. He has a carpet shop and has been involved in this business for more than 3 years. He imports carpets from Iran and from different parts of the country. He needs to complete his stock so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new designs of carpet and make a good income to help his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy new designs of carpet

loans.name: Abdul Aziz

texts.en: Abdul Aziz lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with one son. He is a doctor and has a drug store. He works with his son who is in university and works part-time. He wants to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to import more medicines from other countries to attract more clients and make a good income for his family. He is happy with this loan process.

loans.use: To import more medicines from other countries

loans.name: Noralam

texts.en: Noralam lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 6 children. He is an educated man who studied the University of Agriculture. He has a lot of land for cultivation but he is unable to continue working and  is facing with lots of winter snow. He wants to get ready for next summer and is requesting an individual loan to make his land ready for cultivation and start working. He is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To make his land ready for cultivation

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Abdusalom V., 20, is single and has no children. He sells winter clothing and sweaters for men at one of the central markets of Qurgan-Tube, Tajikistan. Abdusalom has been in this business for 2 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase an inventory of winter clothing. Local residents would then be able to purchase warm clothing from Abdusalom without the need to travel 100 km to the nearest clothing market. Abdusalom plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вахобов Абдусалом, возраст – 20 лет, образование среднее, неженат, детей не имеет. Абдусалом занимается торговлей на одном из центральных рынков города Курган-Тюбе. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. В настоящее время основным его товаром являются мужские зимние вещи, а именно мужские свитера. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать для увелечение товарооборота, а именно приобретение нового товара и увелечение ассортимента продаваемого зимнего товара. Данный кредит даст возможность жителям города Курган-Тюбе и прилегающим к нему районам приобретать необходимые им зимние вещи, так как близлежащий вещевой рынок находится на расстояние 100 км. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Moriya

texts.ru:
Moriya N., 48, is married and has 3 children. For 14 years, she has been selling traditional fabrics for Tajik national clothing. Moriya has a sales spot at “Tidzhorat” market in Yavan. Moriya plans to use this loan to purchase a few new types of fabric for women. The new fabrics are very popular among the local women. Moriya plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Набиева Мория, возраст – 48 лет, образование средне, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Мория заниамется торговлей национальными тканями для пошива национальной женской оджеды. Этим видом деятельности она занимается в течение 14 лет. Для этого она арендует торговую точку на одном из рынков города Яван под названием «Тиджорат». На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый вид женских тканей появивишихся недавно. Так как такой товар пользуется большим спросом у местного населения данный кредит даст возможность женской половине приобретать нужные им виды тканей для пошива национальной одежды на мероприятия различного рода, такие как свадьбы, национальные обряды и просто для повседневной жизни. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of new fabrics

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru:
Hosiyat K., 43, is married and has 4 children. Hosiyat is accountant by training. For 15 years, she has been selling traditional fabrics for Tajik national clothing. Hosiyat has a sales location at “Tidzhorat,” a large market in Yavan. Hosiyat plans to use this loan to purchase a new type of fabric for women. Hosiyat’s regular buyers will have an opportunity to buy the new fabric from her. Hosiyat plans to repay this loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Хосият, возраст – 43 года, образование в средне-техническое, по специальности бухгалтер, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Хосият заниамется торговлей национальными тканями для пошива национальной женской оджеды. Этим видом деятельности она занимается в течение 15 лет. Она имеет свою торговую точку на одном их крупных рынков города Явана под названием «Тиджорат». На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый вид женских тканей появивишихся недавно. Так как такой товар пользуется большим спросом у местного населения и Хосият имеет постоянных клиентов, данный кредит даст возможность женской половине приобретать нужные им виды тканей для пошива национальной одежды на мероприятия различного рода, такие как свадьбы, национальные обряды и просто для повседневной жизни. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 18 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of new fabric

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru:
Tolib I. is 43 years old, has a secondary technical education, is an engineer technologist by training and has 5 children. Tolib owns one cow that he keeps in his household. He will use his loan to purchase a second dairy cow to increase his milk production. Tolib will use part of the milk for personal use and will sell part of the milk to neighbors that don’t own cows and have small children. He also uses the milk to make yogurt which he also sells to locals.

This loan will allow Tolib to increase milk production and will allow local residents to purchase fresh milk and yogurt. He plans to pay back the loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Исоков Толиб, возраст – 43 года, образование средне-техническое, по специальности инженер-технолог, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Толиб в настоящее время имеет одну корову у себя дома. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести дойную корову для того, чтобы получать удои молока от двух коров. Часть полученного молока он использует на личные нужды, оставшуюся часть он продаёт соседям не имеющим домашнего скота, так как у них есть маленькие дети. Также из молока он производит кисло-молочные продукты, которые он также продаёт жителям кишлака и районного центра. Данный кредит поможет ему увеличить получение свежего парного молока, которе потом даст возможность местным жителям приобретать свежее молоко и кисло-молочные продукты. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru:
Shodigul B. is 44 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 6 children. Shodigul purchases and sells livestock. She would like to use the loan to purchase several calves to fatten and resell. Shodigul has been in this business for 10 years. Profits from this business help her to provide her family with necessary clothing and food. This loan will allow her to purchase large livestock, previously she has only raised small livestock. Shodigul will pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобошоева Шодигул, возраст – 44 года, образование средне, замужем, имеет 6-х детей. Шодигул занимается куплей и продажей курпного и мелкого рогатого скота. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести несколько молодых бычков для откорма и продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 10 лет. Доход получаемый от этого бизнеса помогает ей вносить свой вклад в обеспечение своей семьи необходимыми вещами и продуктами питания. Полученный кредит даст ей возможность приобрести крупный рогатый скот, так как до этого она занималась продажей только мелкого рогатого скота. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru:
Tohir E. is 61 years old, has a higher education, is a bio-chemist by profession, is married and has 3 children. Tohir works as a teacher in school #22 in Yavan as a chemistry and biology teacher. In addition, he raises and sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Tohir will use his loan to purchase two young bulls to fatten and resell. Every 40-45 days he will sell the livestock and will use his revenues to purchase new bulls. Tohir will use profits from the sale of livestock to support his family as his teaching salary is low. This loan will provide him with a secondary source of income. Tohir will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Эламонов Тохир, возраст – 61 год, образование высшее, по специальности химик – биолог, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Тохир в настоящее время работает учителем средней школы № 22 города Яван учителем по химиии и биологии. Помимо этого он также занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести два молодых бычка для откормки и продажи. Через каждые 40-45 он будет продавать скот, а на вырученные деньги приобретать опять молодых бычков. Полученную прибыль от продажи скота он будет использовать на содержание своей семьи, так как заработная плата получаемая в школе не слишком большая.Данный кредит даст ему возможность иметь дополнительный источник дохода. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase 2 calves

loans.name: Maksad

texts.ru:
Maksad H. is 58 years old, has a secondary education, is a chef by profession, is married and has 5 children. Maksad owns a small café at one of the city markets in Tursun-zoda called “Sahovat.” She provides local sellers with tasty and hot food. She has been in this business for 4 years.

Maksad will use her loan to purchase a dairy cow for personal use. Because she lives in a rural area, the cow will allow her to get milk to make dairy dishes and she also plans to use some of the milk in her cooking at the café. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хамрокулова Максад, возраст – 58 лет, образование среднее, по специальности – повар, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Максад имеет небольшую столовую на одном из рынков в городе Турсунзаде, под названием «Саховат». Она обеспечивает местных торгвцев вкусной и горячей пищей. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 4 лет. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать для приобретение дойной коровы для личного пользования. Так как она живёт в сельской местности, приобретя корову она получит возможность получать собственное молоко на приготовление молочных блюд, а также будет использовать это молоко у себя в столовой в качестиве ингридиента к различным блюдам. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ruzihol

texts.ru:
Ruzihol M. is 48 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 8 children. Ruzihol sells food products at the market in Tursun-zoda called “Dehkon.” Her main products are cookies and other sweets. Ruzihol will use her loan to purchase additional products to sell. She will purchase her products at the Dushanbe market. The loan will help local residents to purchase cookies and sweets for holidays and other days without having to leave their city. Ruzihol will pay back the loan over 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мустафокулова Рузихол, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 8-х детей. Рузихол имеет торговую точку по торговле продуктами питания на рынке города Турсунзаде под названием «Дехкон». Основным её товаром, которым она торгует это печенье и другие сладости. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый ассортимент товар. Товар она приобретает в городе Душанбе. Данный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать печенье, сладости в праздники и в другие в дни, при этом не выезжая за пределы своего города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 4 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase food products to sell

loans.name: Gulraftor

texts.ru:
Gulraftor J. is 34 years old, she has a high school diploma, is married and has 3 children. Gulraftor sells food at "Dekhon" market in Tursun-zoda city. Her primary goods are cookies and other sweets.

With the loan that she hopes to receive, she will purchase more goods. She buys her goods in Dushanbe. This loan will give local buyers an opportunity to buy cookies and sweets during holidays and other days without having to leave their city.

The client plans to repay the loan within 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Джураева Гулрафтор, возраст – 34 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Гулрафтор имеет торговую точку по торговле продуктами питания на рынке города Турсунзаде под названием «Дехкон». Основным её товаром, которым она торгует это печенье и другие сладости. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый ассортимент товар. Товар она приобретает в городе Душанбе. Данный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать печенье, сладости в праздники и в другие в дни, при этом не выезжая за пределы своего города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 4 месяцев.

loans.use: приобретение продуктов питания для продажи

loans.name: Zulfuzor

texts.ru:
Zulfuzor B. is 36 years old; she finished high school, is married and has 5 children. Zulfuzor sells food at "Dekhon" market in Tursun-zoda city. Her primary goods are cookies and other sweets.

With the loan that she hopes to receive, she will purchase more goods. She buys her goods in Dushanbe. This loan will give local buyers an opportunity to buy cookies and sweets during holidays and other days without having to leave their city.

The client plans to repay the loan within 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Болтаева Зулфузор, возраст – 36 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Зулфузор имеет торговую точку по торговле продуктами питания на рынке города Турсунзаде под названием «Дехкон». Основным её товаром, которым она торгует это печенье и другие сладости. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый ассортимент товар. Товар она приобретает в городе Душанбе. Данный кредит даст возможность местным жителям приобретать печенье, сладости в праздники и в другие в дни, при этом не выезжая за пределы своего города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 4 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase food for resale

loans.name: Hamrah

texts.en: Hamrah is 52 years old. Her husband K. does not work anymore. To earn income for her family, she works as a tailor and earns $40 a month. She is asking for a loan of $150 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ati

texts.en: Ati is 31 years old. Her husband, U., does not work anymore. She makes crispy chips, then sells them door-to-door around the villages. This earns $9 in income. She is asking for a loan of $125 to add to her business capital. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Rohayati

texts.en: Rohayati is a 39-year-old widow. Her husband passed away a long time ago, which means she works alone to provide for her family needs. She sells bean sprouts, earning $5 a day. Rohayati is requesting a loan of $150 to add to her business capital. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add business capital

loans.name: Ulpiah

texts.en: Ulpiah is 42 years old. Her husband P. has no job now. To earn income for the family, Ulpiah raises ducks and then sells their eggs. This earns $50 in income. She is asking for a loan of $125 to buy more ducks to raise. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Yoyoh

texts.en: Yoyoh is 19 years old. Her husband Komar has no fixed job. She earns income to support her family needs by raising chickens. This earns $50 a month. Nayah is asking for a loan of $125 to buy more chicks. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Asiyah

texts.en: Asiyah is 45 years old. Her husband Y. sells waste materials and earns $10 a week. To help her husband earn extra income, she raises ducks and earns $40 a month. Asiyah requests a loan of $125 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sarminah

texts.en: Sarminah, 42, and her husband, S., sell jack fruits everyday. They earn $50 a month. Sarminah requests a loan of $150 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Julaeha

texts.en: Julaeha is 31 years old. Her husband A. does not work anymore. To earn a living Juleaha sells food and beverages near a school. She earns $40 a month. She is requesting a loan of $150 to buy more goods. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Lami

texts.en: Lami, 27, sells rice at home to earn more income for the family. She earns $15 a day. Her husband, J., sells rice door-to-door in the nearby villages, and earns $20 a day. Lami is requesting a loan of $150 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala M. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 33 years old and is single. She rented a beauty salon in Beylagan, and has been in this business since 2004.

Kamala applied for a loan of $400 from Normicro Beylagan Branch to develop her beauty salon. She wants to bring modern equipment to her salon so she can offer the best services to her customers. She wants to bring more customers to her salon through marketing and increase her income.

loans.use: To expand beauty salon

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar S. is 58 years old, married and has five children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Bakhtiyar sells fruits and vegetables in the Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business ten years ago.

Bakhtiyar applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of $400 to buy a wider variety of goods to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan S. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Khojavend city of Azerbaijan. He settled in Beylagan with his family in1992. He is married and has two children.

Ruslan owns a spare parts store in Beylagan. He started his business three years ago. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of $1000 to buy new spare parts and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Gasim

texts.en:
Gasim M. is 40 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his family in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Gasim owns and operates a small car-repair store in Beylagan. He is an experienced repairman and businessman. 
Gasim requests a loan of $700 to buy new equipment for his car-repair store. He believes that this loan will help him increase the number of repairs he can do and so increase his business.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for repairing cars

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla A. is 57 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Leyla and her husband breed cattle. They started their business ten years ago.

Leyla has applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of $800 to buy some sheep and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy sheep

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Aflatun

texts.en: Aflatun A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 46 years old, married and has one son. He has been driving a taxi for a few years. He has applied for a loan of $1100, so he can repair his taxi.

loans.use: To repair taxi

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en: Rahman Y. is 44 years old, married and has three children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Rahman owns a small stand near his home where he and his wife sell household products and vegetables to many people in his neighborhood. Although his stand is very old and not in good shape, he has many loyal customers. However, he is caught in a cycle in which he can only re-stock the products that he sells. Rahman has applied for a loan of $600 to fully stock his shop with a greater variety of goods, maximize sales, and expand his business.

loans.use: To increase inventory to expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira M. is 36 years old. She and her husband, an engineer, have three children of school age. 

Zamira is trained as a kindergarten teacher. However, for several years Zamira has also been selling clothing. She sells men's and children's socks in the central local market. She puts aside part of the income from the business for the education of her children. She and her husband hope that their children will receive higher education.  

Zamira has received several loans from IMON over the past 7 years, and she has an excellent credit record. She is now asking for a loan of  3 500.00 somoni ($ 1025.00 US) for the purchase of new goods for resale. Zamira promises to repay the loan in 3 months and thanks eyeryone for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
Khanifa T. is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. The elder is graduating from school this year, the other children, aged 14 and 12, are still in school.

Khanifa sells confections such as spice cakes, pastries, and candies. She travels twice weekly to Khujand city and Tashkent (the capital of neighboring Uzbekistan) to purchase supplies. Her husband works as a mechanic, but Khanifa’s business is the main source of income for the family.

Over the past two years she has built up an impressive credit history with IMON. She is now asking for a loan of 2400.00 somoni (700.00 US dollars) to be repaid over 6 months. Khanifa is planning to expand her business and use the profits to buy a small store in which she and her husband will work. Having a stable source of income will make it possible for Khanifa to educate her children. Khanifa believes that education is more important than ever in today's world.

loans.use: To expand her confectionery business and buy a small store with the profits

loans.name: Kodir

texts.en:
U. Kodir is 43 years old. He is married and has two  children, a daughter, 18, and a son, 16. 

Kodir sells spare parts for bicycles. He has been in this business for 10 years. During the winter, he also sells fur hats for men. Kodir is the only bread-winner in his family; his wife runs the household.  

Kodir has been an IMON client since December 2005. He has gained a reputation as a trustworthy client. He is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase spare parts so that he can expand the range of bicycles he services. The term of the loan is 6 months.  Kodir plans to devote part of the profits to the education of his elder daughter. Kodir thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To expand his bicycle repair business

loans.name: Adozinda Pedro

texts.pt:
Adozinda Pedro M. lives with her husband and four children in the neighborhood of Zona Verde, in Matola, Mozambique. She joined the credit program in 2006 and is now on her 4th loan cycle, requesting $275 to buy more clothes to sell, so that her clothing business can grow. (In addition to selling clothes, Adozinda also sells basic groceries from home.)

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Adozinda Pedro M., residente no bairro Zona Verde portadora do BI nº 110247205V Mae de 4 filhos Vive maritalmente, é negociante entro no programa em 2006 a tomar o valor de 5000 eata no 4º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 6000 para pagar em 4 meses Vende roupas e ainda tem uma Barraca em sua casa, com o valor ela quer aumentar o negocio.

loans.use: To invest in her clothing business

loans.name: Kamuli B3(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been toegether for one year. M. is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a small restaurant. With the extra business profits, M. wants to buy a piece of land and register her children for postgraduate degrees. Hadijah offers laundry services. Robinah has a video library while Julie sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their restaurant, laundry, video and charcoal businesses.

loans.name: Kamuli B3(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Harriet is 47 years old and divorced with three children. She is a dairy farmer.She wants to use her loan to buy a dairy cow.She intends to use the extra business profits to finish her rental houses that are under construction and also to buy a motocycle. Joyce wants to use the loans to buy more beds for her clinic. Goretti has a retail shop and wants to use the loan to add in stock. Pheobe has a nursery school and intends to use the loan to expand to a primary school. Syson is a poultry farmer and wants to buy poultry feeds with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow, to buy beds for a clinic, to add stock to a retail shop, to expand a primary school and to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Anor

texts.en: S. Anor lives in the Nausky region, is married and has 4 children. She has been an active client of  MicroInvest since 2005. She is an executive client who repays her loans on time. Mrs.S. is engaged in  commercial service and trade. She started the business from the small wares selling but now she has her own trade outlet in the flea bazaar. She sells mens and children shoes. She has a direct supplier that allows her prices of goods sold to be lower than the bazaar prices. Mrs.S. is very polite and has many repeat customers. Now Mrs.S. requests the loan of 1700 STJ to expand her assortment (she also wants to purchase layettes because it is one of the high-turnover products).

loans.use: To increase her  assortment of goods

loans.name: Kamuli B3(Iv) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Sylvia has a canteen business. She intends to use the extra profits to construct her own premises for business. Perusi has a beauty salon and wans to use the loan to buy a hair dryer. Afuwa sells maize and ants for a living. Racheal offers catering services and wants to use the loan to buy more utensils. Ruth wants to increase stock in her canteen.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in the current business and add in stock, to buy a hair dryer, to increase farm products, to buy more utensils for a catering business, to increase stock in a canteen

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: K. Lola lives in the Nausky region and is married with 3 children. Mrs.K. became a client of MicroInvest in 2006 after hearing so many success stories from friends that began businesses on MicroInvest loans.  The business stability and increased income helped her to make timely payments on her previous loans. Mrs. K. Lola is sells children and adolescent clothing. She has a wide assortment that she purchases from suppliers at a good price. It permits her to sell the goods at prices that are lower than the bazaar prices. Now Mrs. K. Lola requests a loan of 2100 STJ for the purchase of new goods.

loans.use: New good purchases

loans.name: Januário

texts.pt:
Januário M., resident of the Polana Caniço district, Mozambique ID card # 110312801V, has 6 children. A worker at the Universidade Tecnica de Moçambique, he entered into the program on May 23, 2007, borrowing 6000 MT. He is now in his second round, and would like another 6000 MT to purchase various goods. He will repay the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer

Januário M., Residente no bairro da Polana Caniço portador do BI nº 110312801V tem 6 filhos trabalhador da Universidade Tecnica de Moçambique entrou no programa a 23/05/07 tomando o valor de 6000 esta agora no 2º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 6000 novamente para comprar alguns Bens e vai pagar em 6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en: A. Mukarram lives in the Nausky region and  is married with 3 children. Mrs. Ataevahas has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004 and is recommended as a reliable client. The stability of her business and increase in income has helped her to make timely payments on her prior loans. She started the business from scratch and through time she opened her own shop that sells children's clothing. She is very polite and the prices of her goods are lower than the bazaar prices which is why she has loyal repeat clients. Mrs. A. requests a loan of 4100 STJ for the existing business development and to purchase new goods.

loans.use: Existing business development and purchasing new goods

loans.name: Kamuli B4(I) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year. Clementine is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a poultry business. She wants to use the extra business profits to complete her rental houses and also fence her residential house. Hasifa, Slvia and Annet all have beauty salon businesses. Josephine sells used clothes and wants to use the loan to purchase more clothes for sale. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks. and use the profits to complete rental houses, to improve 3 beauty salon businesses and to purchase more used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru:
Hakim H. is 53 years old and has 4 children. His oldest daughter is getting married. According to our traditions, it is customary to give a gift of furniture and appliances for the house to the newlyweds. This is why Hakim decided to purchase a bedroom set for credit. Hakim works as head specialist in the local administration of Khujand city. His salary is insufficient in order to purchase the furniture for cash. This is why he decided to come to the microcredit organization MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Хомидов Хаким, возрост 53 года имеет 4 детей. Старшую дочь хочет выдать замуж, но по нашим обычааям принято дарить в подарок для молодожен мебель или необходимую технику для дома. Поэтому Хаким решил купить в кредит спальный гарнитур.Хаким работает главным специалистомв хукумате г. Худжанда. Средний заработок у него не достаточен для покупки мебели за наличные. И он решил обратится к нам в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Furniture purchase

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
I am Rehana S.. I live in a brick house with my family in Multan, a mid size city in Pakistan. I sell embroidered clothes in various nearby cities with my mother. I need to expand my business and thereby, produce more clothes. I need a loan for this purpose.   
My group members are, Ameeran B., Haseena B., and Mussarat B. all of these women sell cloth. Faiz E. is a widow and needs a loan for their fruits shop. I help them so that their families can prosper and they do not have to depend any more on some one for money.

loans.use: Expand embroidered clothes business

loans.name: Kamuli B4 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been toegether for one year. Justine is 30 years old and married with three chiildren. She sells used clothes. With the extra business profits, she intends to open up a boutique.Betty and Robinah have bar businesses. Rehema owns a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy more salon equipment. Margret wants to use the loan to purchase more charcoal for sale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, to improve 2 bar businesses, to buy more beauty salon equipment and to buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru:
Sirojiddin N. has 4 children and works as a master in a auto repairs shop. His oldest child is a 19 year old son. He used to work with his father in the shop, but now, after having learned a new profession, his son decided to travel to Russia in order to make money. Since tickets to Russia are very expensive, Sirojiddin decided to buy the ticket for his son. This is why he came to microcredit organization MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Sirojiddin N. has 4 children and works as a master in a auto repairs shop. His oldest child is a 19 year old son. He usedto work with his father in the shop, but now, after having learned a new profession, his son decided to travel to Russia in order to make money. Since tickets to Russia are very expensive, Sirojiddin decided to buy the ticket for his son. This is why he came to microcredit organization MicroInvest. Сироджиддин Норматов имеет 4 детей, работаетмастером в цехе по ремонту автомашин. Старший ребенок у него сын которому 19 лет. Он раньше работал с отцом в цехе и теперь научившись полнлстью работе кузовщика его сын решил поехать в Россиюна заработки.Но т.к билеты сейчас очень дорогие ,то Сироджиддин решил купить билет для сына в кредит. Поэтому обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Purchase a plane ticket

loans.name: Normatov

texts.ru: Сироджиддин Норматов имеет 4 детей,работаетмастером в цехе по ремонту автомашин.Старший ребенок у него сын которому 19 лет .Он раньше работал с отцом в цехе и теперь научившись полнлстью работе кузовщика его сын решил поехать в Россиюна заработки.Но т.к билеты сейчас очень дорогие ,то Сироджиддин решил купить билет для сына в кредит.Поэтому обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Приобретение авиабилета

loans.name: Umaraly

texts.ru:
Umaraly Ishankullv was born in 1982, he is single and has completed high school. During the past two years, he has been selling fabrics. He sells them in a market place called "Korvon" that is located in Dushanbe, Tajikistan.

Umaraly found out about microcredit organization "MicroInvest" from a credit expert, and he registered with our organization on July 6, 2007. He successfully paid off his first loan, which helped him expand his assortment of fabrics and receive a good profit.

When he heard about Kiva's microcredit program, he decided to participate in order to receive a loan to purchase more fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Умарали Ишанкулов 1982 года рождения, не семейный, образование среднее. Занимается продажей тканей на протяжении 2 лет. Он торгует на рынке "Корвон"в городе Душанбе, Таджикистан. О Микроинвесте услышал от кредитного эксперта и зарегистрировался в нашей организации 07.06.2007году. Успешно погасил свой первый займ который помог ему расширить ассортимент тканей и получить хорошую прибыль. Услышав о программе Кива захотел участвовать с целью получения паралельного займа на покупку 2-х рулонов велюра,1-го рулона шерстянных тканей новинок и 4-х рулонов рисунчатых тканей.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
I am Rehana S.. I live in a brick house with my family in Multan, a mid size city in Pakistan. I sell embroidered clothes in various nearby cities with my mother. I need to expand my business and thereby, produce more clothes. I need a loan for this purpose.   
My group members are, Ameeran B. and Mussarat B. both of these women sell cloth. Faiz E. is a widow and needs a loan for their fruits shop. I help them so that their families can prosper and they do not have to depend any more on some one for money.

loans.use: Expand embroidered clothes business

loans.name: Kamuli B4(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been togehter for one year. Sarah is 27 years old and married with two children. She has a salon business.She wants to pay school fees for the children with the extra profits. Barbara sells used clothes and wants to add in stock with the loan. Night has a poultry business and wants to construct more poultry houses with the loan. Margret has a canteen business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer, to add stock of used clothes, to construct more poultry houses and expand a canteen business.

loans.name: Pathani's Group

texts.en: I am Pathani M.. I have five children, two of whom are married. I am a textile designer, and I create embroidered clothes. I started this business three years ago. My profit ratio is high; for every ten dresses that I create, I earn $150. There are four other members in my loan group: Rubina B. will invest the loan in her clothing business. Mussarat B. needs this loan for the family's electrical appliances shop. Sughran B. and Susi K. require these loans for their embroidery businesses.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: Kasokoso Group

texts.en:
Hildah is a 38 year old widow with five children. Hildah, Aisha and Annet all have brick laying businesses. Hildah wants to pay school fees for the orphans with the extra business profits.Mollaw sells raw foodstuffs in the market and wants to use the loan to purchase more foods for sale. Margret sells used shoes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their businesses

loans.name: Imtiaz's Group

texts.en: I am Imtiaz A. D.. I live in a brick house in Multan, Pakistan, with husband and son, who is 12 years old. My son attends school and is in grade three. I embroider clothes and want to expand this business. I have a flair for this work, and I feel I can do well. With the profits I plan to remodel my house .I have few friends who are my neighbors, and we would like to borrow as a group. We are responsible for each other's loans. Hajran B., Sakina B., and Shakila B. need loans for their furniture business. Shamim B. needs this loan to buy a rickshaw. These are very hard-working entrepreneurs and need loans to improve their businesses.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: Karima

texts.ru:
Karima is Muslim, she was born in 1978 and she is married with 2 children. Her husband imports goods from Kyrgyzstan and she sells them together with her mother-in-law at the Korvon market in Dushanbe, capital of Tadjikistan. She deals in women's clothes: hijabs (covered women's garment - long sleeves, long skirt and a matching scarf which will cover everything but the eyes), knitted jackets and leather jackets. She has had a pretty stable business for the last 4 years. She attends to her customer's requests quickly and helps them choose their garments. She also has time to read her prayers five times a days and believes that the success of her business depends on the mercy of the Allah. She is requesting a loan from Kiva for the purpose of purchasing warm clothes for February.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Карима-мусульманка, 1978 года рождения,замужем имеет 2 детей.Муж привозит товары из Киргизии и она продает их вместе со свекровью на рынке "Корвон ",Душанбе,Таджикистан.Она торгует женской одеждой:Хиджабы(закрытая женская одежда-длинные рукава,длиный подол платья и имеет в комплекте платок скрывающийвсю голову и лицо кроме глаз),кофты и кожанные куртки-френч. Она имеет достаточно стабильный бизнес, налаженный ею в течении 4 лет.Она быстро обслуживает и так же помогает выбирать одежду своим клиенткам.Она так же успевает читать молитву 5 раз в день и считает, что успех её бизнеса зависит от милости бога. В данный момент она нуждается в финансированнии для закупки очередного товара на февраль месяц.

loans.use: Buying the warm assortment of women clothes.

loans.name: Kasokoso A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Florence, Suzan and Robinah all have brick laying businesses. Florence inends to invest in a poultry business with the extra profits. Maria sells raw foods in the market and wants to use the loan to add in stock. Agnes runs a bar business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their businesses

loans.name: Pili's Mohemo Group

texts.en:
Pili, age 33, is married with 3 children (ages 6, 8, and 11). She owns a small grocery store which she opened in 2006. She works there from 5am to 6pm daily and now makes a monthly profit of about $70 from this business.

In the past, Pili received a loan to increase her inventory for her shop. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose to once again increase her business. She will share this loan with Mwajuma, another member in their loan group. Mwajuma is a food vendor in the same neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her small grocery store

loans.name: Mamat

texts.en: Mamat F.  lives in Nausky region, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children. Mr.F. has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2006.  Mr. F. is engaged in the home business of raising a selling livestock and its byproducts (livestock raising and selling, milk production and other works). It is a family business. Mr.F. is also engaged  in  building works (he works as the master of the finishing works). He has been engaged in this business for 20 years. Mr. F. has a large flock and now he requests the loan of 2100 STJ to purchase  mixed fodder.

loans.use: For the purchase of mixed fodder.

loans.name: Kasokoso A(Iii) Group

texts.en: Aisha, Christine and Claire all have brick laying businesses. Aisha is 48 years old and divorced with seven children. Norah runs a canteen and wants to use the loan to purchase more products. With the extra business profits, Aisha wants to pay school fees for the children. p>This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Hurmatvi

texts.ru:
Hurmatvi was born in 1969, she is married and has 4 children. Three of the kids are girls who, together with Hurmatvi, sew izori, a type of pants made out of warm fabrics and worn as part of the national costume. Hurmatvi then sells the izori at the Korvon market in Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. During her own childhood, Hurmatvi had helped her grandmother to make national Tajik clothes. Nowdays, since her own family was forced to find additional income as there is not enough money for family needs, Hurmatvi taught her daughters this craft and now they all sew izori for sale. Hurmatvi has many loyal customers who she was able to attract because of the quality of her sewing and the sturdiness of the seams. She sells about 10-20 izori daily and her garments cost much less then imported clothes.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Хурматви 1969 года рождения,замужем имеет 4 детей.Из них 3 девочек которые шьют из теплых тканей национальные штаны с матерью.Мать реализует их на торгвой точке расположенной на рынке Корвон,Душанбе,Таджикистан.Хурматви с детства помогала бабушке шить изоры-нац.штаны.Сегодня когда жизнь вынудила искать работу из-за нехватки денег на семейные нужды,Хурматви обучила своих девочек этому ремеслу и теперь они все занимаются пошивом изоров-штанов.На сегодня Хурматви смогла привлечь многих клиентов качеством пошива и прочностью швов.Она ежедневно продает по 10-20 изоров и её изделия стоят на много дешевле импортных изделий.

loans.use: Buying velur-fabric for future sewing clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kasokoso A(Iv) Group

texts.en:
Dissy is 38 years old and divorced with two children.Esther and Joy have retail shop businesses and intend to use the loan to add in stock. Afuwa has a canteen business while Dissy has a bar.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Balbina's Temeke Group

texts.en:
Balbina, age 49, is married with 4 children (ages 13, 15, 17, and 28). She is a local food vendor and sells various types of dishes and snacks from 7am to 5pm daily. She started this business 2 years ago and now makes a monthly profit of about $135 from her work.

Balbina received a previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to increase her food sales. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in general items and food sales.

loans.use: To buy food items for vending

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Gulchehra is a mature woman with ten years of work experience in this area. She is married and has 3 children. She sells at the Korvon market in Dushanbe, capital of Tadjikistan. Her store is located by the entrance to the market, which is a lucrative spot, since clients see her wares first. Gulchehra does her best to have a lot of variety in the goods she offers and is always friendly with her customers. She has registered with us on 06/07/2007 and has been a good customer. Currently she is borrowing money in order to finance a wholesale purchase of a new shipment of scarves made from warmer, heavier fabrics for the winter months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Гулчехра, достаточно взрослая женщина с 10 летним стажем работы в этой области.Она замужем и имеет 3 детей.Торгует она на рынке Корвон, в городе Душанбе,Таджикистан.Её торговоя точка расположена при входе на рынок и является очень прибыльной, так как клиенты просматривают её лавку первой.Гулчехра старается всегда иметь разнообразный ассортимент и всегда приветливо обслуживает клиентов.У нас она зарегистрировалась 07.06.2007 и успешно кредитуется в настояшее время.Сейчас она нуждается в финансировании для покупки нового ассортимента платков из более теплых тканей и более плотной вязки.

loans.use: Purchase of a new shipment of wool scarves

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat T. lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs.T. is engaged in the business of selling national dresses in the flea bazaar. The stable business income helped her to open her own trade outlet. Additionally she works as a secretary. Mrs.T. works with the direct suppliers of the material which is the reason her prices for her dresses are lower than the bazaar prices. She has repeat customers and bulk buyers. Mrs.T. requests a loan of 2700 STJ for the purchase of new material lots.

loans.use: For the purchase of new material lots.

loans.name: Mwantumu's Ngeta B Group

texts.en:
Mwantumu, age 35, is married with 2 children (9 and 4). She and her husband also take care of 2 other relatives. Mwantumu owns a small farm which she has had for 5 years now. She works there from 8am to 4pm daily and makes a monthly profit of about $135 from her crop sales.

In the past, she and her subgroup have received a loan and were able to repay it successfully. They now hope for a new loan to help their businesses. Zubeda and Mwamvita sell clothes for a living.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Kasokoso A(V) Group

texts.en:
Joanita, Judith, Florence and Annet all have brick laying businesses. Joanita is 42 years old and married with six children.Sharifu has a retail shop and wants to use the loan to purchase more stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, age 29, is married with an 8 year old. She owns a fish selling business, which she started 1 and a half years ago. She works there from 7am to 6pm daily selling fish and now makes a monthly profit of about $80 from her work.

In the past, Rose took out a successful loan which increased her sales. She now hopes to do this again. She is in a loan group called Tuwuane, whose members ensure one another is paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Shukrullo

texts.ru:
Shukrullo has been selling women's handbags for the last 10 years. He is married and has 4 children. His store is located at the Korvon market in Dushanbe, capital of Tadjikistan. To the question as to why he chose to sell this type of goods he responded that he likes to come up with designs for handbags. He has a creative soul and enjoys picking out his wares on his trips to China to restock. In the future he is hoping to open a handbag making workshop and for this purpose he is having his son study at the university as a leather goods designer. Currently the goods turnaround at his store is very fast and he is saving up money for the workshop for his son. He would like to use the loan from Kiva in order to buy additional shipments of handbags to expand his selection.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Шукрулло давно занимается продажей женских сумочек(10 лет).Он женат и имеет 4 детей.Его торговая точка расположена на рынке Корвон в Душанбе,Таджикистан.На вопрос, почему он выбрал этот ассортимент товара, он ответил, что сам очень любит придумывать дизайн для женских сумок.По натуре он творческая личность и он с удовольствием сам привозит товар, выбирая ассортимент, с Китая.В будушем он мечтает открыть цех по производству дамских сумок, с этой целью он обучает своег сына в Университете на дизайнера кожных изделий. В данный момент он имеет хороший оборот товара и копит деньги на будуший цех для сына.С Кивы он хочет получить займ на покупку нового ассортимента сумок.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kigandazi A Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Irene runs a small restaurant. Jane sells used clothes wants to increase the stock with the loan. Annet has a canteen business. Prossy sells fish while Rose has a public pay phone.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their current businesses

loans.name: Fatuma's Kota Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 51, is a widow taking care of two children, ages 6 and 8. She has a business of selling charcoal which she started a year ago. She works from 6am to 6pm daily and now makes a monthly profit of about $18 from her sales.

Fatuma was able to start this charcoal business with a loan from BRAC Tanzania. She now hopes for another loan to increase her charcoal sales. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in clothes, books, and fabric sales.

loans.use: To buy charcoal stock

loans.name: Davlatbeck

texts.en: Davlatbeck K.  lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2006 when he applied to MicroInvest for a business development loan. The loan has helped him to improve his business situation markedly. Mr.K. is engaged in the home business of the raising and selling livestock. In addition, he  bakes and sells  “lepeshky” (the national bread). It is the family business that brings the general family income. Now Mr.K. requests the loan of 1700 STJ for the purchase of mixed fodder for his livestock.

loans.use: For the purchase of mixed fodder

loans.name: Shani's Mango Group

texts.en:
Shani, age 35, is single and started a food selling business in 2006. She works from 5am to 6pm daily and now makes a profit of about $55 a month from her food sales.

In the past, Shani successfully took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more food items in order to increase her sales. She hopes for a new loan for the same purpose and will share it with Zuhura who is also a food vendor in the same neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy stock of general items

loans.name: Olida's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Olida, age 34, is single and runs a small timber business. She started this work in 2004 and now makes a monthly profit of about $73 from the sales. Her day consists of selling timber from 6am to 8pm.

In the past, Olida successfully took out a loan to buy more timber. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who also have timber businesses in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy more timber stock

loans.name: Kigandazi B Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Rehema and Restay have brick laying businesses. Dessy sells fish and wants to use the loan to buy a fridge.Louinsa has a retail shop and wants to add in more stock. Keremiisa sells matooke(raw food) in the market. With the extra business profits, Rehema wants to start baking cakes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their current businesses

loans.name: Kapemba's Ngura Moja Group

texts.en:
Kapemba, age 37, is married with 2 children (ages 7 and 12). She owns a beauty salon which she started in 2007. She works there as a hairdresser from 7am to 9pm daily and her services bring her a profit of about $60 each month.

In the past, Kapemba took out a loan to buy more necessities for her salon. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses in fish and general items sales.

loans.use: To expand salon's services

loans.name: Kigandazi C Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Rose and Dorah have hardware businesses. Annet runs a bar. Winfred has a canteen business while Deborah has a retail shop. With the extra business profits, Rose intends to construct a house for her grandmother.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en: Abdullo K. lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children.  Abdullo K. has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2004. He joined MicroInvest after hearing so many successful stories from friends who began their businesses with MicroInvest loans. He is engaged in the home business of raising and selling livestock. He has been in business for 5 years. He has a large flock and he dreams of purchasing one more pedigree bull. Mr. Abdullo K.  requests a loan of 4100 STJ for the pedigree bull purchase.

loans.use: For the purchase of a pedigree bull

loans.name: Kigandazi D Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Aisha is 25 years old and married with one child. She runs a drug store. Kizza sells raw foods to earn a living. Harriet sells fruits and vegetables. Joyce has a brick laying business while Sauda has a retail shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock and expand their businesses.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Zulfiya has her own store at the Korvon market which sells women's accessories: hair clips, scrunchies, wigs and other small items. She has been renting out this space for the last 5 years with the help of her husband. Currently her husband imports the goods that she sells from China. This is their family business and her 5 children help her out in the store. She tells that this type of goods is very popular and on an average days she has at least 10-15 clients. Her store is famous in the market.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Зульфия имеет свой магазин в торговых рядах рынка Корвон.Это магазин галантереи: заколки, резинки,парики и прочии мелкие товары.Она арендовала свой магазин 5 лет назад и в этом ей помог муж.В данный период её муж является её поставщиком товаров из Китая.Это их семейный бизнес и 5 её детей так же помагают ей торговать в магазине.Она говорит, что этот вид продукции очень ходовой и в день она обслуживает 10-15 клиентов.Её лавка является одной из известных в этой местности.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kigandazi E Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Betty is 37 years old and divorced with four children. Her current business is selling fish. Betty wants to buy a piece of land with the extra business profits. Damalie lays bricks for a living. Cathy has a canteen business and wants to use the loan to add to her stock. Annet sells charcoal and wants to expand her business while J. J. has a retail shop and intends to increase the stock of goods in it.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista, age 37, is married and lives with her husband. She owns a clothing business, which she started in 2006. From her sales, she makes a monthly profit of about $80. She works selling the clothes from 5am to 8pm daily.

In the past, Teopista took out a successful loan which she used to buy more clothing stock. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She belongs to a loan group called Tujitume.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Kigandazi F Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Irene has a beauty salon. Janet is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to buy a water tank. Agnes and Maria both sell used clothes while Margret has a canteen business.Irene wants to open up a retail shop with the extra business profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Saro

texts.en: Saro D. lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. Saro D.  became a client of  MicroInvest in 2006 when she was in a difficult situation and applied for her first loan. She started the business practically from scratch. Now she is engaged in selling grits (buckwheat, rice, pea, green gram, etc) and has her own outlet in the food bazaar. Additionally she is a school teacher. She is experienced in business for 10 years. Mrs.D. now requests a loan of 3200 STJ for the purchase of new goods.

loans.use: For the purchase of new goods.

loans.name: Kireku A Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for six months.Florence is a tailor. Firida and Ruth both have restaurant businesses. Phoebe sells used clothes and wants to use the loan to purchase additional stock. Zaituni sells charcoal. With the extra business profits, Florence wants to start a tailoring school.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Petnonela's Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Petnonela, age 35, is a widow and takes care of her 3 children (ages 10, 8, and 4). She owns a shop, where she sells general items. She started this business in 2006 and now makes a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales. She works from 6am to 7pm daily.

Petnonela took out a previous loan to buy items for her shop. She now hopes to do this again. She will share the loan with Suwa, a member in her loan group, who has a charcoal store.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Kireku B Group

texts.en:
Jane is 42 years old and married with six children. She owns a retail shop and wants to use the extra profits to buy a fridge. Esther and Mastula sell charcoal and want to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Racheal's current business is selling used clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock and expand their businesses.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old and is married with 2 children (ages 22 and 19). She owns a shop where she sells general items. She began this business in 2003 and works there from 6am to 7pm daily. In a month, the shop brings her about $170 in profit.

Jane has taken a loan in the past to buy more stock for her shop. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She is a member of a loan group called Tujiheshimu.

loans.use: To buy items for shop

loans.name: Kireku C Group
