texts.en: This group has been together for six months. Rose is 43 years old and married with six children. She is a poultry farmer and wants to use the extra business profits to buy a piece of land. Regina and Aisha have canteens and intend to use the loan to re-invest and expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 33, married, and has 2 children (ages 7 and 3). She sells cosmetics to earn a monthly income of about $35. She started this business in 2006 and works daily from 6am to 7pm.

In the past, Sarah took out a loan to increase her stock. She now hopes for a new loan to buy more cosmetics once again. She is a member of a loan group called Baraka ("blessing" in Swahili).

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics inventory

loans.name: Mohammad Yasin

texts.en: Mohammad Yasin lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of 4 children. He is an educated man but he also has 10 years' work experience in agriculture. He has lots of land to cultivate so he is requesting an individual loan to buy things he cannot otherwise afford such as fertilizer and seeds to expand his business. He needs to do this to support his family and enroll his children in a better school. He is happy that he can continue his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children (ages 16, 12, 10, and 5). She owns a shop where she sells general items. She started this business in 2005 and now makes a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales. She works from 7am to 6pm daily.

In the past, Lydia took a loan to buy more inventory for her shop. She now hopes to do the same thing. She is a member of a loan group called Twiga (Swahili for "giraffe").

loans.use: To buy shop inventory

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en: I am from Multan, a medium-sized city famous in Pakistan for its shrines. I live in a two-room brick house with my family. My son manufactures cloth on power looms. He started this business six months ago. Now, we'd like a loan to improve and expand our business. Haneefa B. wants to buy a loom. Maqsooda B. creates embroidered cloth. We would like to borrow in a group, and we are mutually responsible for each other's loans. If one cannot repay, the others will make up the difference.

loans.use: Expand our cloth manufacturing business

loans.name: Kireku D Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for six monhs. Resty is 32 years and divorced with four children. Resty and Aidah both sell used clothes. Resty wants to use the extra business profits to buy a piece of land. Flavia has a salon business. Jesca offers tailoring services while Mariam has a soda depot.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their businesses

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 49 and lives in Lugazi Town. He is hard working and a member in good standing of a lending group called Kavule Effort. He is married and has seven children and takes care of two others. For the last 16 years, Charles has run a retail shop where he sells mainly household items such as sugar, ground nuts, soap, salt, maize, and millet flour. The best selling item is ground nuts, which are a delicacy to the Basoga people, who constitute the majority in the area. 
In addition to operating a retail shop, he raises hybrid cows and sells their milk in neighboring villages. His daily sales usually total $100. Using his proifts, he has been able to buy a plot in Lugazi town which he intends to develop in the near future. He plans to build rental rooms to earn some income in his old age.

loans.use: Charles plans to buy three hybrid cows.

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en: My name is Fozia I.. I have a one-year-old. I live with my son and partner in Multan, Pakistan. I create embroidered dresses, and my husband sells fruit. He has been in that business for three years. My husband wants to expand his business so that he can increase his sales, and we're asking for a loan for this purpose. I dream of owning a house. Along with the women in my loan group, I have learned to save and to be responsible and punctual. We have also learned valuable social skills that can help all of us in our lives, such as how to collaborate and help each other. These women would use the loan for the following businesses: Zarina B. and Nasreen B. will invest in their shoe business. Tahira B. would use it for the family's fruit business. Najma B. will use this loan to expand her stitching and embroidery business.

loans.use: To buy fruit for resale

loans.name: Kireku E Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Florence has a clothes selling business. With the extra business profits, Florence intends to buy a piece of land. Fatumah and Mastula sell charcoal. Rose runs a canteen while Safina offers catering services.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock and expand their businesses.

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en: I am Nagina R. from Multan, a historical city in Pakistan. I own a three-room brick house. I have three children: one boy and two girls. My husband is a day laborer, and I make embroidered outfits. I require a loan to improve my business. The others in my loan group are Naseem A., who will use the loan  for the family's tailoring business, and Zakia B., who will invest in her husband’s fruit business.

loans.use: Expand embrodiery business

loans.name: Bibie's Changamto Group

texts.en:
Bibie, age 36, is married and lives with her husband. She started a business in 2005 - a shop where she sells general items. She works from 7am to 6pm at the shop and now makes a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Bibie took out a loan to increase her inventory. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with Pili, a member in her loan group. Pili also owns a shop in the same locality.

loans.use: To buy shop inventory

loans.name: Kireku F Group

texts.en:
Racheal is 28 years old and divorced with five cildren. She has a canteen busines. She wants to construct her own business premises with the extra business profits. Shamim has a brick-laying business while Josephine sells raw food in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Salma's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Salma, age 35, is married with 2 children (ages 14 and 17). She owns a cafe where she sells tea and snacks, which she started in 2005. She now works from 6am to 8pm daily and can make a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Salma took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more food items to expand her business. She now hopes for a new loan and will share this with her subgroup. Sisemi and Salma, her subgroup members, have shop and fish businesses.

loans.use: To buy food items for cafe

loans.name: Nassif

texts.en: Nassif is a 38 year old man who lives and works in the south of Lebanon, in the region of Tyre. Nassif provides for his wife and 2 children working as a car mechanic. He needs to generate revenue in order to perform maintenance on his house against rain damage. He therefore needs a loan in order to purchase more material for his business in order to enhance his productivity and his income.

loans.use: To purchase material

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: R. Mavluda lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. R. Mavluda became a client of  MicroInvest in 2003 after hearing many successful stories from friends who started their own businesses with loans from MicroInvest.  She is engaged in selling grits (buckwheat, rice, pea, green gram etc) and has her own outlet in the food bazaar. Now Mrs. R. Mavluda requests a loan of 1500 STJ for the purchase of new goods.

loans.use: For the purchase of new goods

loans.name: Filberta

texts.en:
Filberta, age 28, is married with a 6-year-old. She owns a tailoring business, which she started in 2005. She works from 6am to 7pm daily and makes a monthly profit of about $50.

In the past, she successfully took out a loan to expand her services. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She is a member of a loan group called Ushirika.

loans.use: To expand tailoring services

loans.name: Kiganda A Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for five months. Betty, Jane, Aisha and Mwajuma all sell raw foods in the market and want to use the loan to purchase more food to sell. Yudaya sells fruits and vegetables.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad owns a grocery store in the south of Lebanon, in the region of Tyre. Mohamad is married and has 2 children. He needs a loan to buy new merchandise for his business. Mohamad works with his wife and his grocery provides food to the surrounding inhabitants of the area.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Tina's Mafamikio Group

texts.en:
Tina, age 42, is married with 3 children (ages 25, 20, and 18). She has a farming business where she raises chickens and cows. She started this business in 2002 and now makes a monthly profit of about $140 from her work. She works from 6am to 9pm daily maintaining her small farm.

Tina took out a previous loan to expand her farm and was able to pay it back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup who have businesses in timber and general items sales.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 38 year old married man. He lives and works in south Lebanon, in the region of Tyre. Hani owns a bakery where he makes what is called a 'mankouche',  a kind of bread on which you put thyme, or cheese etc. Hani works with his wife and needs a loan to buy flour for his business.

loans.use: To buy flour
